Title: Delhi HC's adjournment of hate speech case unjustified: Supreme Court
Content:
SG criticises ‘rushed’ hearing in HC

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Wednesday asked the Delhi high court to fast-track hearing on PILs seeking registration of FIRs against BJP functionaries Kapil Mishra , Anurag Thakur and Parvesh Verma for making allegedly inflammatory speeches, including “desh ke gaddaron ko...” slogans, which petitioners say went viral and caused riots in Delhi.Transferring a petition filed by riot victims led by Aurangabad-based Shaikh Mujtaba Farooq for hearing to the Delhi HC, with a request to hear it on Friday along with pending petitions adjourned to April 13, a bench of CJI S A Bobde and Justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant said, “We think adjournment for a long period was unjustified. But, at the same time, adhering to judicial discipline, we will not assume jurisdiction over the matter when the HC is already dealing with it.” It said, “Delhi HC is requested to dispose of the matters as expeditiously as possible on their own merits and in accordance with law. The HC may also explore the possibility of peaceful resolution of the subject dispute.” The riots claimed 47 lives. The order came after a 45-minute hearing before the bench that was keenly watched by lawyers from both sides.Solicitor general Tushar Mehta, appearing for Delhi Police and Delhi government, criticised the rushed hearing before Delhi high court last month before a bench headed by Justice S Muralidhar , prior to his transfer to Punjab and Haryana high court. Later, a bench headed by Chief Justice D N Patel adjourned hearing to April 13.“We told the court that we have to go through 7,000 videos and over 1,000 speeches, which were inflammatory. We also told them that the situation is not conducive for registration of an FIR as we are trying to restore law and order and under the prevailing circumstances, we defer registration of FIRs against those who made inflammatory speeches,” the SG said.CJI Bobde asked, “Is the situation conducive today? Will you register the FIRs now?” This evoked laughter from a section of lawyers. An annoyed CJI said, “We will stop the hearing. It is a courtroom and not a meeting ground.” The SG replied, “There are inflammatory speeches from both sides. What the petitioners have done is to selectively cite certain speeches. If we had started registering FIRs against leaders of the community without bringing the law and order situation under control, it would have flared up.”Appearing for petitioners, senior advocate Colin Gonsalves said, “If they had arrested those who made inflammatory speeches that went viral leading to riots, the carnage in Delhi could have been stopped.” CJI Bobde said, “We have some experience of riots. Your (Gonsalves’s) statement is not always true. Speaking generally and without referring to the Delhi riots, we know from experience that sometimes when police arrests leaders, riots flare up. What happened in Mumbai riots? A few shakha pramukhs (Shiv Sena functionaries) were arrested and the riots flared up.”Gonsalves said, “When leaders stand next to police and say police are with them and they go scot free because of their proximity to the ruling party, situations flare up.” The CJI said, “These allegations can be established only after a thorough inquiry. What is the urgency today? As you admit, the objectionable slogans (desh ke gaddaron ko...) were first made on January 21, why didn’t you lodge an FIR then?”Gonsalves replied, “We didn’t think the slogan would go viral and cause riots. We thought it to be a political stunt. But we were demoralised by the HC adjourning the hearing to April 13. The high court took the same approach in police lathi charge on Jamia students. The court heard the case on December 19 and then adjourned it to February 2.”The SG said, “I was more than demoralised by the manner in which the high court conducted the hearing. I faced constant heckling by a section of lawyers present in the court during the hearing... We have registered 468 FIRs. And those who incited riots will also be brought to book.”

Title: Study flags reasons for women's dormant bank accounts
Content:
NEW DELHI: Lack of capacity to operate their accounts, no regular cash flow and unease in dealing with male banking agents are some of the main reasons why a whopping 42% of bank accounts owned by women were found to be dormant, according to a research report prepared for Niti Aayog has found.

The research report by MicroSave Consulting was released on Wednesday. Quoting the global Findex report of 2017, the consulting firm said that nearly 65% Indian women either don’t have a bank account or have not transacted any business for over a year after opening them.

The research through detailed interviews was carried out to find the exact reason why nearly 23% didn’t or couldn’t open accounts despite the government’s big push under the flagship Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana and also why women were not using the accounts frequently.

The report has also highlighted how the share of women having accounts increased from barely 43% in 2014 to 77% in 2017 and the gender gap in financial inclusion reduced to only 14% within these four years.

It said in neighbouring countries like Bangladesh and Pakistan , the share of women having bank accounts was just 36% and 7% respectively.

MSC group managing director Graham A N Wright said that there is need to understand the complex gender issues that often limit the use of these accounts. “The banks and their agents need to devise new approach such as selling a package or new idea such as regular saving for daughter’s marriage or education rather than selling the proposal for recurring deposits. Engaging more women agents will also have greater positive impact on women to open and operate accounts,” he told TOI.

Title: Cryptocurrency News: SC quashes RBI order, paves way for cryptocurrency trade
Content:
‘Daily trade in Indian crypto market averaged 150 crore in 2018’

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Wednesday quashed RBI’s 2018 circular preventing banking and financial institutions from providing services to any individual or business entities dealing in cryptocurrency or virtual currency, saying it was a disproportionate measure taken by the regulator.The verdict would allow companies in the sector to use the banking platform to trade and transact in cryptocurrency. The central bank had contended that allowing cryptocurrency (bitcoins) compromised the integrity of the banking system.A bench of Justices R F Nariman, Aniruddha Bose and V Ramasubramanian said while RBI had a special role in the economy and was empowered to take such decisions, it must pass the proportionality test in order to be valid. It said there was no evidence banking and financial sectors suffered any damage due to trading in and circulation of virtual currency. The SC noted prohibition of involvement of banking channels had crippled trade and exchange in virtual currency though there had been no ban as such on cryptocurrency.“I will have to go through the apex court order and then will probably meet you all to see what we want to do or how we look at the judgement,” finance minsiter Nirmala Sitharaman said.When the consistent stand of RBI is that they have not banned virtual currencies and when the Government of India is unable to take a call despite several committees coming up with several proposals including two draft bills, both of which advocated exactly opposite positions, it is not possible for us to hold that the impugned measure is proportionate,” said Justice Ramasubramanian while writing the 180-page verdict.“The position as on date is that VCs are not banned, but the trading in VCs and functioning of VC exchanges are sent to comatose by the impugned circular by disconnecting their lifeline namely, interface with the regular banking sector. What is worse is that this has been done (i) despite RBI not finding anything wrong about the way in which these exchanges function and (ii) despite the fact that VCs are not banned,” the judgement said.The crypto asset industry is estimated to have a market capitalisation of approximately $430 billion globally. India is estimated to contribute between 2-10% based on varied estimates. As per the petitioners who challenged RBI’s circular, the total number of investors in Indian crypto market was approximately 20 lakh and the daily trade volume averaged Rs 150 crore in 2018.The bench, however, said RBI has the power to put in place mechanism to regulate the VC sector and rejected the contention that the regulator’s role and power can come into play only if something has actually acquired the status of a legal tender.

Title: Jet ex-promoter Naresh Goyal detained by ED, booked for laundering
Content:
Jet founder Naresh Goyal (File photo)

MUMBAI: The Enforcement Directorate detained Jet Airways founder Naresh Goyal after long hours of questioning at its Ballard Estate office on Wednesday. Sources said the ED, which took him home in its car, was searching his SoBo house at the time of going to press. It has filed a money laundering case against him.

The agency has been probing Jet and Goyal under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (Fema) and was considering filing a money laundering case. The ED, which is probing Jet’s financial deals of the last 12 years, has quizzed Goyal over a dozen times in the Fema case. It has also questioned his wife and son a couple of times. It is looking into suspicious transactions involving 19 privately held firms —14 registered in India and five abroad—associated with Goyal.

‘Naresh Goyal allegedly linked to firms in tax havens’

According to sources, Jet Airways founder Naresh Goyal also allegedly indirectly controls other companies in tax havens. The grounded airline had allegedly diverted most of the Rs 8,000-crore loan secured from banks abroad by inflating payments and through fictitious transactions, officials said. Jet’s lenders, led by SBI, have initiated bankruptcy proceedings agai- nst the airline with the National Company Law Tribunal.

Recently, Mumbai police had registered a fraud case against Goyal on a complaint filed by a travel agency.



In Video: Jet ex-promoter Naresh Goyal detained by Enforcement Directorate, booked for laundering

Title: Alia Bhatt, Kiara Advani, Vaani Kapoor and other Bollywood actors come under one roof for THIS; view pictures
Content: Tiger Shroff, who is one of the most loved actors in Bollywood, has taken to social media by storm with his debut single ‘Unbelievable’. He has now taken to his Instagram handle to thank his fans as his song is placed in the 2nd position on the Billboard global charts.

Title: China’s created aura of military might without combat: Army chief
Content:
Army chief General MM Naravane

NEW DELHI: Indian armed forces are recalibrating their plans and capabilities for “dynamic responses” along the borders with China and Pakistan below the threshold of all-out wars, as shown during the Balakot air strikes last year, even as they strengthen their conventional military prowess, Army chief Gen M M Naravane said on Wednesday.

Militaries “play to the edge” in the “grey zone” now. China through its incremental moves in the contentious South China Sea, for instance, is altering geo-strategic realities in the region without firing a single shot or inviting any retaliatory action.

“China has not been involved in real, hardcore combat for a few decades now; yet the regular showcasing of its military might have created this aura of China being the undisputed military leader in key technological domains — with deterrence logic of its own,” he said.

India is boosting its power in space, cyber warfare: Army chief

For years we were told that if air power is used across the international border, it would lead to a full-fledged war. Balakot showed that if you play the escalatory game with skill, military ascendancy can be established in short cycles of conflict that do not necessarily lead to war,” Army chief Gen M M Naravane said at a seminar on the changing characteristics of warfare organised by the Centre for Land Warfare Studies.

Dwelling at length on the Chinese way of war epitomised by thinkers like Sun Tzu as well as the continuing relevance of Indian philosopher Chanakya’s famed treatise “Arthashastra”, he said his force is developing both “kinetic and non-kinetic responses” to address the threat of “non-contact or grey-zone warfare”, where ambiguity and careful risk escalation are key. India is strengthening its capabilities in space, cyber and electronic warfare, while also looking to tap blockchain technologies, lasers and directed energy weapons, he said.

“The Houthi rebels’ attack on Riyadh airport and oil facilities in Saudi Arabia and closer home, the Balakot air strike, saw these short, intense, escalatory cycles of military activity, in full media glare, where sophisticated information narratives played an equally important role,” said Gen Naravane.

Terming it a “technological irony”, he said the so-called Islamic State had shown it was far more adept in leveraging social media and digital technologies than the 21st-century militaries of the US and the UK. “The rise of non-state actors, such as insurgents, terrorists, transnational criminal networks combined with greater focus on an individual’s status consequently demands that victory needs to be formulated and achieved in a more nuanced way. Victory no longer rests on the ability to inflict massive destruction but on the ability to wrestle popular support from one’s opponent,” he said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh government staves off crisis as 6 MLAs return to Congress
Content: BHOPAL: The Kamal Nath government has weathered its biggest challenge in 14 months in power. It staved off what CM Nath and his senior Congress colleague Digvijaya Singh dubbed a BJP attempt to topple the government by buying out ruling alliance MLAs.Six of the 10 ‘missing’ MLAs were back in the Nath fold by Wednesday afternoon. But four are still ‘missing’ and reported to be cooped up in bungalows in Whitefield, Bengaluru. All other ruling alliance MLAs are accounted for, says Congress. “My government has already proven majority four times in floor tests and defeated BJP. They will be defeated again,” Nath said. With two seats vacant, the House strength is 228, putting the majority mark at 115.Congress has 114 legislators. Even discounting the four missing MLAs, the Nath government is still comfortable with two BSP MLAs, an SP legislator and four independents. BJP, on the other hand, has 107 MLAs.It was a close call. Madhya Pradesh hasn’t seen such political drama in at least two decades. Sixteen hours of firefighting. Chartered planes criss-crossing like they were shuttles. Scuffles, apparently, at a star hotel in Gurgaon. And political heavyweights from both sides are going toe to toe.The political storm hit the MP government in the dead of night, around 1am on Wednesday, when reports surfaced of six, seven, eight (no one knew how many) Congress MLAs and allies cooped up at a hotel in Gurgaon. Congress alleged that the BJP was holding them there against their wish. Digvijaya turned up at the hotel but was allegedly not allowed to enter.The Congress firefight was led by young Turks Jitu Patwari and Jaivardhan Singh, Digvijaya’s son, who landed up at the hotel to “rescue their besieged colleagues.” With Digvijaya marshalling troops on the ground and Nath on the phone line from Bhopal , Congress launched a fierce counterattack.Around 2 am, BSP MLA Rambai was the first to be brought out. In the next few hours, five more MLAs had stepped out. And around 10am, there were signs of relief on Congress faces back in Bhopal. Former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan flew back to Bhopal on a chartered plane at 10.30am. And BJP soon issued statements, saying they had nothing to do with the controversy and it was Congress’s internal matter.At 4 pm, the six MLAs — Congress’s Adal Singh Kansana, Ranvir Jatav and Kamlesh Jatav , BSP’s Ram Bai and Sanjeev Kushwah and SP’s Rajesh Shukla — alighted from a chartered plane in Bhopal and were driven to the CM’s residence under tight security.Nath issued a statement, accusing BJP of trying to “destabilise the government in collaboration with mafia groups”. “BJP has been defeated every time it tried to destabilise this government,” the chief minister said. Digvijaya said, “The Congress government in Madhya Pradesh is secure and will complete its tenure of five years under chief minister Kamal Nath. We came to know of BJP’s activities and allurement after which we exposed them two days ago.”Earlier in the day, CM Nath was scheduled to fly to New Delhi, but with the homecoming, he cancelled the trip. He sent finance minister Tarun Bhanot to bring back the MLAs.Four MLAs, including an independent, remained untraced till late evening hours, though state Congress claimed they were all in touch with CM Nath and would be back soon. They include Congress’s Hardeep Singh Dang, Bisahulal Singh and Raghuraj Kansana, and independent MLA Surendra Singh Sher. Around 8:30am, Congress had claimed that these MLAs, including former minister Bisahulal Singh, were “bodily lifted and taken away by BJP”.Standing in front of the hotel in the wee hours of Wednesday, Digvijaya had alleged that former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, BJP chief whip Narottam Mishra and former BJP ministers Rampal Singh and Sanjay Pathak were “sitting inside the hotel with money”.But Mishra denied any involvement in the drama or having flown to Bengaluru with the four MLAs. “There is disgruntlement in Congress and BJP is nowhere in the picture,” he said over telephone, adding that he is in Delhi. “Congress MLAs are unhappy. If any MLA comes to meet us, it does not mean we are luring them with money.” Asked where the missing Congress MLAs are, he said, “They are angry with their party’s government.”Mishra claimed 15 to 20 Congress MLAs in touch with him. “What is so inappropriate if some Congress MLAs come to meet me? Let Congress prove that I offered money to their MLAs. Who is stopping Digvijaya Singh from giving proof?” he said.Chouhan said, “The issue is within the Congress family and they are levelling accusations at us.” Asked why he went to Delhi, Chouhan said, “I am the national vice-president of BJP. When the party calls me to Delhi, I go there. Now I am going to Agar. We have to win elections.” Dismissing Digvijaya’s allegations, Chouhan said, “There are so many factions in Congress and the strife is within their party while they make allegations against us. The BJP is never involved in activities like this. But if anything occurs under the government’s own weight then what can we do?”Newly-appointed state BJP president V D Sharma said, “This is Congress’ infighting. The BJP is not interested in such activities.”Back in fold: Congress’s Adal Singh Kansana, Ranvir Jatav and Kamlesh Jatav, BSP’s Ram Bai and Sanjeev Kushwah and SP’s Rajesh ShuklaMissing: Congress’s Hardeep Singh Dang, Bisahulal Singh and Raghuraj Kansana, and independent MLA Surendra Singh Sher.

Title: Madhya Pradesh government staves off crisis as 6 MLAs return to Congress
Content:
Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath (File photo)

BHOPAL: The Kamal Nath government has weathered its biggest challenge in 14 months in power. It staved off what CM Nath and his senior Congress colleague Digvijaya Singh dubbed a BJP attempt to topple the government by buying out ruling alliance MLAs.

Six of the 10 ‘missing’ MLAs were back in the Nath fold by Wednesday afternoon. But four are still ‘missing’ and reported to be cooped up in bungalows in Whitefield, Bengaluru. All other ruling alliance MLAs are accounted for, says Congress. “My government has already proven majority four times in floor tests and defeated BJP. They will be defeated again,” Nath said. With two seats vacant, the House strength is 228, putting the majority mark at 115.

Congress has 114 legislators. Even discounting the four missing MLAs, the Nath government is still comfortable with two BSP MLAs, an SP legislator and four independents. BJP, on the other hand, has 107 MLAs.

It was a close call. Madhya Pradesh hasn’t seen such political drama in at least two decades. Sixteen hours of firefighting. Chartered planes criss-crossing like they were shuttles. Scuffles, apparently, at a star hotel in Gurgaon. And political heavyweights from both sides are going toe to toe.

The political storm hit the MP government in the dead of night, around 1am on Wednesday, when reports surfaced of six, seven, eight (no one knew how many) Congress MLAs and allies cooped up at a hotel in Gurgaon. Congress alleged that the BJP was holding them there against their wish. Digvijaya turned up at the hotel but was allegedly not allowed to enter.

The Congress firefight was led by young Turks Jitu Patwari and Jaivardhan Singh, Digvijaya’s son, who landed up at the hotel to “rescue their besieged colleagues.” With Digvijaya marshalling troops on the ground and Nath on the phone line from Bhopal , Congress launched a fierce counterattack.

Around 2 am, BSP MLA Rambai was the first to be brought out. In the next few hours, five more MLAs had stepped out. And around 10am, there were signs of relief on Congress faces back in Bhopal. Former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan flew back to Bhopal on a chartered plane at 10.30am. And BJP soon issued statements, saying they had nothing to do with the controversy and it was Congress’s internal matter.

At 4 pm, the six MLAs — Congress’s Adal Singh Kansana, Ranvir Jatav and Kamlesh Jatav , BSP’s Ram Bai and Sanjeev Kushwah and SP’s Rajesh Shukla — alighted from a chartered plane in Bhopal and were driven to the CM’s residence under tight security.

Nath issued a statement, accusing BJP of trying to “destabilise the government in collaboration with mafia groups”. “BJP has been defeated every time it tried to destabilise this government,” the chief minister said. Digvijaya said, “The Congress government in Madhya Pradesh is secure and will complete its tenure of five years under chief minister Kamal Nath. We came to know of BJP’s activities and allurement after which we exposed them two days ago.”

Earlier in the day, CM Nath was scheduled to fly to New Delhi, but with the homecoming, he cancelled the trip. He sent finance minister Tarun Bhanot to bring back the MLAs.

Four MLAs, including an independent, remained untraced till late evening hours, though state Congress claimed they were all in touch with CM Nath and would be back soon. They include Congress’s Hardeep Singh Dang, Bisahulal Singh and Raghuraj Kansana, and independent MLA Surendra Singh Sher. Around 8:30am, Congress had claimed that these MLAs, including former minister Bisahulal Singh, were “bodily lifted and taken away by BJP”.

Standing in front of the hotel in the wee hours of Wednesday, Digvijaya had alleged that former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, BJP chief whip Narottam Mishra and former BJP ministers Rampal Singh and Sanjay Pathak were “sitting inside the hotel with money”.

But Mishra denied any involvement in the drama or having flown to Bengaluru with the four MLAs. “There is disgruntlement in Congress and BJP is nowhere in the picture,” he said over telephone, adding that he is in Delhi. “Congress MLAs are unhappy. If any MLA comes to meet us, it does not mean we are luring them with money.” Asked where the missing Congress MLAs are, he said, “They are angry with their party’s government.”

Mishra claimed 15 to 20 Congress MLAs in touch with him. “What is so inappropriate if some Congress MLAs come to meet me? Let Congress prove that I offered money to their MLAs. Who is stopping Digvijaya Singh from giving proof?” he said.

Chouhan said, “The issue is within the Congress family and they are levelling accusations at us.” Asked why he went to Delhi, Chouhan said, “I am the national vice-president of BJP. When the party calls me to Delhi, I go there. Now I am going to Agar. We have to win elections.” Dismissing Digvijaya’s allegations, Chouhan said, “There are so many factions in Congress and the strife is within their party while they make allegations against us. The BJP is never involved in activities like this. But if anything occurs under the government’s own weight then what can we do?”

Newly-appointed state BJP president V D Sharma said, “This is Congress’ infighting. The BJP is not interested in such activities.”

Back in fold: Congress’s Adal Singh Kansana, Ranvir Jatav and Kamlesh Jatav, BSP’s Ram Bai and Sanjeev Kushwah and SP’s Rajesh Shukla

Missing: Congress’s Hardeep Singh Dang, Bisahulal Singh and Raghuraj Kansana, and independent MLA Surendra Singh Sher.

Title: Throwback Thursday: Amitabh Bachchan shares an old picture of Jaya Bachchan in Swami Vivekanand's avatar from a Bengali film!
Content: Megastar Amitabh Bachchan is one of the veteran actors of Bollywood who is quite active on social media. He keeps his fans updated about his day-to-day activities through his posts on various sharing platforms.He often shares pictures with his family and film co-stars. And now, Big B took to his Instagram to share an old picture of his actress-wife Jaya Bachchan from the film 'Dagtar Babu'.In his caption, he went on to reveal that Jaya played the role of Swami Vivekanand in the Bengali film, however, it didn't see the light of the day. In the monochrome photo, Jaya can be seen in Swami's avatar as she posed for the camera. The caption of the post read, "Jaya .. in film ‘Dagtar Babu’ in Bengali playing Vivekanand .. film could not be completed."Check it out here:Meanwhile, on the work front, Amitabh will be next seen in Shoojit Sircar 's 'Gulabo Sitabo' with Ayushmann Khurrana Nagraj Manjule 's 'Jhund', 'Chehre' with Emraan Hashmi and Ayan Mukerji 's 'Brahmastra' with Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

Title: Telecom AGR Dues: Pay Rs 77,000 crore dues without any delay, government tells telecom companies
Content:
Submit docus for AGR dues’ calculations: DoT to telcos

NEW DELHI: The telecom department on Wednesday sent recovery notices of Rs 76,746 crore to Vodafone Idea, Airtel and Tata Tele, expressing unhappiness at their decision to make part payments against AGR (adjusted gross revenue) dues and asking them to deposit the balance amount “without any further delay” to comply with the Supreme Court’s orders.“Partial payment cannot be construed as compliance to the SC order dated October 24, 2019 and February 14 this year … pay balance amount without any further delay,” the telecom ministry said in a letter to the three companies, making it clear that it wants to collect the full dues that have been ordered by the top court, highly-placed sources told TOI.Vodafone Idea has so far paid only Rs 3,500 crore towards the Rs 53,038 crore demanded from the company, while Airtel has paid Rs 18,004 crore against the Rs 35,586 crore demanded from it. Tata group companies, Tata Teleservices Limited (TTSL) and Tata Teleservices (Maharashtra) Limited (TTML), cumulatively paid Rs 4,197 crore towards the Rs 13,823 crore asked from them.Commenting on the development, another senior official said, “With this notice, the companies now need to pay the balance amount immediately or else face penal action that, in the first step, would include encashment of bank guarantees submitted by them. Thereafter, if they do not replenish the guarantees and submit the balance AGR dues, we will look at the extreme step of cancelling their telecom license for which a show cause notice will be issued,” one of the source said.As per Wednesday’s notice, Vodafone Idea will thus need to submit Rs 49,538 crore to the telecom department immediately, while Airtel will need to pay Rs 17,582 crore. Tata companies will need to deposit Rs 9,626 crore.Questions sent to the companies on Wednesday evening remained unanswered. When contacted over phone, a spokesperson for Airtel declined to comment.The DoT notice said that the top court’s order mandates the companies to pay the entire license fee and spectrum usage charge (SUC) dues, along with interest, penalty, and interest on penalty, on an “upfront” basis.Also, the telecom department asked the telcos to submit supporting documents in lieu of the AGR calculations that they have done in their self-assessment. “The said details/documents are urgently required for proper reconciliation of the legitimate dues because amount paid by you is based on self-assessment.”The tough stance taken by the government on the matter comes at a time when the telecom companies insist that their AGR dues are way lower than what is being demanded out of them. Also, Vodafone Idea has made it clear that it does not have the financial strength to pay the balance amount without a government bailout, which should be extended in various forms including a staggered payment option, and reduction in license fee and spectrum charges that telecom companies need to pay.“At this point in time, we do not have the financial strength to pay the balance, self-assessed principal, interest, penalty and interest on penalty. In the present financial situation, we would be in a position to do so only if the DoT and the government can kindly take up the steps we are requesting,” a top Vodafone Idea officer said in a February 25 letter sent to the Telecom Secretary and the Prime Minister’s Office, which was also marked to the Finance Minister , Cabinet Secretary, among other high-ranking officials.The government and the multi-ministry Digital Communications Commission (DCC) are already seized of the industry’s woes and are understood to be working on a series of options, including a staggered payment or part cash payout and the rest through bonds & warrants.Vodafone’s Global CEO Nick Read will be visiting the country later this week, and has sought time for a meeting with Telecom and IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad for Friday. Kumar Mangalam Birla , the company’s Indian partner and the chairman of Vodafone Idea, has had meetings with Prasad and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on the matter.The source said that a fresh DCC meeting is expected on the matter very soon where the final contours of a possible relief package may come up.

Title: You can't help but fall in love with this sun-kissed picture of Diana Penty!
Content: On Tuesday actress Payal Ghosh who filed an FIR against filmmaker Anurag Kashyap accusing him of wrongful restrain, wrongful confinement and outraging the modesty of a woman, met the head of National Women’s Commission, Rekha Sharma in New Delhi to discuss the ongoing investigation against the director. Talking to ANI about the same, the actress has opened up about Richa Chadha’s defamation case accusing Payal and others of maligning the ‘Fukrey’ actress’ name.

Title: Vivad se Vishwas bill: Lok Sabha passes ‘Vishwas’ bill, government eyes Rs 1.5 lakh crore
Content:
The Lok Sabha on Wednesday passed the bill to implement the ‘Vivad se Vishwas’ scheme (File photo)

NEW DELHI: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday passed the bill to implement the ‘Vivad se Vishwas’ scheme with estimates suggesting that the government could mop up Rs 1.5 lakh crore from the latest project to settle pending direct tax disputes.

The government had tasted success with a similar scheme for indirect taxes last year, prompting it to go for the ‘Vivad se Vishwas’ scheme in the Budget. Apart from reducing litigation, the scheme could help the government mop up massive revenue at a time when tax collections have been muted.

The bill was cleared by the lower House through a voice vote. More than 4.8 lakh direct tax cases involving Rs 9.3 lakh core in disputed amount are locked in various appellate forums such as Commissioner (Appeals), ITAT, debt recovery tribunals, high courts and the Supreme Court with the amount topping 80% of the government’s direct tax revenue in 2018-19. Not just in case of tax disputes, the scheme can also be availed of in search and seizure operations where the recovery is up to Rs 5 crore.

While the government is going all out to get taxpayers to come forward and settle the dispute, industry representatives, too, said the scheme is an attractive offer, especially for the “early birds”.

Under the scheme, a taxpayer who pays the disputed tax before March 31, will get complete waiver of interest and penalty. The scheme would remain open from March 1 to June 30, 2020, and those who avail of it after March 31 would have to pay some additional amount.

Title: Life insurers to insist on medical tests to keep term rates under check
Content:
Companies said, given the coronavirus scare, insurance becomes more crucial (Reuters)

MUMBAI: Buying a term cover could get more difficult, even as insurers are already indicating that term rates for life policies could rise 15-20% from April due to higher reinsurance costs. The companies are now likely to insist on health checks as medically underwritten policies attract relatively lower reinsurance costs.

Term insurance policies — contracts which compensate only in the event of death without any survival benefits — have crashed more than 50% since liberalisation. Companies have offered term insurance of up to Rs 1 crore for rates as low as Rs 6,000.

Coronavirus outbreak: Complete coverage

Even as they reduced the premiums, insurers also accepted proposals without insisting on medical checks instead of opting for financial underwriting. The assumption was that those who are wealthier are better placed to take care of themselves or avail medical treatment, thus reducing mortality risks. This is in addition to factoring in life expectancy, where India lags behind developed countries.

‘Term insurance premium equal to those in US and UK’

“The pricing of term insurance in India has been aggressive because of a rate war between companies. At present, term insurance rates are equal to those in the US and the UK, and cheaper than Singapore ,” said Santosh Agarwal , chief business officer ( life insurance ), PolicyBazaar.

Coronavirus outbreak: Live updates

Earlier this month, LIC chairman M R Kumar had also indicated that term insurance rates would rise because of reinsurance. According to Agarwal, reinsurers charge more for life policies that are issued without medical checks as against those that have been issued after the applicant has undergone tests. “To keep the rate increase at 15-20%, companies will increase medical underwriting,” said Agarwal.

Life insurance companies reinsure their portfolios to protect themselves against unexpectedly large claims. Reinsurance is also a statutory requirement. Companies said, given the coronavirus scare, insurance becomes more crucial. “Now we are in the process of smoothening the medical underwriting journey, letting the customer schedule medical checks online, and link our systems, the insurance company and the third-party administrator doing the check,” said Agarwal.

Title: World University Ranking 2020: IIT-Bombay, Delhi break into top 50 in world university ranking
Content: MUMBAI/NEW DELHI: For the first time, Indian technical institutions have found place among the top 50 in QS World University Ranking by subject, with IIT-Bombay and IIT-Delhi occupying the 44th and 47th rank, respectively, this year in engineering & technology.India also improved its presence in the top 100 list with five institutions featuring this year as against three in last year’s rankings. In the arts and humanities category, Jawaharlal Nehru University improved its ranking from 166 to 164 among the top 500 universities with the University of Delhi too featuring among the top 250 in this category.Massachusetts Institute of Technology is at pole position for the eighth year in a row. In the second and third positions are Stanford and Cambridge, respectively. Delhi has the most number of institutions from India among the top 200 with IIT-Delhi and DU again featuring in the social science & management category.AIIMS has been ranked 231 in life science & medicine category, improving its rank from 338 in 2019.IIM-Ahmedabad and IIM-Bangalore rank in the 51-100 band for business & management studies. Globally, Harvard, INSEAD and London Business School occupy the top three places. With design technology picking up pace, the National Institute of Design ranked in the 101-150 band. The Royal College of Art, UK, topped the charts in this category.In terms of overall ranks, IIT-B occupies the 152nd position, 10 spots higher as compared to last year. IIT-Delhi comes next at the 182nd (172 in 2019) place, followed closely by the Indian Institute of Science at 184th. Among traditional universities, DU is ranked 474, followed by Hyderabad and Jadavpur. The Universities of Mumbai and Pune remain in the 801-1001 band of rankings.Union HRD minister Ramesh Pokhriyal said: “It is a significant achievement of our premier engineering institutions, which has made India proud. This is the result of continuous efforts by the government to promote an environment of research and innovation.”“Our students and faculty members are our key strength. It is their dedication and hard work that have got us where we are today,” IIT-B director Subhasis Chaudhuri said.IIT-D director V Ramgopal Rao said: “We are very happy to see a significant improvement in our rankings. This is a result of the various measures we have taken in the institute on boosting the research ecosystem, bettering teacher-student ratio and strengthening our connect with external stakeholders in the last three years. The number of international students has gone up to 130, most of them pursuing their masters and PhD.”IIT-Delhi has also started several interdisciplinary research projects, pushing their score on research impact, he said, adding a dozen new centres of excellence have come up on the campus.Delhi University vice-chancellor Yogesh Tyagi said, “DU is the premier university of the nation and it is heartening that it not only features in all the five lists of the latest ranking but has made significant progress since last year.”Quacquarelli Symonds Limited subject rankings are based on research quality, academic reputation and accomplishments besides graduate employment.

Title: Gadchiroli cops immortalize Jambhulkheda martyrs in table calendar
Content:
Nagpur: As a mark of respect and remembrance, Gadchiroli police have come out with a unique table calendar featuring pictures of 15 martyrs of Jambhulkheda blast of May 1 last year. The pictures of the jawans have been printed on the page displaying respective month of their birth.

Fifteen jawans of Quick Response Team (QRT) and a civilian driver, on way to Dadapur village, were killed in a blast triggered by Maoists at Lendhari nullah near Jambhulkheda in Kurkheda taluka of north Gadchiroli. The jawans were heading to assist Purada police station staffers in investigating an arson at Dadapur village where the Maoists had torched 36 vehicles of a road construction company and later deployed ‘call ambush’.

Apart from putting up the pictures in the martyrs’ gallery, Gadchiroli police, under SP Shailesh Balkawade, conceptualized the table calendar.

Sub-inspector Prashant Diwate, public relation officer and also in-charge of propaganda cell, said the calendar also has snippets and brief description of the civic actions or community programmes which the police had organized for establishing rapport with the masses.

“We have covered in pictures and captions the positive developments and achievements of the district police ranging from conducting two elections (assembly and general) without allowing Maoists to disrupt the proceedings to several ‘jan jagaran melawas’ or public awareness rallies at remote places,” he said.

The calendar also displays logo of Gadchiroli police’s elite C-60 commando force with it’s tagline ‘Veer bhogya vasundhara’ (The brave shall enjoy the world) on one side and the state police on the other corner.

The C-60 commandos, with their accomplishments like eliminating 40 cadres in Kasnasur-Boriya encounters in April 2018, had catapulted the image of Gadchiroli police nationwide especially overshadowing the Telangana’s Grey Hounds which earlier hogged the limelight for their daredevil actions against Maoists and taming the Reds in the hinterlands.

Title: Kamptee co to pay daily fine for delay in project
Content:
Nagpur: With municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe acting tough on employees and contractors, the engineers too have started following suit by taking action against erring contractors.

The Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) traffic department has started levying fine of Rs20,000 per day on Kamptee-based Abhi Engineering for delay in completion of sewage and stormwater drain project approved by Devendra Fadnavis during his tenure as chief minister in his South-West constituency. The action was supposed to begin from June 2018.

An engineer from NMC’s traffic department told TOI that a proposal seeking further action will be put up before chief engineer Ulhas Debadwar soon. “Abhi Engineering was supposed to complete works within 11 months from August 31, 2017. Extension was given to it till November 20, 2019. A notice was served to the contractor on January 16 directing to complete works within three months or face daily fine,” he said.

“Now, we have decided to recover fine of Rs20,000 per day with effect from November 20, 2019. The proposal seeking further directives on whether to terminate contract, give extension, double the fine or any other action will be submitted to the chief engineer,” he added.

Considering sewage and stormwater problems in the constituency, Fadnavis had approved Rs35 crore for the project in 2016. The NMC divided the work in two parts. The work order of stormwater drain costing Rs21.17 crore and sewage drain worth Rs 12.06 crore were awarded to Abhi Engineering. The project was to be completed within 11 months. The NMC was supposed to levy penalty on a daily basis from June 2018.

Activist Suraj Lolage , who had lodged a series of complaints in this case, told TOI, “Engineers have started levying penalty only to save themselves from earning Mundhe’s wrath. Less than 30% work was completed as the extended deadline of November 20, 2019 lapsed. It’s clear that the work was at an initial stage in the first deadline, but no action was taken. Work is below 50% complete as on date. Citizens are left to face problems despite availability of funds and issuance of work orders.”

Lolage said that engineers are yet to initiate action on his complaint that Abhi Engineering is using a stretch of London Street Project for storing pipelines and accommodation of labourers for the last one-and-a-half years.

“The NMC, under RTI, informed me that no such permission was given to use the land. I had raised several complaints when the work order was about to be issued to Abhi Engineering, but nothing happened. The work order cost was exclusive of GST. But, yhe engineers calculated bills of Abhi Engineering, including GST. They excluded GST only after my complaints. The traffic department, which has nothing to do with civil works, is executing the project which itself is a massive irregularity,” he said.

Ajju Vijayvargiya, owner of Abhi Engineering, has blamed the NMC for delay. “No plan was given to us with work order for laying the network. The engineers did not give us site clearance. The scope of work was revised many times. Instead of the main line, they are now demanding us to lay network as per requests of zone officials and corporators. We are yet to get a single bill as on date. The penalty levied on us is unjustified,” he said.

Title: Niti Aayog seeks to change lowest bidder norm for government contracts
Content:
Union minister Nitin Gadkari

NEW DELHI: Niti Aayog will prepare a draft proposal to suggest alternatives to the current ‘lowest bidder’ (L1) tendering norm to overcome deficiencies in the process which doesn’t give sufficient weightage to quality parameters. In the current system, which is called Least Cost Selection Method, the bidder quoting the lowest price wins the contract.

Speaking at an event “Goodbye L1”organised by Consulting Engineers Association of India , Niti Aayog vice chairman Rajeev Kumar said everyone knows about the deficiencies in the L1 norm and by following this tendering model, government agencies have “tied their hands and feet”. He referred to a concept paper by Central Vigilance Commission which has talked about the need to revisit current norm and how an all-inclusive public procurement strategy is required, in sync with a rapidly changing world. It has suggested that conventional L1 method is not suited for major infrastructure projects.

Stressing that greater public support was required for the change considering the “moral hazard” attached to such a proposal, Union minister Nitin Gadkari said, “The spirit behind the theme ‘Goodbye L1’ is good, the strategy may not be right. If L1 doesn’t get a contract, people feel that the minister or bureaucrats must have made good money. So, there are risks of getting blamed even if intention is good.”

Kumar said the L1 bidding norm not only impacts infrastructure projects but other government works as well. He said the current tendering system affects research laboratories and defence bodies as they find it difficult to get the right quality product because the tenders go to the lowest bidder. Pointing out that the change can happen only if there is a public demand, he said, “Make a bigger coalition and create public opinion. You should spread the discussion how following alternative norms is beneficial and there will be no increase in cost...because of L1 bidding practice we have not been able to create globally competitive infrastructure firms barring only a few.”

Title: Youth with symptoms admitted to GMCH in Pune
Content: AURANGABAD: A 20-year-old student with symptoms of Covid-19 was admitted to the isolation ward of the GMCH here on Wednesday and his throat swab sent to the Pune-based National Institute of Virology for tests. This is the first suspected case in the district.Subhash Harbade, medical superintendent of GMCH, told TOI that the youth reached the city in a train from Muzaffarabad, Uttar Pradesh, on Wednesday.“We checked the youth after he reached out to us, only to find symptoms of coronavirus . Our medical team rushed him to the district civil hospital, where his swabs were collected and sent to NIV. It could be either swine flu or coronavirus. Only after we get reports after 72 hours, will we be officially in a position to confirm the same,” said Harbade.Sources said that the district civil hospital refused to admit the youth for unknown reasons, but the GMCH decided to put him in the isolation ward.Meanwhile, three members of a family from Beed were declared fit after they showed symptoms of coronavirus.The announcement was made on Wednesday after the Beed district civil surgeon Ashok Thorat, along with a team, visited the family and checked them.The family feared that they may have contracted the disease from the Pune-based patient who had flown with them in the same flight from Dubai.

Title: Coronavirus suspect in GMCH tests negative, discharged
Content: Nagpur: A 41-year-old IT professional from Nagpur, who had travelled in a flight from Dubai, has tested negative on Friday evening. He was seated next to the Hyderabad youth who tested positive of COVID-19. The city man had been admitted in the quarantine ward of Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), on Thursday. He was discharged late on Friday night.Medical superintendent of GMCH Dr Avinash Gawande informed that the tests were conducted in the new facility installed at the Indira Gandhi Government Medical College and Hospital (IGGMCH).“The patient had travelled on February 20 from Dubai to Bengaluru and then to Nagpur. The patient did not show any sign and symptom of cough, cold and fever, but he informed that he was seated next to the Hyderabad youth. So, we took no chance and admitted him to the quarantine ward,” Dr Gawande said.The patient was staying alone in the 32-bed quarantine ward of the GMCH for entire Friday.

Title: Fake job racket mastermind brought to Pilibhit
Content:
Representative image

PILIBHIT: A mastermind of a gang of cheats who duped people by promising them jobs abroad was produced in the court of chief judicial magistrate in Pilibhit on Tuesday.

The accused was identified as Abdul Kareem Rahman, a resident of Mumbai. He was lodged in a Bangalore jail since November 16, 2018 in connection with another case of duping people.

In Pilibhit, police said, Rahman played a key role in duping three people of Rs 24 lakh each on the pretext of sending them to Canada on jobs.

In August 2018, the Sungarhi police station in Pilibhit had registered two FIRs in this matter under IPC section 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 364 (kidnapping with intension of murder), 392 (robbery), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 506 (criminal intimidation) and 342 (wrongful confinement).

In September, Pilibhit police arrested three of Rahman’s aides -- Harpal Singh and Gurupal Singh of Takiya village under Gajraula police station and Karanjeet of Deepnagar village under Tikunia police station in Lakhimpur Kheri district.

The trio told Pilibhit police that they had taken the two victims to Bangalore, saying they would have to board their flight for Canada from there. On reaching Bangalore, the two youths were taken hostage. They were forced to call home to their families that they had reached Canada from a mobile phone with a Canadian SIM. Once their families got a “confirmation that they had reached Canada”, they made full payment to the cheats. Thereafter, the trio fled from Bangalore, abandoning the victims in an isolated area.

During investigations, Pilibhit police learnt of Rahman. Once they came to know that he was in a Bangalore jail, they obtained a warrant B from a Pilibhit court on November 20 and filed it with the Bangalore jail office. The Karnataka police brought Rahman to Pilibhit on Tuesday.

Title: Death of rape survivor’s father: Kuldeep Sengar convicted of culpable homicide
Content:
Expelled BJP Kuldeep Singh Sengar (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and six others, including two UP policemen, were convicted on Wednesday of “culpable homicide not amounting to murder” in the death of the Unnao rape survivor’s father.

According to special judge Dharmesh Sharma, the accused demonstrated their “political and muscle power” to criminally intimidate the deceased and his family and deter them from pursuing the sexual assault case against Sengar. While framing charges in August last year, the court had viewed the death as “part of a larger conspiracy to deter, silence and prevent the father from pursuing the complaint” regarding the rape of his daughter in 2017. The court will hear arguments on the quantum of punishment on March 12.

Besides Sengar, the court convicted then Makhi police station in-charge Ashok Singh Bhadauria, sub-inspector K P Singh, and Vineet Mishra , Birendra Singh , Shashi Pratap Singh and Atul Singh , Sengar’s brother. It came on record that the man was brutally assaulted but charges of assault, criminal intimidation and possession of firearms were made against him.

Title: ‘Surrogacy bill needs review’
Content:
Ahmedabad: Experts participating in a panel discussion on Tuesday said that the Surrogacy (Regulation) Bill will have several contradictions and therefore a review was needed.

The central government in February approved the bill with a few key changes. Compared to the earlier law, the bill is under scrutiny for points ranging from rights of same-sex couples to unwed women. The theme of the discussion was ‘Surrogacy: The Ethical Dilemma.’ The panel consisted of Dr Nayana Patel, surrogacy expert, Tanishtha Samanta from IIT-Gandhinagar, K Parameswaran from Gujarat National Law University (GNLU), and Kelly Dhru, a doctoral scholar at Hamburg University. They discussed medical, legal, sociological, and bioethical aspects.

Patel said that surrogacy is allowed for divorced and widowed women but not for unwed women.

The panel said that may discourage doctors. GNLU launched India Bioethics Project that will carry out research in fields such as contraception, abortion, pre-natal diagnosis for sex selection. “Through this project, GNLU intends to contribute soft laws to such vital areas,” said Dr S Shanthakumar, director of GNLU.

Title: Dr Anup Marar gets ‘Intellectual of the Year 2019’ award
Content:
Nagpur: Rifacimento International is a well-established name publishing reference books in the genre of Who’s Who. They have been compiling and publishing biographies since 1982. Recently, they included Nagpur-based Dr Anup Marar in the award category of Intellectual of the year 2019 for his contribution in field of health care. He was honoured with a memento and certificate.

Dr Anup Marar is the Director of Orange City Hospital & Research Institute (OCHRI) since 2000. He was earlier associated with Radhikabai Meghe Memorial Medical Trust — Sawangi (Meghe), Wardha, as Chief Medical Superintendent and Chief Coordinator. He is associated with many government registered bodies, namely Orange City Bahuudesshiya Sanstha, Saraswati Vidyalaya Alumni Association, Dignity for the Dead Foundation, Hospitals Association of Nagpur, Save Merit Save Nation and Poonam Pride Housing Society. He played a leading role in designing and promoting ethical health care sector models. His name has been included in Asia Pacific’s “Who’s Who”, Asian Admirable Achievers and Reference Asia: Asia’s Who's Who of Men and Women of Achievement. He is also Honorary Advisor of Maharashtra Chapter of Association of Healthcare Providers (India) and Member of Visitors Board, Indira Gandhi Government Medical College. An ISO 9001:2000 Lead Auditor and Certified NABH Assessor; he is also Founder Editor-in- Chief of “Jaivik” Newspaper that propagates moral and ethical values for circulation among the medical fraternity of Central India.

Dr Marar owes his success to his parents and family, Mr. Udaybhaskar Nair, his friends & well-wishers and Nagpur city.

Title: UN body yet to file plea in SC, hasn’t engaged attorney here
Content:
An anti CAA protest (File photo)

NEW DELHI: The UN Human Rights Council is yet to file an intervention petition in the Supreme Court as amicus curiae in a case challenging the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).

Responding to a question by TOI, the spokesperson for the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) said, “The amicus brief is still being processed, and is being handled here in Geneva.” This means the rights body has not engaged an Indian attorney to represent it in India.

While it might be a first in India, the OHCHR has filed similar amicus curiae petitions in many countries in the world. Sources in the UN said such petitions were normally filed in countries which were believed to have an independent judiciary.

In the past few years, the OHCHR has filed similar petitions in the US Supreme Court (2012) to support petitioners Donald Vance and Nathan Ertel versus Donald Rumsfeld , former defence secretary, on the issue of torture, as well as in two other cases — one in the Supreme Court and one in the US Court of Appeals in the fourth circuit. Almost all of them concerned the use of torture.

The UN filed similar petitions in Brazil ’s Supreme Court regarding the denial of abortion services, made in response to the Brazilian government’s response to the outbreak of Zika virus, and a second on the constitutionality of a differentiated disciplinary regime in that country.

It has filed in the constitutional tribunal of Peru, as well as in the constitutional court of South Korea, and even the federal high court of Nigeria last month. The OHCHR has intervened similarly in a case in the Supreme Court of UK on abortion in Northern Ireland. The European Court for Human Rights received two such petitions in 2011 and 2015.

Title: HC stays defamation trial against 11 Gurudwara chiefs
Content:
Nagpur: The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court on February 17 granted a stay to the trial proceedings of a defamation case in a lower court against 11 people, who are each president/chairman of Gurudwaras in Nagpur, till the pendency of the instant petition before it.

The case in lower court was a result of a private complaint filed by a member of the Sikh community against the 11 petitioners. An inter-family dispute had found its way before the community elders for settlement around seven years ago. The petitioners contend that the respondent did not follow through with the promises made at the Gurudwara to resolve the dispute and disagreements from both sides. This ultimately led to the respondent approaching the trial court, orders being issued by the judge to proceed with the case and petitioners moving HC to quash the proceedings.

Advocate Amit Khare, who appeared for all 11 petitioners, told the bench headed by Justice Rohit Deo that the “process issued by the trial court against all the petitioners is unwarranted and abuse of the process of law by the respondents to harass the petitioners”. He prayed for a stay on the entire proceedings before the trial court at Nagpur during the pendency of the instant petition, which was granted. Advocate AN Ansari, who appeared for the respondent, has sought time to file a reply.

Title: Refugees, not migrants, are citizens: Mamata Banerjee
Content:
West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee (File photo)

KOLKATA: Buniyadpur (Dakshin Dinajpur): Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday clarified her stand on refugees following her views as reported in sections of the media and categorically denied having said that Bangladeshi immigrants were bona fide citizens of India.

“I have never said that people of Bangladesh are our citizens. There are citizens of Bangladesh as we are citizens of India. India, Pakistan and Bangladesh were one country before Partition in 1947. Many people from Pakistan and now Bangladesh came over to India after Partition. I referred to them,” Banerjee said at a public rally in Buniyadpur, Dakshin Dinajpur.

Benerjee had raised the issue while taking on BJP on the CAA-NPR-NRC issue. “Some people may come to your home and ask about your parents and their address. Don’t answer them,” the CM said, pointing to a reply on an RTI application asking for PM Modi’s citizenship certificate. “Look at the response. It says the PM is a citizen of India by birth and so the question of his having a citizenship certificate (which is citizenship by registration) does not arise. Why should others born in this country have to show documents?” she said.

Title: Girls get first-hand experience to act as collector, SP ‘for a day’
Content:
Nagpur: In a unique initiative to boost the confidence of girls and motivate them ahead of International Women’s Day (March 8), the Buldhana district administration gave an opportunity to bright girls of government schools to act as collector and superintendent of police for a day.

Conceptualized by Buldhana collector Suman Chandra, the weeklong initiative will allow girls to experience administration’s functioning and address other issues. The initiative aims to provide them with exposure towards governance and administration besides making them feel confident and more inspired towards their goal as well as motivate other girls.

According to Chandra, “Bright and meritorious girls of the zilla parishad schools will get an opportunity to sit on the collector’s chair to have a first-hand experience of governance. This will also give them an opportunity to decide the changes they would like to bring in the society, if given such an opportunity.”

On the first day of this unique drive, Poonam Deshmukh, a Class 8 student from Padoli zilla parishad school, acted as collector and oversaw the administrative work. She took stock of the unseasonal rainfall in the district and got details about the crop damage in Khamgaon tehsil from superintending district agriculture officer Narendra Naik. Later she interacted with the media and participated in the ‘Lokshahi Din’.

“Poonam expressed happiness about her experience and went home as a more confident girl,” Chandra told PTI.

Another girl, Maria, a Class 9 student from a zilla parishad school in Malkapur tehsil, attended a census meeting and understand how the census is conducted.

“They get an exposure for a day and we also make them write a diary wherein they note down their experience and their vision for society. They will share their experience at a programme on Women’s Day,” said Chandra.

Poonam told TOI, “Acting as a collector for a day is one of the most important days of my life. Now I aspire to become collector one day and will put in my best efforts to realize my dream.” She said her elder sister wanted to become the collector but could not do so due to family constraints. “Girls should study well and prove their potential,” Poonam said.

Under the same initiative, another girl, Sahrish Kanwal, from zilla parishad Urdu high school, Malkapur tehsil, took over as the district superintendent of police for a day from SP Dilip Patil. She resolved to end cases of atrocities against women and child and aim towards ensuring every girl becomes self-dependent and proves her mettle.

The district administration is also celebrating ‘Pink Week’, focusing on women’s health. “A woman in the pink of her health will keep the society in the pink of health,” Chandra said. All the primary health centres in the district are conducting the drive to ensure good health for women.

The district administration has organized screening for anaemia, breast cancer, cervical cancer and non-communicable diseases. “All these efforts are being made to focus on the welfare of women and eventually, their empowerment in the long-run,” Chandra said.

Title: SBM impact on rural women: 93% feel safer after having household toilets
Content:
NEW DELHI: Nearly 93% of rural women feel safer from assault by not going out in the open to defecate, a survey on the impact of Swachh Bharat Mission has found.

The survey was carried out by the UNICEF and Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) on Wednesday in the run up to International Women’s Day on March 8.

A total of 6,993 women across the five states of Bihar, Madhya Pradesh , Maharashtra , Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh were covered and it was conducted last month.

The survey released by Union Jal Shakti minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday found that 91% women save up to one hour of their day, which they earlier spent on walking to defecation sites. Nearly 88% of women respondents said they are proud to own a toilet.

Similarly, 93% women respondents felt that they need not have to stop eating to control the urge to defecate anymore while 81% said they need not worry about privacy while changing menstrual hygiene material. Another big finding was 93% said they no longer fear contracting infections as they use household toilets.

"The increased access to household toilets has led to the improvement in the suvidha (convenience), suraksha (safety) and swabhimaan (self-respect) of women in rural India," an official statement said.

Shekhawat on Wednesday also launched the phase-II of Swachh Bharat Mission ( Grameen ) on Wednesday.

The second phase of SBM (gramin) will be implemented from 2020-21 to 2024-25 in a mission mode with a total outlay of nearly Rs 1.41 lakh crore.

"This will be a novel model of convergence between different verticals of financing. Of this Rs 52,497 crore will be allocated from the budget of Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation, while the remaining amount will be dovetailed from the funds being released under 15th Finance Commission , MGNREGS and revenue generation models particularly for solid and liquid waste management," the jal shakti ministry said in a release.

Title: AAR halts smooth take-off for a Mauritius JV partner and holds cap gains as taxable in India
Content:
MUMBAI: The Authority for Advance Rulings has denied the benefit of capital gains tax exemption to a Mauritius resident entity, which sold its shares in an Indian company.

This sale pertained to the period prior to April 1, 2017, when as per treaty provisions, India did not have the right to tax such capital gains. For sales, post this date, India under a renegotiated tax treaty with Mauritius has obtained the right to tax capital gains on sale of shares of an Indian company. In addition, India’s general anti-avoidance rules (GAAR) came into effect from the financial year 2017-18, with investments prior to that (such as those made by the Mauritius entity, in this case) being grandfathered.

However, the AAR looked into the entire nature of the transactions in a holistic manner and concluded that it was a conduit to avoid tax.

The applicant, Bid Services Division (Mauritius) was a second tier (step-down) subsidiary of a listed South African company. It with its JV partners, GVK Airports Holding (GVK) and ASCA Global had successfully bid for operation and maintenance of the Mumbai airport.

It held a 27% stake in the consortium company, Mumbai International Airport Private Limited. Under a share purchase agreement entered into in March 2011, it divested 13.5% of its holding to GVK for US $ 231 million.

It approached the AAR to determine the taxability of capital gains. It contended that it held a Mauritius tax residency certificate and that in the absence of a limitation of benefit clause in the India-Mauritius tax treaty, the beneficial provisions of the tax treaty (aka capital gains tax exemption) cannot be denied.

However, the AAR noted that it was a shell company, interposed merely to obtain a tax advantage. Thus, by placing emphasis on ‘substance over form’, the AAR denied the tax treaty benefits.

Dhruva Advisors, in their tax alert point out that availability of tax benefits to a Mauritius entity under the tax treaty has been the subject of intense litigation over the years, with the tax department closely evaluating the commercial expediency, beneficial ownership and substance requirements in the transaction.

“The AAR in this case have disregarded circular no 789 issued by the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) which treated the tax residency certificate as conclusive evidence of beneficial ownership. The Supreme Court had also affirmed this in the case of Azadi Bachao. Instead the AAR applied anti-abuse rules emanating from various judicial precedents,” points out the tax alert.

Unlike court orders, rulings of the AAR merely have persuasive value in similar cases. However, the ruling throws light on how the commercial nature of each and every transaction can be closely scrutinized by the tax authorities, which puts more onus on the taxpayers to back up transactions with a proper commercial reasoning, sums up Dhruva Advisors .

Title: If we defeat its fear, cancer too can be defeated, says Sonali Bendre
Content:
Nagpur: Ace Bollywood actress Sonali Bendre who survived serious metastatic cancer last year said that getting over the fear and stigma of cancer is the first step towards defeating this deadly disease.

“For many of us, cancer means death. But, I’m a living example in front of you all. We can defeat cancer at any stage,” she said while sharing her experience of battling cancer.

The actor was diagnosed with high-grade cancer two years back, in 2018. Doctors had told her that she had 30% chances of survival. She decided to take the battle head-on and finally emerged victorious.

Sonali visited Nagpur’s National Cancer Institute (NCI) on March 5 to celebrate the first anniversary of ‘Ayushmati’, a unique initiative of NCI that supports free cancer screening for healthy women above 40 years of age.

In the last one year, 1398 women from Nagpur got themselves screened for three types of cancers in NCI for free.

“We all believe that cancer is not going happen to me. But we need to understand this can happen to anybody. Women feel shy or experience fear even from getting screened for cancer. If you don’t get screened, how will you detect it in the early stage?,” she asked while appreciating the Ayushmati project.

Sonali embraced and advocated the tagline of the National Cancer Institute which is “Freedom from Fear of Cancer”. “I think it is important to spread the message — Early Detection Saves Lives,” she said.

The programme began with the introduction to the National Cancer Institute and its initiatives, especially “Ayushmati”, by Shailesh Joglekar, General Secretary and CEO.

Dr Anand Pathak, medical director, gave an outline about the journey of ‘Ayushmati’ and the data trends observed. He impressed upon the need for cancer screening for women for early detection due to the growing prevalence of cancer among women in India.

Shital Teli-Ugale, Metropolitan Commissioner, NMRDA was the guest of honour.

“A complete household revolves around women and the well-being of women determines the well-being of the family. If we save lives of women through early detection, we are saving the complete household and all the members involved,” she said.

She encouraged women to come forward for early detection and appreciated the efforts taken by National Cancer Institute by conducting “Ayushmati”.

Sonali Bendre, chief guest of the function, expressed how fascinated and shell-shocked she was after visiting the National Cancer Institute as she compared it with other globally located cancer hospitals.

She shared her experience of battling cancer and her denial saying, “How can this happen to me? We all have the believe that this is not going happen to me. But we need to understand this can happen to anybody.”

“Ayushmati” will continue operating for the next year and would invite women who have visited through the past one year for cancer screenings and continue to encourage other women above the age of 40 to get themselves screened.

Title: Prohibition wing busts gang selling adulterated liquor
Content:
Villupuram: A 10-member gang involved in smuggling Indian made foreign liquor (IMFL) from Puducherry and selling it in Villupuram district after adulterating it with essence and changing the wrappers and hologram to make them look as though they were bought from TASMAC outlets and thereby making huge profits was arrested by the district prohibition enforcement wing (PEW) during a vehicle check at Valathi bus stand near Gingee on Wednesday.

About 1,400 Puducherry-made IMFL bottles, three cars and three motorbikes all worth about Rs 25 lakh were seized from the accused. Police also detained some land owners suspecting their involvement in the racket.

A senior police officer identified the arrested as prime accused M Balakrishnan, 38, of Kodungiyur village, P Pandiyan, 36, R Ranjith, 22, A Shagul Hameed, 19, A Anandh Raj, 23, V Balu, 53, G Ajith Kumar, 24, P Madhan, 25, M Ajith Kumar, 24, and P Velangkannan, 28, from Karaikal, Cuddalore, Chennai and Valathi. He refused to reveal the identity of the two detained land owners.

Police said that based on the direction by Villupuram SP S Jayakumar to monitor smuggling of liquor into the district, a team headed by Villupuram and Kotakuppam PEW inspectors Renukha Devi and Vishnu Priya was conducting vehicle check at Valathi bus stop near Gingee from Tuesday night.

Around 6 am on Wednesday, police intercepted three cars and two motorbikes trying to cross the spot one after the other. Following a check, they identified that the occupants of the vehicles belonged to the same gang and were smuggling about 27 cartons of 180 ml bottles and eight cartons of 750 ml bottles in the vehicles.

Interrogation with the accused revealed that Balakrishnan was running a tire retreading unit at Muruganthangal junction road for more than a year and had used the rented shop for stocking the IMFL bottles and operating a fake liquor unit in the shop.

Police, who booked a case against the gang, are holding further investigation to ascertain whether they supplied the adulterated liquor to TASMAC outlets.

Title: Bike-borne men snatch mobile phone from minister
Content:
Puducherry: Two men on a motorcycle snatched a mobile phone from a Puducherry minister while he was taking a walk near the guesthouse allotted by the government in the town on Monday night.

Police said agriculture minister R Kamalakannan, who hails from Karaikal, reached Puducherry on Monday and was staying at the guesthouse allotted to him near the fire station. Known for his simplicity, the minister usually moves around town on his bike or on foot without any security cover.

He left the guesthouse for a walk on Monday night and took a stroll on the beach road and was walking towards the guesthouse when he got a call on his cellphone.

When he crossed the fire station within the former white town , two men on a motorcycle zipped past him and the pillion rider snatched the phone from him. Caught unaware, the minister could not note down the registration number of the bike. The mobile phone cost Rs 18,000. He lodged a police complaint and alerted the service provider to block the number. Police have registered a case and initiated investigations. TNN

Title: Sexually assaulted by her teacher, Class VI girl drops out of school near Katpadi
Content:
Vellore: A Class VI student of a government aided high school at Kasam near Katpadi has dropped out of school after she was sexually assaulted by her 45-year-old teacher. Based on a report by the Vellore district child protection officer, the school management placed the teacher under suspension from Wednesday.

P Nishanthini, district child protection officer of Vellore, said that based on a tip received on WhatsApp, on Monday child protection officials paid a visit to the school which has around 250 boys and girls studying in Class VI to X.

“When we checked the attendance register of Class VI, the victim was marked absent from February 3. Inquiries revealed that the girl was unable to recover from the trauma and decided to drop out of school. We, along with the child welfare committee, are initiating steps to find the girl now with her distant relative and make her continue studies in a school she prefers,” Nishanthini said.

Quoting a girl student, Nishanthini said the victim stayed at her grandmother’s house near the school. Suresh Kumar, 45, her class teacher, had been molesting the girl for more than six months after taking her to remote spots during class hours and had threatened her of dire consequences if she reveals it to her relatives, Nishanthini said. “A month ago some Class X students caught Suresh Kumar sexually assaulting the girl and informed the victim’s grandmother. From February 3, the girl stopped attending school,” she added.

When TOI contacted a relative of the girl, he said that over the past two years, more than three sexual assault complaints were lodged against Suresh Kumar by parents of three girl students. However, the headmaster of the school issued only a warning instead of escalating the matter to the management and education department, he said. “We demand appropriate action both against Suresh Kumar and the headmaster,” he added.

Meanwhile, based on a report by the district child protection unit, the management launched a departmental inquiry against Suresh Kumar.

Title: Four PU students on hunger strike against fee hike faint
Content:
Puducherry: Four of the five students of Pondicherry University , who were on a hunger strike from February 29 demanding that the administration revoke increase in fees, fainted and were admitted in a private medical college and hospital on Wednesday.

Theerdha Thulasi, 19, a second year MSc (physics) integrated student, fainted on the fifth day of the strike in the morning. She was rushed to Pondicherry Institute of Medical Sciences (Pims) where she was administered intravenous fluids. Soon, three other fasting students lost consciousness and were also rushed to Pims. All the four were discharged after treatment in the evening. Another group of five students commenced the relay indefinite hunger strike from Wednesday at the administrative block.

Meanwhile, the university administration has directed the protesting students to clear the administrative block and shift to Ponlait students’ corner on the campus. Registrar in-charge B Chithra in a notice said the university has earmarked an area (Ponlait students’ corner) on the campus for holding protests and agitations as followed by other central universities.

She warned that the university will take appropriate action as per the code of conduct and discipline mentioned in the prospectus against the students violating the orders. The university maintained that the fees were not hiked for several years and the fees for some courses were not increased since the inception of the university. The revision after nearly a decade (for some courses after more than three decades) would naturally show an exponential increase and not a linear increase. Except for some professional courses like MBA and computer science, the fees for the rest of the courses have been increased by 39% or less.

The students, however, refused to follow the university’s order and vowed that they will not move an inch until their demands are met. “We have heard your diktats. We have heard your silence. We have seen your violence and arrogance. We read your four pages of threat thinly disguised as appeals to our students, and we only have four words in reply to all your sincere efforts: Not an inch back: Fees must fall,” said students’ union president Parichay Yadav.

Title: Lorry driver, 25, gets four 5-year RIs for raping girl, 16
Content:
Puducherry: Principal district and sessions judge P Dhanabal has convicted a 25-year old man to four five-year rigorous imprisonment terms, one-year rigorous imprisonment and a three-month jail term for sexually assaulting a girl , raping her, trespassing into her house and hurting her in the Union territory of Puducherry. All terms will run concurrently.

The judge set off the period of sentence he had served in jail after his arrest. Judge Dhanabal, however, acquitted his friend booked on charges of abetting the crime.

According to special public prosecutor N Balamurugan, the convicted man, a lorry driver , and his friend from Reddiarpalaym approached a 16-year-old girl when she was alone at her house on April 17, 2015. The driver sought details and phone numbers of her neighbour, who had vacated the house recently. The girl told them that she did not have any information about her neighbour and attempted to lock the door.

However, the lorry driver managed to sneak into the house, overpowered and punched her on the face. He switched on the television and kept the volume high so that neighbours would not hear her screams for help and raped her. His friend stood guard when he committed the crime. The lorry driver abandoned he victim and escaped after she fainted.

The girl’s mother and sisters reached the house in a few minutes and she informed them about the incident. Her mother lodged a complaint with the D Nagar police, who booked the man under sections 6 (punishment for aggravated penetrative sexual assault) and Section 10 (punishment for aggravated sexual assault) of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act and Sections 376 (punishment for rape ), 452 (house-trespass alter preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint), 506 (punishment for criminal intimidation) and 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt) of the Indian Penal Code.
