AHMEDABAD: A family court on Wednesday ordered that a 25-year-old man be put behind bars for 480 days for not paying maintenance to his estranged wife and disobeying a court order.

The court issued an arrest warrant for Mohammed Afzal Shaikh , a resident of Danilimda , and directed the city police commissioner to execute the warrant. This happened because Shaikh's wife, Aksa (21), requested the court to recover the maintenance money from her husband, said Aksa's advocate, Salim Saiyed.

The court ordered 480 days in jail for Shaikh because he defaulted on maintenance for this number of days. He was supposed to pay Rs 81,000 to his wife upon a court order.

According to Saiyed, the couple married in 2018 but the woman left the matrimonial home because of marital discord. She moved the family court and sought maintenance from her husband, who is in the transport business.

On November 14, 2019, the court ordered the husband to pay Rs 5,000 monthly maintenance to his wife from July 17, 2018, the day she had filed the application. The court also ordered him to pay Rs 1,000 to his wife towards legal expenditure. In November 2019, Aksa filed another application in the court and urged the court to recover the dues of Rs 81,000 as ordered from her husband.

The man did not heed the court summons. The court finally passed an order for a jail term for the man equal to the number of days he had defaulted on the payment and issued an arrest warrant, the woman's lawyer said.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Fresh group of 18 Italians quarantined at Jaipur hotel
Content: JAIPUR: A group of 18 Italian tourists, who reached Jaipur from Agra on Wednesday, has been quarantined at a hotel on Govind Marg in Raja Park area. They do not have symptoms of coronavirus As soon as the group reached the city, health officials were informed about it. They swung into action and conducted screening for influenza-like illness of the group on Wednesday."We have conducted screening of all the 18 Italian tourists. No one has the symptoms of coronavirus (Covid-19). We have asked them to remain in their rooms and do not venture outside," a senior health department official told TOI.It was the second group of Italian tourists reaching Jaipur in the past six days. An Italian tourist couple of the first group has already tested positive for Covid-19. They are undergoing treatment at the isolation ward of the Sawai Man Singh Hospital. Taking all the precautions, the health department is continuously monitoring their health. The group landed at Delhi airport on February 26. Then they flew to Varanasi, where they spent three nights. They came back to Delhi and travelled by bus to reach Agra, where they spent two nights. From Agra, they travelled by bus and reached Jaipur late on Tuesday night.Among the 18 Italian tourists, there are two doctors, who are constantly monitoring the health of the rest of the group. All of them have their own individual thermometer and they keep monitoring their body temperature. Also, they are taking all precautions and are using masks.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Coast guard men dive deep to retrieve 14kg smuggled gold at Gulf of Mannar
Content:
Gold biscuits worth 6 crore wrapped in a piece of cloth were found by divers about one nautical mile from the shore.

Reason for dropping gold into sea yet to be ascertained

MADURAI: In a possible first major seizure of smuggled gold hidden in the sea in southern parts of Tamil Nadu , more than 14kg of gold biscuits wrapped in a piece of cloth were retrieved from the Gulf of Mannar in a joint operation by Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and officials of the directorate of revenue intelligence (DRI) on Wednesday. The gold worth more than Rs 6 crore was found by divers around one nautical mile (1.85km) from the shore at a depth of 14.5 feet to 16.5 feet after a two-hour-long search.ICG officials said they conducted a search in the sea on Tuesday based on specific intelligence input about gold being smuggled in from Sri Lanka to Ramanathapuram and apprehended two men from an unregistered boat around 2.30pm. The men from Ramanathapuram district were detained nearly 2.5km off Vedalai village towards Manoli Island – about 3.5km from Mandapam.“We suspected that they dropped something in the sea after seeing us because there was no fish on the boat. The nets were also dry and neatly packed with no sign of fishing activity,” an officer involved in the operation told TOI.ICG divers attached to the antismuggling unit in Mandapam searched the spot for nearly two hours but could not find anything. The area was cordoned off and guarded by ICG vessels till Wednesday morning when the search resumed. Meanwhile, DRI personnel found a GPS device on the boat with a specific location marked on it. When asked about it, the men confessed to smuggling gold and abandoning it at the place so they could go back and retrieve it later.On Wednesday, a team of 20 personnel and officers from the ICG and the DRI including three divers conducted a search with the help of a hovercraft and interceptor craft.After about 2 hours, the divers found a cloth pack with five black packs in it. Back on the shore, when the package was opened, they found gold biscuits concealed in one of the packs. It was handed over to DRI for further investigations. The source of the gold, the destination and the reason behind dropping it in the sea are being probed. ICG officials said this was the first time the DRI approached them for an operation in the sea.Sources said names of the duo could not be revealed as it could help others involved in the act go underground. On Wednesday evening, DRI sleuths picked up two men from Maraikayar Pattinam village in Tuticorin for questioning for their suspected role in the smuggling.

Title: Bihar: Neighbour's driver among 7 held for loot
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: Seven persons, including a driver and former guard of Chatth Dham apartment, were arrested on Wednesday for their alleged involvement in jewellery and other valuables loot from a flat of chartered accountant A Bandopadhayay on February 27.

Bandopadhayay and his wife, both in their early 70s, were alone when four armed criminals barged into their flat around 7pm and decamped with valuables after staying there for 20 minutes. They had also thrashed the couple. The apartment is located at Rajendra Nagar under Kadamkuan police station in state capital.

Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma said those arrested were identified as former guard Manoj Kumar , driver Santosh Kumar Manjhi, jeweller Anil Prasad, Manish Kumar , Vijay Kumar, Bittu Kumar and Sonu Kumar. "They were arrested from different places in Patna, Vaishali and Saran districts. Criminals had given the looted jewellery to Anil for selling at Garkha in Saran," he said.

"Santosh worked as a driver of Bandopadhayay's neighbour while Manoj lived in a single room on the apartment's terrace for more than 15 years even after leaving the guard's job. Manoj had roped in Santosh for loot. They thought the couple had jewellery and cash worth several lakh in their flat," the SSP said.

He said Manoj had contacted one more person in Saran through which four criminals were hired for the loot. "Manoj cut the CCTV camera cable in the apartment almost a week before the incident while Santosh went to Kolkata for avoiding suspicion. It surfaced during investigation that Manoj was moving on a two-wheeler in front of the apartment during the loot," the SSP said.

He said Manoj spilled the beans during investigation and revealed the names of his associates involved in the crime. The SSP said looted jewellery, two looted cellphones, two-wheeler and cloths used by criminals in crime, anaesthetic chemical used on Bandopadhayay's wife to make her unconscious, one country-made pistol, one live cartridge and a knife were seized from the arrested criminals.

Title: India must keep playing fearless cricket: Jhulan Goswami
Content: KOLKATA: India have had a perfect ride so far in the Women's T20 World Cup in Australia. Right from the opening match of the tournament, when they stunned the hosts, to making the semifinals with an all-win record, Harmanpreet Kaur 's girls have surprised one and all.If the group-stage performance is anything to go by, India have the firepower to win their maiden T20 World Cup title this year, feels former India skipper Jhulan Goswami . However, India will face their biggest hurdle in the semifinal, where they will face England.India have never beaten Heather Knight 's side in the competition, a run which includes an eight-wicket defeat in the 2018 semifinals in West Indies."As far as I am concerned, reaching the semifinals in itself is an achievement and the team has done that by beating top sides like Australia and New Zealand. They should continue to play fearless cricket and go for the kill. Facing England should not matter to them," said Jhulan, who is currently playing the domestic one-day meet in Una.India eves had a fantastic prelude to their World Cup campaign. They finished runners-up in the tri-series in Australia just before the World Cup. Jhulan feels holding nerves would be key to the knockout games. "India have handled pressure well so far. In the semifinal a lot will depend on how you execute your plan and definitely there will be the luck element," she added.India's batting hasn't looked good so far with star opener Smriti Mandhana (38 runs in 3 matches) and skipper Harmanpreet (26 runs from four matches) failing to fire.Jhulan is not ready to read too much into this. "They both are brilliant cricketers. I have not seen Harman failing to score for this long, but that can happen to any player. I am sure she will bounce back. Even Smriti is due for a big one," Jhulan added. Despite their top guns failing India have found a fearless warrior in Rohtak-born youngster Shafali Verma ."Shafali is an exciting player. The team management was right in giving her the licence to express herself. She has given India those cracking starts, making best use of the powerplay. It's great to watch her exquisite shots."The Indian bowlers too have been in phenomenal form, especially legspinner Poonam Yadav, who bamboozled Australia in the opening match and is leading the charts with nine scalps."Poonam has been exceptional. She holds key to the team's success. The bowling unit has been very disciplined and has helped defend low totals. Shikha too has been fantastic. She is the lone medium-pacer in the side and has played her role to perfection."

Title: Myths around the side effects of Sugar Free that you must not believe!
Content: Feel at home with Malaysia Airlines’ Business Class: Get up to 35% off on fares

Title: SSC CHSL Admit Card 2020 for Tier 1 released
Content: NEW DELHI: Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has released the admit card for Combined Higher Secondary (10+2) Level Examination (CHSL) 2019 on its regional portal of Central Region.As of now, SSC has released admit card for Central Region only. The SSC CHSL admit card 2020 for other regions will be released soon. Once the admit cards are released, the candidates who applied for the SSC CHSL 2019 examination can visit the respective regional websites of SSC to download the admit card.SSC has scheduled to conduct the CHSL 2019 Tier I examination from March 17 to March 28, 2020. The candidates who qualify SSC CHSL Tier I examination will be eligible for SSC CHSL Tier II examination.SSC is conducting CHSL examinations for the recruitment to the Lower Divisional Clerk/ Junior Secretariat Assistant, Postal Assistant/ Sorting Assistant and Data Entry Operators posts.The online application process for SSC CHSL 2019 exam commenced on December 3, 2019, and closed on January 10, 2020. The last date to make online fee payment was January 12, 2020.The candidates should carry two passport size recent colour photographs and one original valid Photo ID Proof such as Aadhaar Card/ printout of E-Aadhaar, Driving License, Voter Card, PAN Card, Identity Card issued by University/ College/ Government, Employer ID Card or any photo bearing ID card issued by Central/ State Government to the Examination Venue, failing which they will not be allowed enter the examination hall. If the photo identity card does not have the Date of Birth (DOB) printed in it, then the candidate should carry an additional original certificate in proof of their DOB.In case of mismatch in the date of birth mentioned in the admit card and Photo ID/ Certificate brought in support of date of birth, the candidate will not be allowed to appear in the SSC CHSL examination.

Title: Bihar: One more held for advocate's murder
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: The main accused in the sales tax advocate Satyendra Kumar murder case was arrested on Wednesday. He was murdered near his house at Sheetal Tola under Town police station of Ara in Bhojpur district on February 22. Town police station SHO Janmejay Rai said main accused Guddu was arrested from Paswan Chowk under Nawada police station.

Ara Bar Association secretary Vidya Niwas Singh alias Deepak Singh demanded speedy trial of the case in order to provide justice to the advocate's family. One Rajesh was earlier arrested while Guddu remained at large. The lawyers of Ara had abstained from court work for 4 days from February 28 till March 2 to demand the arrest of the main accused.

Title: Ahmedabad woman tries to kill self with diabetes pill overdose
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 35-year-old woman from Chandkheda tried to commit suicide on Tuesday evening by swallowing at least 20 diabetes pills used to control blood sugar . Apparently, she was angry with her husband who had beaten her after she tried to stop him from beating their 7-year-old son.

According to the FIR registered with Chandkheda police, the woman’s husband was annoyed with their 7-year-old son who was doing mischief at home. Her husband suddenly started beating him. The woman tried to save the boy, but her husband beat her instead. “As I was hurt with my husband’s behaviour, I took 20 pills of diabetes and tried to commit suicide,” she stated in her statement with Chandkheda police.

The woman fell sick and her husband took her to a nearby private hospital. “She fainted after and her blood pressure was very low when she was brought to the hospital,” said a police official.

A Chandkheda police official said that the woman had stated that her husband had often beaten her over petty issues during the 10 years of their married life. She said he had also kept demanding more dowry from her parents.

She said that her in-laws and husband used to pressure her to seek money from her parents so that they can buy a new house.

After recording her statement, Chandkheda police registered a complaint of domestic violence, causing hurt and abetment along with charges of dowry prohibition act and began an investigation.

Title: Italian coronavirus patient being treated with HIV, swine flu & malaria medicines
Content: JAIPUR: With limited options available for treatment of coronavirus, the doctors at SMS Hospital are providing drugs used for treatment for malaria, swine flu and HIV to the Italian patient with coronavirus (Covid-19). The 69-year-old patient is undergoing treatment at ICU of Isolation Hospital attached to SMS Hospital."We are providing him treatment while keeping him in isolation. We are providing him tamiflu (oseltamivir) which is effective in treatment of swine flu. We are providing him chloroquine which is an effective drug in treatment of malaria and two drugs used in the treatment of HIV/AIDS. These are four medicines which we are providing him," said health minister Raghu Sharma.He clarified these drugs are not 'officially announced' drugs for treatment of Covid-19 but it can minimise the problem which he is facing. "As of now, there is no treatment available for Covid-19 according to the World Health Organisation guidelines. There is no treatment available for Covid-19. Also, the vaccines have not been developed yet. According to the SMS Medical College official report on treatment of Italian patient, it mentions, "As per new guidelines following two drugs IV remdesivir/lapinavir and ritonavir have been tried in various studies out of which remdesivir may not be available in India. We would like to procure remdesivir or any new drug which has been tested for therapeutic treatment so far, through the concerned embassy. Meanwhile, we are treating him by IV antibiotics, chloroquine and oseltamivir."However, doctors have also started lopinavir/ritonavir a protease inhibitor combination used to treat HIV."The doctors who are the first contact with diseased corona patients are waiting for clear directions from government of Rajasthan. In the meeting, it was discussed. They asked for protocol based treatment and guidelines for covid-19 for all doctors of private or government for Covid-19," said, Dr Tarun Patni, president, Jaipur Medical Association The Italian patient is on ventilator and is battling for life. The doctors have put him on bipap machine. Wife of 69-year-old Italian tourist, is suffering from fever, running nose and cough as she has also been tested positive for coronavirus. She is undergoing treatment at Isolation hospital of Sawai Man Singh medical college along with her husband. "She is fine and her condition has not deteriorated. We are giving her symptomatic treatment. However, her husband's condition is stable, it has neither improved nor deteriorated. He is undergoing on ventilator support," Dr DS Meena, medical superintendent, SMS Hospital said.

Title: Coronavirus in Bihar: Covid-19 in Bihar: 2,000 masks, kits ready for supply to hospitals in district
Content: PATNA: The district administration has geared up with preventive measures in view of novel coronavirus (Covid-19) spread in many countries.About 2,000 universal protection kits and N95 masks are ready for supply to hospitals, said Patna civil surgeon Dr Raj Kishore Chaudhary on Wednesday. He said the person who returned from Malaysia was examined at the Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) on Tuesday and his blood sample had been sent to Kolkata for test. "The person, residing in an apartment in the state capital, was advised to stay at home till the test report is received," he said.Three medical teams were already deputed at the airport for medically examine the passengers coming from foreign countries or who recently had visited any of the affected countries. More teams were kept ready for examining passengers at the railway stations and bus stands, he said.Besides, all the 23 primary health centres (PHCs) were directed to make people aware of this disease and take precautionary measures. Chaudhary said the PHCs, in coordination with the BDOs and ASHAs would seek information whether any villager recently returned from the affected countries or having primary symptoms of coronavirus.PMCH has made an isolation ward in the old building central emergency having six rooms equipped with necessary instruments and masks, said Dr Abhijit Singh, incharge of the central emergency. tnn

Title: ‘The Batman’: Director Matt Reeves reveals first look of Batmobile and Robert Pattinson in full Batsuit
Content: After the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Forensic Medical Board ruled out the murder angle in Sushant Singh Rajput’s death report, an audio tape of Dr Sudhir Gupta has been leaked wherein he reportedly claims that the late actor was ‘murdered’. When ETimes reached out to Sushant Singh Rajput’s family lawyer Vikas Singh for his reaction on the same, he stated, “To be honest, I tweeted my stand yesterday but I would like to speak to him before I take a final call. He is not answering my phone, what if he changes his stand, one doesn’t know. I will wait till I can talk to him.”

Title: Italian tourists' team toured six districts in 9 days: Rajasthan home minister
Content: JAIPUR: Health minister Raghu Sharma said in the assembly on Wednesday that the 23-member Italian tourists' group, tested positive for coronavirus carriers, visited six districts during February 21-29.Sharma said the Italian patient with 22 co-passengers arrived at New Delhi airport from Italy on February 21 and reached Mandawa (Jhunjhunu) Hotel Castle by bus the same day."On February 22, they reached Ganjakesari Hotel, Bikaner, then stayed at Rangmahal Hotel in Jaisalmer on February 23-24, Dal Hotel Jonpark, Jodhpur, on February 25, Hotel Trident Udaipur on February 26-28 and Hotel Ramada in Jaipur on February 28. On February 28, the patient was admitted to Fortis Hospital , Jaipur, due to health issues."Sharma said, the patient was examined on February 29 after being admitted to the isolation ward of SMS Hospital on suspicion of coronavirus infection. He tested negative in the first test but in the second examination he tested positive, Sharma added. The NIV, Pune, report confirmed the case of coronavirus.

Title: Coronavirus in Pune: Four-fold rise in demand for N95 masks, hand sanitisers in Pune
Content: PUNE: The demand for N95 masks and hand sanitisers soared by 200% in the city on Wednesday amid panic-buying to counter novel coronavirus (Covid-19) infection, leading to a shortfall and price rise at many locations.“Till Tuesday, I was selling 1,000 N95 masks per day in the wholesale market, the sale skyrocketed to 25,000 on Wednesday as the news of more positive cases in the country started making rounds. Similarly, I sold 6,000 bottles of hand sanitisers on Wednesday as against 600 units the previous day. If the sale continues like this, we will soon face severe shortage of personal protection equipment,” a wholesaler operating out of Sadashiv Peth said.The city had an acute shortage of N95 masks during early January as well, following significant rise in their exports to Covid-19-affected nations. The situation was then mitigated after a ban on exports.Sushil Shah president of the Chemists Association of Pune District confirmed the panicbuying and said, “Though not a single positive case has been reported in Maharashtra, the demand for N95 masks, sanitisers, thermometers and gloves has increased to an extent that we are encountering a sudden shortage. If the trend continues, the shortage will only become severe in the coming days.”He said 50ml and 100ml bottles of hand sanitisers were already in short supply in the city. “We currently have hand sanitiser bottles of 400ml, which are selling for Rs 450 in the retail market,” Shah said.Rohit Karpe, distributor of N95 mask in Pune, said, “The manufactures have also raised the price of the mask in the wholesale market from Rs 27-40 per unit to Rs 85-120. The mask is sold in retail market at Rs 200 onwards as it is not covered under drugs nor under any controlled category.”“As per the WHO, only medical staff involved in the care of isolated travellers and immediate contacts should wear masks. Other people should not panic and rush to buy them,” eye surgeon Sanjay Patil, president of the city chapter of Indian Medical Association, said.

Title: Pune Coronavirus News: Canine coronavirus vaccine demand soars amid misconceptions and panic in Pune
Content: PUNE: Optional and often skipped canine coronavirus vaccine has suddenly caught the eyes of dog owners in the city, with many confusing it to be a shot against the novel coronavirus infection.Pet parent Tanya Ginwala did not know about the vaccine for the past 12 years, when she got her dog. "After I came to know about the novel coronavirus (Covid-19) outbreak in China and other countries, I promptly took my dog to a veterinarian and got it vaccinated," she said.Baner resident Manjeet Kaul, another pet parent who got her dog vaccinated, said, "I adopted a German Shepherd some days back and decided to get its check-up done as a precautionary measure after hearing about the coronavirus outbreak."Veterinarian Milind Mhatre, however, clarified that the canine coronavirus vaccine was not to safeguard pets against the Covid-19 infection. "It was an optional shot, which pet parents used to skip from the list of annual vaccinations. Since the Covid-19 outbreak in China and other nations, pet parents have suddenly started getting their dogs administered with the canine coronavirus vaccine. I used to administer about 20 canine coronavirus vaccines in a month earlier, but the number has gone up to 35 now," he said.Mhatre said while people were getting the shot administered to their pets in panic, they should understand that the vaccine was for different purposes. "Covid-19 is a different strain of the coronavirus family altogether," he said.A veterinarian claimed that samples from a dog's nasal and oral cavities in Hong Kong had tested positive for the novel coronavirus infection last Friday. "It is believed to be the first dog in the world to test positive for Covid-19. However, no research is available to prove that dogs and cats can be infected by Covid-19," he clarified."Dogs use smell and tongue as a means of sense. The dog owner in Hong Kong was infected and I believe that dog also got infected due to contact. Canine coronavirus has been there for very long, but Covid-19, which a mutated strain of the virus, is what is affecting humans. The canine coronavirus causes gastrointestinal problems in dogs, unlike the respiratory issues caused by Covid-19 in humans. However, panic-stricken pet owners are opting to administer the vaccine to their pets," Jeya Bharath, a veterinarian with a clinic on Sus Road, said."The strain of the current outbreak of coronavirus is completely different from the one that dogs and cats get infected with. Megavac CC is the vaccine meant for canine coronavirus and has been available in the market for nearly 15 to 20 years," Bhavya Kumar, another veterinarian, said.

Title: CIL Answer Key: Coal India MT Answer Key released at coalindia.in
Content:
Open the official website of Coal India Limited - coalindia.in

Click on the CIL Management Trainee Response Sheet link available under 'Latest' section

Click on the Answer Key link to download it

Download the answer key for reference

Next, mark your objection(s), if any and upload them on the website with supporting proof

NEW DELHI: Coal India Limited (CIL) has released the Response Sheet for the Computer-Based Test (CBT) conducted for Management Trainee on February 28, 2020, at various centres across India.The CIL Management Trainee Answer Key 2020 is now available on the official website of the CIL - coalindia.in. The candidates who appeared in the CIL Management Trainee recruitment examination are advised to visit the official website of the CIL to check and download the answer keys.In the press release, the CIL has mentioned that the comments/objections if any, regarding questions/answers in the Computer Based Online Test (CBT) for Management Trainee Recruitment Advertisement No. 01/2019 held on 27.O2.2O20, can be submitted online through the official website from March 5, 2020, 09:00 AM to March 10, 2020, 09:00 AM. Objections through any other mode will not be entertained by the authority.The candidates who appear for the Management Trainee exam can follow the simple steps given below to check and download the answer keys through the official website:

Title: Horoscope Today, 5 March 2020: Check daily astrological prediction for Aries, Taurus, Gemini, Cancer and other signs
Content:
Wondering whether it will be a power-packed day or a dull, cumbersome one? We have you covered. Read on to know…

Aries

Today , you may have good patience, meditation may help you to increase concentration, which will speed up your project. Your subordinates may cooperate with you, it may help you to complete the project before time. There may be some short travels , related to work. You may likely to meet an influential person , who may help you to boost your business and help you gain success.

Taurus

Today you may spend to buy some creative or artefact to renovate your house, which may increase your social status. You may implement some new plans into your family business , it will pay you in term of gains in near future. You may also be busy in family or social get together that may give you profits and you will do well.

Gemini

Today is a good day for you. You may have good vitality and health. You may enjoy your work. Today your challenge is to avoid straightforwardness. It is advised to avoid arguments on worthless topics, otherwise there may be some disputes in the family. Job seekers may find suitable job. Love birds are advised to avoid making arguments on worthless topics.

Cancer

Today you are affected by negative moon. You may feel unhappy, you may become impatient today, you may find yourself unable to perform your task and not able to fulfil your desire. You will to be detached from the given responsibility. You may not be able to complete any task.

Leo

Today ,you are blessed by the moon. Work related pressure may ease off now. Your earnings may convert into profits now. You are likely to invest for a long term period. You may get an overseas work order, which may give you financial benefits in coming future. You may find your soul mate. Students may hear good news in their academics.

Virgo

Today you are blessed by positive moon, you may perform good in your professional front. You may implement your business plans very easily with the help of your colleagues. Intellectual investments and financial investments may start giving profits now, which may increase confidence level. You may use your wisdom to gain benefits.

Libra

Today , you are blessed by moon. Your spiritual power may make you happy. Your way of thinking may be positive. You are inclined to spiritualism today. You may plan to visit some religious place. You may also take interest in occult science. You are likely to observe flawlessness in your nature. It is advised to keep your views with you only, try to discuss with those person, who may understand your feelings.

Scorpio

Today, you may feel nervous , you may have lack of patience, for seeking peace you may be attracted by occult, it is advised to follow your intuition before going ahead. You may also get depth knowledge on a subject or you may have a good focus towards your research. Chanting mantra may help you in this situation.

Sagittarius

Today, you are blessed by positive moon and Jupiter , which may help you to improve your inner strength. You are likely to get some new opportunities for your business and work, which will pay you in terms of gains in near future. Couples may to hear good news in terms of child birth. Love birds are advised to be clear in their opinion with each other to make their future bright.

Capricorn

Today you are blessed by moon, things are now under control. Your performance may be praised by your seniors and you may expect promotions. Money which was stuck , is likely to be recovered now, it may help in increase liquidity in the business. There may be some good news in terms of legal matters also. In the partnerships , many issues are likely to be resolved now.

Aquarius

Today, you may hear a good news in terms of job. Job seekers may be focused to crack entrance exams with the help of hard work. Singles may hear good news in terms of marriage. Couples may here some good news in terms of child birth.

Pisces

Today, you may plan for a change in place, it is advised to postpone the decision related to migration. It is also advised to avoid investment in business. Dull feeling may make you upset. By the late evening, situation may be under control. With the help of good advice from one of the elders, you may control the messy situation.

The author, Samir Jain, is a Jaipur based astrologer who is an expert in astrology, numerology, palmistry and Vastu. He is also an expert in Jain Temple Vastu and Jain Jyotish. Over the last several years, he has consulted clients from the USA, Brazil, Mexico, Canada, the UK, Australia, Turkey, France, Italy, South Africa, and Germany.

#astrology #horoscope #dailyhoroscope #horoscopetoday #horoscopemarch #marchhoroscope

Title: Government tells hotels to put in place preventive measures for coronavirus
Content: JAIPUR: A health department order on Wednesday wanted the hotel industry to avoid large gatherings of people in view of the holi festivities and share information about tourists coming from sensitive countries who carry risks of spreading coronavirus According to the order, the hotels are also required to inform the chief medical and health officer about the tourists coming from China, Hong Kong, South Korea, Japan, Italy, Iran, and Nepal so that screening for coronavirus can be done immediately.Hotel industry at the forefront of Covid-19's impact on businesses has already started taking preventive measures after the Italian tourists tested positive in a city hotel."We have provided sanitizers at every service area of the hotel and made sure that staff are using masks. We have also informed the staff to report any guest showing signs of illness," said a senior official of a star hotel.A general manager of a hotel said that they are screening every vendor who are entering, by checking their temperature, cough and cold. "We cannot do that with every guest as it looks odd. But we have a dedicated to team who are keeping a watch on the guests for visible illness," he said.Meanwhile, hotel Ramada where the infected Italian couple stayed has been disinfected twice said the five staff who were quarantined have tested negative in the first report"Immediately after receiving the information and as advised by the concerned government authorities the hotel has at once implemented the due diligence and precautionary steps strictly as per the directive from the Chief Medical & Health officer and as per the guidelines from the government of India," said Atal Saran Bhargava , general manager of hotel Ramada, adding that the five staff who have been quarantined have tested negative in the first report.When TOI spoke to hotel Marriott, it said in a statement that the chain will continue to follow recommended procedures and protocols issued by the Ministry of Health and World Health Organization 's statements and follow guidelines on hygiene practices from these agencies and the local health departments.

Title: Riots in Delhi: IB official may have been killed to send a message
Content:
The intelligence establishment - after analysing the prima facie sequence of events, some statements and initi... Read More

NEW DELHI: The investigation into the death of intelligence official Ankit Sharma , according to multiple sources, indicates that there was a strong possibility of it being a "targeted killing" and not a random act of violence.

The police have pieced together an initial sequence of events. Sharma had returned from office around 5pm on February 25 and stepped out with his friends. He, along with his friend, Kalu, and a few others were on one side of a 'pulia' (small bridge) while heavy stone-pelting was on from the other side. Sharma was at the front.

Eyewitnesses have told police that Sharma tripped over a stone and fell. Three-four men came from the other side and overpowered Sharma, who was then dragged away to the other side. "Curiously, they did not touch anyone else but him," said a source.

Sharma was possibly taken to a confined location (a house) as nobody saw him after. That's where he is suspected to have been stripped and brutalised. His body was then dragged to the drain and dumped. The body, which had only undergarments on it, was fished out from the drain the next day.

The intelligence establishment - after analysing the prima facie sequence of events, some statements and initial medical opinion - is convinced that Sharma's death appeared to be a murder with a motive. "The sequence indicates that the killers may have been trying to send across a message. This is bigger than what meets the eye," a senior intelligence officer told TOI on Wednesday.

While the exact number of injuries on his body are not clear yet, doctors conducting the post-mortem had told a cop present there that it had at least 54 deep stab wounds.

Talking about 'targeted killing' becoming the strongest line of probe, an investigator said: "The fact that Sharma was abducted and taken away and not killed or harmed at the spot by the mob had raised suspicion at first. The theory has only been strengthened as the sequence of events has become clearer. Vengeance is clearly visible by the condition of the body. Nobody is killed like this usually by a mob," he added.

Asked if they had any leads on suspects, a senior police officer said they were trying to identify the people who dragged him away based on the details of their appearance as recalled by eyewitnesses. "Leads from technical surveillance in the area is awaited. We are also trying to trace a group of Bangladeshi criminals whose location has come in the area around that time," he added.



In Video: Delhi riots: IB official Ankit Sharma's murder a 'targeted killing'?

Title: Maharashtra: Exiled for extra-marital fling, 'killer' Maoist in police net
Content:
Representative image

GADCHIROLI: One of the wanted Maoist masterminds of the Jambhulkheda blast last year that killed 15 Maharashtra policemen and a driver was on Wednesday arrested along with his second wife on the outskirts of Gadchiroli, where he had been left to fend for himself after ostensibly falling out with fellow cadres over his extra-marital relationship.

Dinkar Gota, a divisional committee member of the Korchi Dalam's north Gadchiroli unit, and his second wife Sunanda Koreti together had a bounty of Rs 18 lakh on their heads. The NIA might seek Gota's custody for its probe into the blast case, officials said.

Gota has a total of 108 offences against his name, including 33 murders. He along with two absconding Maoist functionaries - Bhaskar Hichami and Satish ؙ- are suspected to have planned and executed the arson at Dadapur village on May 1 last year in which 400-500 cadres torched 36 vehicles of a road construction company.

The Maoists later booby-trapped a police quick-response team on its way to Purada police station to investigate the arson. The team, led by then SDPO Shailesh Kale, drove straight into the trap laid by the attackers at Jambhulkheda. As soon as the private vehicle ferrying them reached a small bridge over Lendhari Nullah, an IED blast killed all 16 inside.

While Gota eluded capture for almost a year after the twin attacks, his private life seemingly proved his undoing. Sources said the Maoist functionary fell foul of Korchi Dalam's top-rung functionaries over his decision to leave his first wife Sunita. The latter, a member of the Tippagarh Dalam, surrendered last year after her husband grew close to Sunanda, who has 38 police cases registered against her.

It was after Sunita's surrender that the outfit issued a strict warning to Gota to dissociate himself from Sunanda. He was on the verge of being suspended when he deserted the group along with Sunanda last September, sources said .

Gadchiroli SP Shailesh Balkawade said there was "a strong rumour" earlier this year about Gota being killed by his fellow cadres. "We were hot on his trail since he left the outfit. The arrest of Gota and his wife is the outcome of the cumulative effort of our intelligence unit, technical cell and the special investigation team."Sources said Gota and Sunanda had been living a quiet life in relative anonymity at a village near the police headquarters. Their mobile phones ultimately gave them away.

Balkawade said separate cases had been registered against the duo for the Dadapur arson and the Jambhulkheda blast. "We have arrested Gota and Sunanda as part of the Dadapur arson probe and got a 14-day remand."

In another success, Gadchiroli police busted a Maoist camp in the Khobramenda forest on the northern side of the district early on Wednesday. Around 70-80 Maoists were attending a camp when C-60 commandos stormed the place.

Title: Coronavirus symptoms: When should you get yourself tested
Content: With India having confirmed 28 cases of coronavirus , it is leading to widespread panic. And naturally so, people are fearing every person who is coughing, sneezing or complaining of breathing issues. While it is important to be cautious, one shouldn’t panic. According to lifestyle coach Luke Coutinho, “Panic and fear solve no problems and actually raise cortisol levels which lowers immunity. And that is the quickest way for any virus to impact your health. Stay calm.”Dr Karan Madan, pulmonologist, AIIMS shared, “Most coronavirus symptoms are similar to common cold and flu. If you have mild symptoms, we would not recommend testing for coronavirus. If you have low grade fever, cough, it is best to rest and have lots of fluids. This isn’t the first coronavirus. There are 4 coronavirus types that are already in circulation and may cause slight respiratory issues. This is the 7th one and we need to look for patients demonstrating serious symptoms like high grade fever, breathlessness.”Dr Madan further added, “Influenza and coronavirus have similar symptoms. Right now it is difficult to substantiate it medically. So if you have a runny nose, slight cold and fever, you just need to focus on recovering by taking ample rest and maybe antiviral medicines.”Professor Ramanan Laxminarayan, director for Centre for Disease Dynamics, Economics and Policy, “If you are an elderly with other comorbidities, or have a heart issue, are a stroker or have severe respiratory issue, then you have more to worry about because unlike the 1982 pandemic which attacked most young population, this one is impacting more of elderly.”Talking about the preventive measures, he said, “Wash your hands, do not touch your face, exercise good hygiene practices, do not shake hands, and maintain distance from people who appear sick.” The vaccine for coronavirus may be 8-12 months away.If you are suspicious of some surface, get some hydrogen peroxide to clean it. Sneeze or cough like a vampire (in the crooks of your elbow) and educate others to do the same.

Title: Jaipur on alert for coronavirus, can deal with situation: CM
Content:
Representative image

JAIPUR: Appealing the people not to worry, chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said that the state government is alert and well equipped to deal with coronavirus (Covid-19). He said the government will take all measures to prevent the disease from spreading in the state.

While reviewing the situation in the state with health minister Raghu Sharma, chief secretary D B Gupta, additional chief secretary Rohit Kumar Singh and other health department officials and medical education department officials at his residence on Wednesday said that advisory should be issued to all the collectors of the districts visited by the group of Italian tourist, among them two were tested positive for Covid-19 in Sawai Man Singh Hospital.

Title: People's feedback negative, Andhra Pradesh cabinet sets NPR aside
Content:
Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy

VIJAYAWADA: A day after urging the Centre to remove the additional questions in NPR 2020, the AP Cabinet on Wednesday decided to keep National Population Register (NPR) in abeyance in the state. The NPR 2020 has several new questions added when compared to the previous exercise carried out in 2010. The additional questions relate to place and date of birth of the parents of the head of family.

The AP Cabinet felt that the government had received negative feedback from the people on the proposed implementation of NPR 2020. People have been raising objections to some of the additional questions included in the NPR and some sections of people are apprehensive of the intentions of the data collected during the exercise.

On Tuesday chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy made an appeal to the Central government to revert to the 2010 questions for the NPR 2020. The issue was discussed in the state Cabinet meeting on Wednesday.

The Cabinet appealed to the Central government to limit the questions to the 2010 NPR and drop the new questions added to the list to seek information from citizens. As the Central government is yet to respond, the state Cabinet had decided to keep the NPR exercise in abeyance.

Minister for information and public relations Perni Venkatramayya (Nani) told media persons that the Cabinet had discussed the objections received from several sections of people and felt that the objections were reasonable. "The doubts of the people are to be cleared and their objections are to be honoured and answered," the minister said.

Title: Awaiting transfer, Thane’s civic chief ‘leaves’ corp for ‘detox tour’
Content:
Sanjeev Jaiswal

THANE: Thane municipal chief Sanjeev Jaiswal on Wednesday announced his voluntary exit from the corporation where he had served for over five years and two months even as formal orders regarding his transfer from the government are yet to be issued. Jaiswal, an IAS officer of the 1996 batch, has proceeded on leave for a fortnight. He has been seeking a transfer since 2018.

It is learnt recent differences within his team over internal transfers proved to be the breaking point.

Jaiswal, who is known to have had an action-packed tenure, said he is embarking on a 10-day “detox tour” to the north, including Himachal Pradesh and Dharamshala, starting Thursday, and has handed over charge to his subordinate, additional commissioner Rajendra Ahiwar .

Jaiswal’s exit, just days before the civic budget, has taken both activists and politicians by surprise. While he refused to cite the reason for his sudden exit, it is learnt the commissioner was upset over an alleged “vertical split” in the administration with a few subordinates seeking political intervention in a series of transfers. Jaiswal has been in the news for frequent tiffs with the political class during his tenure.

He told mediapersons on Wednesday it was his final interaction with them and he did not wish to continue and was awaiting his next posting. He said he was happy as the lake city’s residents had showered him with love.

Meanwhile, he is believed to have surrendered his official car on Wednesday and is also likely to vacate his official bungalow at Patalipada in Thane and relocate to a personal residence in Bandra after he returns from the north.

Title: Realme 6, Realme 6 Pro to launch in India today: Here’s how to watch the live stream
Content:
Realme 6 Pro expected specifications

Realme 6 expected specifications

Realme Band

expected specifications

NEW DELHI: Chinese smartphone maker Realme is all set to launch its two latest smartphones in India. The company has scheduled an online event for today in which it will launch the Realme 6 and Realme 6 Pro smartphones. Along with smartphones, the company will also launch its first fitness band in the country. The customers who want to watch the launch event can livestream the same on the official YouTube account of the company. The live stream will begin at 12.30 pm today.The company has already confirmed that both Realme 6 and Realme 6 Pro will be available online on Flipkart and Realme.com.Talking about the price, the Realme India CMO has recently tweeted that Realme 6 Pro is not the successor of the last year launched Realme 5 and the smartphone will fall under a higher price category.As teased by the company, the Realme 6 Pro will offer 90Hz full HD+ display and dual punch-hole selfie camera. The smartphone will also come with a quad-camera setup with 64MP main sensor and 20x zoom support. The smartphone will come with 30W Flash Charge fast charging support. The smartphone is said to be powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 720G processor.Just like the Realme 6 Pro, Realme 6 will also come with 90Hz display. The smartphone will also come with 30W fast charging and sport multiple rear camera setup. The smartphone is expected to be powered by a MediaTek Helio G90 processor.Along with the two smartphones, the company will also launch its first fitness tracker — Realme Band in India. The smartphone is said to come with nine sports mode and a builtin USB Direct Charge port. The tracker will also come with an IP68 rating which makes it dust and water-resistant.

Title: From God's own country: Help to two Delhi girls to tie knot
Content:
Justice Kurian Joseph contributed Rs 1 lakh each for the two girls.

NEW DELHI: A group of Keralites has taken it upon itself to get two girls married off after their house in Khajuri Khas was set on fire and their jewellery looted during the riots in northeast Delhi. Justice Kurian Joseph , formerly of the Supreme Court, contributed Rs 1 lakh each to the fund being collected for the two girls.

Mohammad Asad, a labourer, lost his house in E Block of Khajuri Khas in which he lived with his family, including four sons and two daughters. His son Mohammad Salim Sheikh told TOI, "Last Monday, a mob looted us of the jewellery and cash meant for the wedding on March 29. A new bike meant to be a gift to the groom was also torched. They then set the house on fire, but we managed to save ourselves."

Some Keralities formed the Distress Management Collective on WhatsApp . Led by social activist Deepa Manoj, it has 186 people. "While distributing relief items, a woman emerged from a burnt house and sobbed that her daughter was to get married, but they had lost everything bought for the wedding," disclosed Deepa.

On March 2, at the group's meeting at Kerala School , Justice Joseph handed over two cheques of Rs 1 lakh each. "It is a humanitarian gesture for the girls who are like my daughters," the judge said.

Deepa said the group would arrange everything for the two weddings. A grateful Raseeda, mother of the girls, said "The help is a boon for us. I am heartbroken by the violence, but the marriage date is fixed and we have go through the rites."

Title: Maharashtra: 14 cops who caught Ajmal Kasab to get promotion
Content:
MUMBAI: Maharashtra government on Wednesday announced one-rank promotions for 14 policemen who displayed “historic valour” during the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks to capture terrorist Ajmal Kasab.

Home minister Anil Deshmukh told reporters outside the state legislature here, “Tukaram Omble, who was martyred during the 26/11 attacks, and 14 other policemen had captured (terrorist) Ajmal Kasab alive. The government has decided to proffer one rank promotion to the 14 policemen for showing historic valour.” They have already been given various honours.

Ten Pakistani terrorists had arrived here by sea and killed 166 people, including 18 security personnel, besides damaging property worth crores on November 26, 2008. The team manning a road block at Girgaum during the attack had accosted a hijacked Skoda car driven by Ismail Khan with Kasab in the next seat. In the brief but fierce gunfight that ensued, Khan was shot dead and an armed Kasab was nabbed early on November 27, 2008.

Kasab, the only Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist to be captured alive, was hanged on November 21, 2012.

Title: Gairsain named Uttarakhand's new summer capital
Content:
Trivendra Singh Rawat

GAIRSAIN: In a decision hailed as 'landmark and historic', CM Trivendra Singh Rawat announced in the state assembly on Wednesday soon after presenting the Budget that his government will make Gairsain the summer capital of Uttarakhand .

With this, Uttarakhand becomes the second state in the country after Jammu and Kashmir to have two state capitals.

After making the announcement, the chief minister said that modalities still have to be worked out on the duration (number of months each year) for which Gairsain, situated in Chamoli district of the state, would function as state capital. "We will sit together, work out the plan and make our preparations in this regard. The start has been made, and now we will proceed on this path," said the chief minister. On a query on how basic infrastructure issues would be addressed in the hill town, the CM acknowledged that water crisis was the biggest problem at Bharairisain - about 14 km from Gairsain - which houses the massive assembly building. "I have spoken to engineers, and asked them to develop a lake near Bhararisain , which can also cater to the water requirements of Gairsain area," Rawat said.

Rawat termed the decision a tribute to the people who fought for a separate state.

He said, "For decades, people wanted Gairsain as capital of the state, and we have fulfilled their request."

Title: Coronavirus in Visakhapatnam: 3 flee screening at Vizag airport, caught by cops
Content: VISAKHAPATNAM: Three passengers who arrived from Kuala Lumpur and were running fever, escaped from Visakhapatnam airport on Tuesday night after they were singled out following a thermoscan.Preparations were made to screen all the passengers when the three - the parents in their 50s and their daughter in her 20s - sneaked away from the airport under the pretext of going to washroom.CISF and airport authorities alerted the police and they were brought back to the airport area.They were sent to a government hospital. The 108 ambulance driver, followed by another ambulance service, refused to take them to the hospital. Finally, the district nodal officer for Covid-19 arranged a private ambulance. Dr P V Sudhakar, principal, Andhra Medical College , said: "Their attempt to evade screening could have put other passengers at risk."

Title: Google assistant: How hackers are looking to target Google Assistant and Apple’s Siri
Content:
NEW DELHI: Humans are not able to hear ultrasonic frequencies but smartphones are capable of that and hackers are now trying to exploit this functionality. According to a latest research finding, using this ultrasonic wave trick hackers can hack Google Assistant and Siri on your smartphones.

According to research carried out by Washington University , hackers can use the guided ultrasonic waves to fool the voice assistants and make them perform various actions. These actions include taking pictures, making calls, sending text messages and also just the volumes.

The researchers mention in a note, “By leveraging the unique properties of acoustic transmission in solid materials, we design a new attack called SurfingAttack that would enable multiple rounds of interactions between the voice-controlled device and the attacker over a longer distance and without the need to be in line-of-sight. By completing the interaction loop of inaudible sound attack, SurfingAttack enables new attack scenarios, such as hijacking a mobile Short Message Service (SMS) passcode, making ghost fraud calls without owners' knowledge, etc.”

The team also mentions that the Surfing Attack worked on tables made from glass, wood, and metal.

How does SurfingAttack work

SurfingAttack modulates the voice command onto an inaudible frequency band and transmits attack signals using an off-the-shelf PZT transducer (cost $5 per piece) through different types of tables made of solid materials.

The researchers also said that they tested this hack on 17 different smartphones which include smartphones from Google, Apple, Samsung, Motorola and Xiaomi , and the attacks worked on all the devices. The research also mentioned that the attack will also work on smartphones that have silicone cases.

In order to protect your smartphones from such hacks, the team has advised users to use thicker smartphone cases such as the one made from wood. Along with this, it also advises users to place a phone on the table which has a tablecloth as this disables the activation of the voice assistant.

Title: Love in time of violence: Wedding bells at Delhi hospital
Content:
Feroze and Rukhsar had a sombre ceremony on the terrace of Al Hind hospital

NEW DELHI: At Al Hind hospital in Mustafabad , tragedy and celebration managed to co-exist briefly on Tuesday. Around 5pm, the terrace of the hospital became the venue for a hurried wedding ceremony. The sombre affair had no elaborate feasts and the guest list comprised doctors and nurses, who even chipped in for the bride's attire.

The bride, 19-year-old Rukhsar, was originally supposed to get married at a mosque near her home in Shiv Vihar on March 3. But on February 25, her family lost everything after her home was burned down in the violence that hit the area. Even the groom's family went back on their word and cancelled the wedding. But Rukhsar saw a glimmer of hope after a relative found another match for her.

"We lost everything - money, jewellery and clothes for the wedding. The house is beyond repair. But miraculously, we found another groom for Rukhsar," said her mother, Saba Parveen .

The young groom, 22-year-old Feroze, works as a delivery executive with a food delivery company. "They had lost everything and were worried about their daughter's future. So, my father thought it best that the wedding take place as scheduled. He had my consent," said Feroze, a resident of east Delhi's Krishna Nagar.

Parveen said initially they thought that they would postpone the wedding, but then decided to go forward as she wasn't sure about their safety in the neighbourhood. "We wanted to make sure Rukhsar is safe," she said.

When TOI visited Al-Hind on Wednesday, at least 60 people, including Rukhsar's family, were living there as "refugees". The two-storey hospital had been converted into a relief centre and carpets were laid on the ground to house the displaced families. The hospital gained limelight after Justice Muralidhar 'a midnight order on February 26, which directed policemen to ensure that an ambulance reach the building safely.

Parveen's family moved to Al-Hind on February 26 on learning about the relief camp. Volunteers are cooking food outside on the road and then distributing it among the residents here. Several people have pitched in with grains, oil and other essentials.

The staff is overburdened with work but confident that they will pull through. "The first-aid work is over. But victims are still coming in to get their dressings changed. There are over a dozen patients here, including one with bullet injury. We are working round the clock to ensure medical aid to everyone," said Razia , a 21-year-old nurse.

Razia was referring to 22-year-old Danish, who sustained a bullet injury in his right thigh on February 24. He was earlier shifted to GTB hospital, which discharged him after five days. But on Tuesday, his injury started showing signs of infection, following which he had to be admitted to Al-Hind.

"We could not take him to GTB again because they discharged him before he was well. We are praying for his recovery," said Danish's mother, Ishrat.

Title: Bigg Boss Telugu 3 winner Rahul Sipligunj reportedly attacked in a Hyderabad pub; suffers minor injuries
Content: Popular playback singer Rahul Sipligunj , who was crowned as the winner of Bigg Boss Telugu season 3, was reportedly attacked on Wednesday (March 4) night in a local pub in Hyderabad.As per latest reports, Rahul was attacked with beer bottles by a group of unknown people following a brawl. It is speculated that a few tried to misbehave with one of Rahul’s female friends at the pub and the latter’s intervention led to a scuffle. Rahul reportedly suffered minor injuries in the incident.Police have booked a case and are investigating the matter. Further details are still awaited.Rahul shot to fame with Bigg Boss Telugu season 3 hosted by Nagarjuna Akkineni . Rahul, who is quite popular for his indie music, is gearing up to make his acting debut with an upcoming Telugu film that features his Bigg Boss BFF Ali Reza as well.

Title: 'No Time To Die': Daniel Craig's James Bond movie postponed for November 2020 release amid Coronavirus threat
Content:
Read Also

The global release of the new James Bond film ' No Time to Die ' was postponed on Wednesday by seven months amid the coronavirus disruption that has closed movie theatres in China and caused widespread headaches for other Hollywood productions.The release of Daniel Craig 's last outing as agent 007, being distributed internationally by Universal Pictures , will be postponed from the start of April until November, producers said."After careful consideration and thorough evaluation of the global theatrical marketplace, the release of NO TIME TO DIE will be postponed until November 2020," a posting on the official James Bond Twitter account said.The posting made no specific reference to coronavirus but follows reports in entertainment trade media last week of the cancellation of plans for the film's red carpet premiere in China, Hollywood's biggest overseas market.Movie theatres have been closed in China since January and other nations, including Japan, South Korea and parts of Italy, are also closing theatres in a bid to stem the spread of the virus.The Bond franchise is one of the movie world's most lucrative, with 2015's 'Spectre' raking in $880 million at the box office worldwide, while 'Skyfall' in 2012 grossed more than $1 billion globally.'No Time to Die' cost an estimated $200 million to produce and was due to open in movie theatres from April 2 after a world premiere in London on March 31.The James Bond postponement followed coronavirus disruptions to filming new movies and TV shows and delays in releasing U.S. movies in China.A planned three-week shoot in Venice, Italy, for Tom Cruise 's new 'Mission: Impossible' film was postponed last week due to the outbreak, and producers of the CBS television global competition show 'The Amazing Race' said last week they had temporarily suspended filming of a new season.James Bond fan sites had also written to the studios behind the film this week, urging for a delay."With the Coronavirus reaching pandemic status, it is time to put public health above marketing release schedules and the cost of cancelling publicity events," fan website MI6-HQ.com wrote in an open letter."We have all waited over 4 years for this film. Another few months will not damage the quality of the film and only help the box-office for Daniel Craig's final hurrah," the letter added.Wednesday's post said the film will now be released in the United Kingdom on Nov. 12 and in the United States on Nov. 25.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: Was defection drama over 9 extra votes that BJP needs for second Rajya Sabha seat?
Content:
The CM’s House in Bhopal was abuzz with activity on Wednesday

BHOPAL: Several political observers are interpreting the political drama that unfolded in Madhya Pradesh over the past couple of days in light of the March 26 election to three Rajya Sabha seats. Election would be held on the seats being vacated by senior Congress leader Digvjijaya Singh and BJP leaders Prabhat Jha and Satyanarayan Jatia.

As the equations stand now in the House, Congress can hope to win two seats while one seat will surely go to BJP. But BJP is keen to retain both its seats, and needs nine additional MLAs — almost the exact number that went ‘missing’ from the ruling alliance camp. And the drama that unfolded in the past couple of days is being seen as an attempt to bring the MLAs into their fold.

On the other hand, Congress needs just two more seats to wrest one from BJP while retaining one. Independent legislator Pradeep Jaiswal is a cabinet minister in the Kamal Nath government and will vote with Congress. Therefore, Congress would need only one additional vote beyond its strength of 114 in the House to and take two of the three seats. In normal circumstances, getting one vote from its six other allies (two MLAs from BSP, one of SP and three independents) is no challenge for Congress.

What’s more, BJP is facing the jitters as two of its MLAs — Sharad Kol and Narayan Tripathi — who had voted with Congress in the assembly in July last year and have repeatedly praised CM Kamal Nath, skipped the introductory meet with BJP state chief V D Sharma on Tuesday evening. Congress seems to be placed comfortably for the Rajya Sabha poll.

“There could be some challenge for Congress only when BJP does something drastic, like defection of nine or more MLAs of Congress and the small groups supporting the Nath government. The drama that unfolded over the past couple of days was, perhaps, an attempt in that direction but timely action by our party, particularly Digvijaya Singh , scuttled the attempt,” a senior PCC functionary told TOI.

Former principal secretary of MP Vidhan Sabha, Bhagwandev Israni , while talking of provisions of anti-defection law, said: “If six or eight Congress MLAs had voted against the Congress candidate in violation of the party whip, they would have lost membership of the House, but their votes would have been valid.”

As the situation stands now, each of the three RS candidates will have to get at least 58 votes to win, said Vidhan Sabha principal secretary A P Singh. “Congress, on its own, can get 58 and 56 votes for its two candidates, while BJP will get 58 and 49, if they contest two seats. So, Congress has to get just two additional seats while it has support of seven MLAs from outside and the BJP has none,” said Singh.

While names of senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh and AICC general secretary Jyotiraditya Scindia are said to be among the top choices from the ruling party, it would be interesting to see who gets priority — the one to get 58 first-choice votes.

On the other hand, BJP has several heavyweights in contention for nomination to Rajya Sabha, say sources — from incumbent Rajya Sabha member Prabhat Jha to former Union minister Uma Bharti and BJP national general secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya .

Title: Why global airlines are flying past Chennai
Content:
Representative image

Chennai is strategically positioned. Lying on the intercontinental air route that connects Europe with the Middle East and Australia, it has all the makings of an international hub, but a schedule of flights shows that hardly a quarter of its potential is used when it comes to destinations in the west.

Read the entire story on TOI+

This Indian city could have been a hub of international travel

Title: qs ranking 2020: IITs break into Top 50 in world university rankings
Content: MUMBAI: For the first time, Indian technical institutions have found place among the 'Top 50' in QS World University Ranking by subject, with IIT-Bombay and IIT-Delhi occupying the 44th and 47th rank this year in engineering and technology categories respectively.India also improved its presence in the 'Top 100' list with five institutions featuring this year as against three in last year's rankings. In the arts and humanities category, JNU improved its ranking from 166 to 164 among the 'Top 500' universities with DU too featuring among the 'Top 250' in this category.MIT university is at the pole position for the eighth year in a row. At the second and third positions are Stanford and University of Cambridge.

Title: Kashmir internet news: For first time post August 5, social media ban lifted in Jammu and Kashmir
Content:
The administration in Jammu and Kashmir allowed citizens to access social media (AP, file photo used for repre... Read More

SRINAGAR: For the first time after the nullification of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir, the Union territory administration on Wednesday allowed citizens access to social media. Though 2G mobile internet services were restored in Kashmir from January 25, this is the first time in seven months that access has been given to social media platforms.

However, the access is only on 2G mobile data services and fixed line internet provided by private players. Fixed line internet services by BSNL are yet to be operational. Moreover, the access to the websites, including social media platforms, will be given till March 17, according to a notification of J&K home department.

Communication links in the Union territory were snapped on August 5 last year when the Centre ended the special status enjoyed by J&K. Phone links were restored in the subsequent months and on January 25, access only to 300 white-listed sites (including websites related to emails, banking, education, jobs, travel, entertainment etc) was restored for a week. This was periodically extended. The fresh order by the home department came hours before the previous extension was set to expire on Wednesday midnight.

“Internet access across the Union Territory with internet speed restricted to 2G only and internet connectivity with MAC-binding to continue till 17 March, 2020. The directions to remain in force unless modified earlier. While the postpaid SIM card holders shall continue to be provided access to the internet, these services shall not be made available on prepaid SIM cards unless verified as per norms applicable for postpaid connections,” said the order, issued by J&K principal secretary (home) Shaleen Kabra.

The order was issued after assessing the reports of law enforcing agencies and the impact of telecom services regulation on the overall security situation.

About fixed line internet connectivity, Kabra said it would continue to be made available with MAC-binding, which essentially means to make a client machine work from a particular internet protocol (IP) address.

“It is further directed that the access/communication facilities provided by the government, viz e-terminals/internet kiosks apart from special arrangements for tourists, students, traders, etc. shall continue,” Kabra said.

Kabra asked the police chiefs of Jammu and Kashmir divisions to communicate the home department’s directions to service providers and ensure implementation with immediate effect.

While continuing the ban on social media, authorities had last month said that anti-national elements and people across the border were “misusing” these networking sites allowing peer-to-peer communication and virtual private networks (VPNs). Internet service providers (ISPs) were asked to ensure access to 1,674 white-listed sites only and not to any social media applications.

(With agency inputs from Jammu)

Title: Thermal screening of international flyers for coronavirus at Jaipur airport
Content: JAIPUR: Amid coronavirus concerns, the Jaipur International Airport administration is taking measures to ensure that no international passengers leave the airport without going through the thermal screening.The screening is being done on passengers of international flights and chartered planes. Many domestic tourists have expressed fear that only announcements are made in domestic flights asking persons feeling unwell to get in touch with airport authorities. However, their screening has not been done."All the passengers irrespective of their nationality should be screened as they have travelled together with people who are suspected. Due to lack of infrastructure, they are not screening all the passengers," said a passenger. An official at Jaipur airport said, "Foreign tourists travelling in domestic flights have been asked to fill a medical form. International flights' tourists are being checked thoroughly."Residents of many districts in the state including Jodhpur and Udaipur have also expressed fears that foreign tourists are not being screened as there is no thermal screening facility. These airports have not been equipped as there are no direct flights. International tourists reached these tourist destinations using domestic flights. Manta Singh, a resident of Udaipur said, "There should be a foolproof system at these airports where thousands of international tourists reach daily via different flights. If they move out of airport without screening, a risk is always there."Yogesh Kumar Gujjar, officiating director at Udaipur airport said, "We have no directions to screen the tourists coming by domestic flights. On the directions of the medical and health department, we are acting when they give us specific input on suspected coronavirus passengers. So far, we have sent two tourists and handed them over to the medical and health department."

Title: I was offered Rs 35 crore to switch to BJP, says Congress MLA Parmar
Content:
Mahesh Parmar

BHOPAL/INDORE: At the peak of Wednesday’s political drama, Congress MLA from Tarana seat — Mahesh Parmar — claimed that he was one of those contacted by BJP to switch loyalties.

At the Pradesh Congress Committee headquarters on Wednesday, Parmar told TOI: “On Monday, I received a call from former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan . He said that I will be given a ministerial berth if I switched loyalties and join BJP.”

Parmar alleged that he was offered Rs 35 crore along with the ministerial berth. “They promised to give me a ticket, help win the election and also said that I will be looked after by the party throughout my life. Shivraj Singh Chouhan told me that the faster I make the decision, the better,” he said. “The invitation was to go and speak to Chouhan and other BJP leaders”, he said, adding that he immediately informed CM Kamal Nath about the phone call.

The Congress MLA said that since he comes from Ujjain, he vows by Lord Mahakaal that the call came from Chouhan. “If Chouhan denies, let him place a hand on Mahakaal deity and say that I am lying,” he said. “I am loyal to Congress and the BJP ideology is very different from what I believe in. I could never imagine joining that party,” Parmar added.

Chouhan has denied all such allegations, saying BJP doesn’t indulge in horse-trading. On the other hand, as mystery continued over where Congress MLA Hardeep Singh Dang is, his supporters demanded that he be included in the Kamal Nath cabinet. But he would never quit his party, they said.

Dang, the Suwasara legislator, left his home two days ago and is incommunicado ever since. Congress says he has been taken by BJP from a hotel in New Delhi to Bengaluru. His representative Pavan Pandey said, “The MLA’s phone is switched off. He may be out of the city. I had a discussion with him around two days ago. All allegations of BJP tempting him with money are baseless. He belongs to a middle-class family but it doesn’t mean that he would leave Congress. The state government is under no threat.”

Pandey, a close confidante of Dang, acknowledged that the MLAs is unhappy with the state government after his demand for full compensation to farmers for crop loss in last year’s floods in Mandsaur went unheard. But Dang wouldn’t quit Congress, he said. “I want to request chief minister Kamal Nath and our senior leader Meenakshi Natrajan to give Dang a ministerial post. It’s not his wish but the demand of his supporters and local people,” he said.

Voices of dissent have surfaced from the Dang camp in the past. After BJP’s victory in Lok Sabha polls in May last year, rumours were rife about his quitting Congress. He was believed to be unhappy over not being given a ministerial berth in the Nath cabinet. The MLA had, however, dismissed these rumours and asserted that he would not leave Congress.

Title: Contract staff tries to immolate self at JCTSL depot
Content:
Representative image

JAIPUR: A contract employee of a private company responsible for the maintenance of the Sanganer depot buses of Jaipur City Transport Service Ltd (JCTSL) attempted to commit suicide on Wednesday.

He poured kerosene on himself and tried to set self on fire before being stopped by other employees. The employees were protesting against non-payment of salaries for the last three months.

Title: Pune: Metro’s first TBM reaches Shivajinagar station site
Content: PUNE: The first tunnel boring machine lowered from the Agriculture College in mid-December reached the Shivajinagar underground Metro station ’s location after digging about 1km-long tunnel around 20 metres below the ground-level on March 1, almost three months before the schedule.The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MahaMetro) was expecting daily progress of about 8 metres. But the uniform strata (rocks underneath) helped to push up the daily tunnelling work up to 12-14 metres and even beyond that on some days.The second tunnel boring machine (TBM) lowered in the first week of January has also reached near the Shivajinagar station area and is expected to progress up to the station in a few days.Shivajinagar will be the first underground Metro station on the Pimpri Chinchwad-Swargate route. Its work has started.An official from the Maha-Metro said, “The progress of the tunnel work has been far better than the expectation. We were anticipating that the tunnelling work will reach up to Shivajinagar around June. But the work progressed at a faster pace mainly because of the uniform rock all along the tunnel’s alignment,” the official said.The MahaMetro is now working out a plan for further progress of TBMs towards Civil Court, the next station on the route. The MahaMetro said though the Shivajinagar station’s work was still incomplete, it would not hamper the tunnelling work.Various technical options were under consideration to ensure that the tunnelling work progressed towards Civil Court, about 1km from Shivajinagar station. The underground Metro stretch from Agriculture College to Swargate is about 5km-long.

Title: Deepika Padukone gets a doll version of her ‘Padmaavat’ character and it is sure to wow you!
Content: The AIIMS Forensic Medical Board, which was looking into Sushant Singh Rajput’s death case, ruled out murder in its conclusive report. “There were no injuries on the body other than of hanging. There were no marks of struggle/scuffle on the body and clothes of the deceased,” Dr Sudhir Gupta, Chairman of AIIMS Forensic Medical Board said.

Title: 13 rooms of luxury hotel sealed, bookings cancelled after Italian coronavirus patient visit
Content: UDAIPUR: The district administration and the health department on Wednesday scrambled to trace everyone who came in contact with the Italian tourist who tested positive for coronavirus while on vacation in Udaipur. The administration also sealed 13 rooms of the luxury hotel where the group of Italian tourists were staying. All future bookings have also been cancelled.The authorities said the hotel has not been seized but only few rooms which were occupied by the Italian group, has been sealed and disinfected as per norms. In adherence to the advisory sent by the state government, the medical department screened 45 personnel of Hotel Trident where the tourist had stayed as a part of the Italian group which had come for vacation in Rajasthan during February 21 to 28. "The group was in Udaipur from February 26 to 28 and during three days, they had visited Saheliyon ki bari, Eklingji, Saas Bahu temple, City Palace etc. Medical teams have been constituted and sent to all these places to screen people who were in contact with the gu ests," ADM (city) O P Bunkar said."The suspects would be isolated for a period of 28 days. On the other hand, authorities at the RNT Medical College and the health department had a video conferencing with higher officials at Jaipur on Wednesday who instructed the doctors on handling the situation. An isolation ward has been made at the government hospital and rapid response teams too have been constituted, chief medical and health officer (CMHO) Dr Dinesh Kharadi informed.

Title: SC puts onus back on Cognizant in buyback tax case
Content:
File photo

Bengaluru: In the income-tax matter related to Cognizant's Rs 19,000-crore share buyback that was effected in May 2016, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said the I-T department's communication dated March 22, 2018, may be treated as a show-cause notice and Cognizant is entitled to respond within ten days.

The I-T authority’s 2018 communication refers to a tax demand arising from the buyback.
