Title: MahaRERA: Buyers to decide fate of incomplete projects
Content:
Representative image

MahaRERA has pulled up 984 developers, mostly from the city, Mumbai and Thane, for not completing projects within the deadline and seeking an extension from the real estate regulatory authority .

The Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) has called these developers for suo motu hearings in April. The hearings will involve both the developers and consumers, who have invested in their projects. The consumers will have the powers to remove a developer by revoking project registration.

“Fifty-one per cent of the consumers in a project can form an association of allottees and, during the hearings, agree on giving the developer more time. The suo motu hearings are held to protect the consumers’ interests and ensure early completion of the projects,” a MahaRERA official said.

“Once this is done, an existing developer can be allowed to complete the project within a specific time and after payment of fees as prescribed under the (deadline) extension rules,” the official added. “In the entire process, the association of the allottees/society/cooperative society/ federation or any other body, consisting of a majority of the allottees who have booked plots or apartments or buildings, in the project would decide whether they will favour an extension or exit the project,” the official said.

The Real Estate (Regulation and Development) Act, 2016, (RERA), mandates that a developer can apply for the first extension on failing a deadline. For further extension, MahaRERA has to hear the flat buyers before deciding whether to grant the extension or allow the allottees’ association take over and complete the project.

The promoters, who have failed to meet the deadline after the first extension, would not be able to sell or advertise any of their projects. On the other hand, consumers would not be able to register their properties because the RERA registration would lapse.

MahaRERA currently has 24,643 projects registered across the state. Of these, 7,666 projects in the state are in the “totally completed” category. Developers of 828 projects have sought deadline extension. Shirish Deshpande , chairperson of consumer forum Mumbai Grahak Panchayat, said MahaRERA had the power to initiate a suo motu investigation in case of any violation of RERA provisions.

“In case a promoter has failed or neglected to renew the MahaRERA registration, he or she can be summoned by the regulatory authority suo motu. It will be fair and appropriate to also call the association of allottees for such hearings,” he added.

Title: Rahul Gandhi: President of Indian National Congress Rahul Gandhi visits Delhi riot-hit area, says hate won't help India
Content:
Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited riot-affected Brijpuri on Wednesday.

NEW DELHI: Around 10 days after communal violence took a toll of 47 lives and left hundreds injured in northeast Delhi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited riot-affected Brijpuri on Wednesday. Among others, he visited a school owned by a former Congress MLA that had been torched by rioters.

"Hate and violence are the enemies of development and division and burning of India will not benefit Bharat Mata," Gandhi said while interacting with the media at Arun Modern Public Senior Secondary School, owned by former Congress MLA Bheeshma Sharma. The Congress group inspected the scorched classrooms and saw the school buses that had been burnt down.

The bus carrying the Congress delegation stopped near the school, the area around which had turned into a fortress with multiple security rings in place to make sure there was no untoward incident during the visit of the Congress leader. Police and security personnel were deployed in and around the area to keep vigil when Gandhi was in the area, which was one of the localities most affected by the communal turmoil and had faced the brunt of vandalism, arson, gun use and stone-pelting last week.

"This school is the future of India. Violence and hate burnt it down. This has benefitted none," Gandhi said.

Two separate delegations - one led by Gandhi and the other comprising mostly Congress MPs - visited different areas in northeast Delhi. Accompanying Gandhi were K C Venugopal, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, Mukul Wasnik, Kumari Selja, Gaurav Gogoi , Randeep Surjewala and K Suresh.

At the school, Gandhi also said, "Violence in India and its capital damages the global reputation of the country. Brotherhood, love and unity are our strengths and these have been hit in this place. Such politics does not only damage a school, but also India and Bharat Mata. The reputation which is needed for the future has been reduced to ashes."

The group also visited Brijpuri Masjid near the school that was vandalised during the frenzy. Some Congress functionaries with a gaggle of locals were present near the school to receive the former party president. Gandhi wrapped up his visit in around 30 minutes. A Congress delegation had visited the areas days before the Gandhi's Wednesday tour.

Mohammad Fakhruddin of Brijpuri Masjid told TOI , "Rahul Gandhi keenly listened to the narrative of the violence that overtook the mosque on February 26. A madrassa in the vicinity of the masjid was also vandalised. An irreparable damage was caused to the two buildings." Fakhruddin said that the Congress leader promised to send another delegation to take stock of the damage in detail.

The other Congress delegation comprised of MPs who left for northeast Delhi in a bus from Kerala House . The There, the delegation interacted with shopkeepers whose establishment had been affect by the violence.

Title: Kochi: Meet to mull waste disposal options
Content:
Representative image

KOCHI: The district administration would be convening a meeting of officials and elected members of local bodies to explore the possibilities of expanding decentralized waste treatment projects in the district on Friday.

The meeting would consider entrusting workers of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Programme and Ayyankali Employment Guarantee Scheme with the job of collecting biodegradable and bio-nondegradable waste.

As part of expanding decentralized waste treatment to more areas, units of pit compost, bio-compost, pipe compost and ring compost units will be allotted to households. Plans are on the anvil for setting up a storage facility at ward-levels for collecting garbage.

District administration asked all the members of district panchayat, chairpersons and secretaries of corporation and municipalities, presidents and secretaries of block panchayats and grama panchayats to attend the meeting.

At a time when the district administration is planning to expand decentralized waste treatment, Kochi Corporation authorities have been turning a blind eye to it. At the council meeting held on Tuesday, some of the councillors challenged the corporation authorities' stand against decentralized waste treatment projects.

The corporation council held in July had given its approval for supplying garbage to a private firm which, in association with Kochi Metro , has been engaged in beautification of Metro medians. Despite the corporation council's decision, corporation authorities failed to supply the garbage to the company.

Title: 'Couple' in 20s ends life in Karnal
Content:
Representative image

KARNAL: A man and woman in their 20s allegedly committed suicide by jumping before a train near Bhaini Khurd village under Taraori block of Karnal district on Tuesday night.

Though families of both refused to comment, the Government Railway Police (GRP) suspected that both were in a relationship. The man was identified as Rajat (21) of Dadupur Khurd village of Karnal district. The woman, 20, belonged to a village under Taraori police station.

The police said Rajat had studied till Class X and had been working at a hotel, while the woman had studied till Class IX. The girl was to get married on March 12. They had been missing since Tuesday evening and a few hours later their bodies were spotted on the railway tracks.

It is suspected that they belonged to different castes. Police suspected it to be a case of failed love affair as bodies of both were lying near each other. Karnal GRP in-charge Tara Chand said the bodies were handed over to their relatives after the postmortem and recording statements of family members.

Title: FA Cup: Manchester City, Leicester into FA Cup quarterfinals; Tottenham crash out
Content:
Sergio Aguero celebrates after scoring a goal (AP Photo)

LONDON: Manchester City won a 20th consecutive domestic cup tie to move into the quarter-finals of the FA Cup with a 1-0 win at Sheffield Wednesday as Tottenham crashed out on penalties to Norwich.

Sergio Aguero scored the only goal for the holders eight minutes into the second half as Wednesday goalkeeper Joe Wildsmith failed to get a strong enough hand to the Argentine's low strike.

A solitary goal was scant reward for the dominance of Pep Guardiola's men as the Catalan was rewarded for naming a strong line-up against the Championship side.

Riyad Mahrez and Gabriel Jesus missed glorious first half chances, while Nicolas Otamendi and Benjamin Mendy hit the woodwork before Aguero finally made the breakthrough.

Despite failing to add to their tally, City maintained hopes of a cup treble after lifting a third consecutive League Cup on Sunday and beating Real Madrid 2-1 in the first leg of their Champions League last 16 tie.

"He is a good manager and crazy," said Aguero of Guardiola's relentless demand to keep winning.

City will travel to Newcastle in the quarter-finals.

Norwich will host Derby or Manchester United in their first quarter-final since 1992 after seeing off Spurs 3-2 on penalties after a 1-1 draw.

A bad night for Tottenham, who have now lost their last four games in all competitions, was compounded when midfielder Eric Dier climbed into the stands to confront supporters who had allegedly insulted members of his family.

"I think Eric did what we as professionals cannot do but when someone insults you and your family is involved, especially your younger brother," said Spurs boss Jose Mourinho.

"This person insulted Eric, the younger brother was not happy with the situation and Eric was not happy. But we as professionals cannot do what he did."

Jan Vertonghen headed Tottenham into an early lead, but Mourinho's decision to hand 36-year-old goalkeeper Michel Vorm his first appearance of the season backfired.

The Dutchman spilled a long-range effort from Kenny McLean and Josip Drmic bundled home the rebound to level.

Both sides then tired badly in extra-time, but neither could find a winner and saves from Tim Krul to deny Troy Parrott and Gedson Fernandes allied to Erik Lamela's wild attempt that flew over the bar saw another shot at a trophy for Spurs slip by.

Mourinho again blamed the absence of key personnel such as Harry Kane and Son Heung-min to injury for defeat.

"Some of my players were really in trouble and they made an incredible effort to try," said Mourinho.

"I don't have one single negative feeling towards my players. I can cope with negative moments in football , but I feel really sorry for my players."

Leicester also booked their place in the last eight with a much-needed 1-0 win over Birmingham thanks to Ricardo Pereira's late header.

The Foxes have won just one of their last seven Premier League games to stall their charge towards the Champions League next season.

Brendan Rodgers' men were again without Jamie Vardy through injury and needed right-back Ricardo to get the only goal when he headed home Marc Albrighton's cross eight minutes from time.

"I thought it was just a matter of time," said Rodgers, whose side will host Chelsea in the quarter-finals.

"In the second half we dominated -- lots of quick combos and the goal was coming. It was an excellent display."

Sheffield United will host Arsenal in the other quarter-final tie.

Title: Ex-MP of AIADMK, son get 7-year jail
Content: CHENNAI: A special court for cases against MPs and MLAs on Wednesday convicted and sentenced former AIADMK MP K N Ramachandran and his son Rajasekaran to seven years of rigorous imprisonment in a case related to a bank fraud .In addition to the sentencing, special judge D Lingeshwaran imposed a penalty of 1.11 crore each against Ramachandran and Rajasekaran, and another 15.2 crore against Kannammal Education Trust owned by the duo.This apart, the prime accused and the manager of Central Bank of India, R Thiagarajan, who colluded with the duo to help them get 17.28 crore in loan by defrauding the bank has been sentenced to five years in jail along with 13.1 lakh penalty.According to the CBI, the former Sriperumbudur MP was the trustee of the Kannamal Educational Trust. Along with his son Rajashekar, the MP borrowed a loan to the tune of 17.28 crore from the bank, in collusion with Thiagarajan in 2013.Though the duo took the loan for construction of a new campus for the educational institution, it was found that the funds were diverted and utilised for several other purposes.As the account became irregular and interests remained unpaid, the bank initiated an internal investigation and found the manager at fault for providing loans to the father-son duo. A case was registered with the anti- corruption bureau (ACB) of the CBI in 2016.The three were charged for offences under Sections 120 B of the Indian Penal Code, read with Section 11 of Prevention of Corruption Act and Section 13(2) read with 13(1)(d) of said Act.During the trial, the duo and the bank manager submitted that they were not at fault and the entire transaction was carried legally. Opposing their submissions, CBI special public prosecutor contended that electronic evidences were available for the transactions between Rajashekar and the bank manager in 2013 in booking tickets and hotel rooms abroad for 2.53 lakh.Recording the submissions, the court observed that the elected representative should serve the public rather than collude with officials and get involved in fraudulent activities.The judge also noted that corruption in the country "has to be controlled with iron hands".

Title: Param Bir Singh: New police chief Param Bir Singh asks civic body to regularise illegal chowkies
Content:
Param Bir Singh

MUMBAI: Among several issues discussed by police commissioner Param Bir Singh and BMC chief Praveen Pardeshi on Wednesday, was a request from the police to the civic body to regularise police chowkies that do not have permissions in place.

There are around 189 such chowkies that have been constructed illegally. Following Singh’s request, Pardeshi is said to have called the development plan (DP) department staff, and asked ward-level officials to coordinate and resolve the issue.

The DP department was asked to check if Mumbai’s Development Control Regulations allowed illegal chowkies to be regularised at the site where they currently stand. A senior civic official said Pardeshi directed that those chowkies that could be regularised, should be done on priority. In cases where they cannot be regularised at the same site, then an appropriate space for them should be considered in the vicinity.

Shiv Sena leader and standing committee chairman Yashwant Jadhav said that a few chowkies were constructed in areas several years ago, when the authorities had felt that there was a need for them because of an incident that might have taken place at that time. “It is necessary to check whether these chowkies are still needed now at the same site, and if yes, they should remain there. If not, steps should be taken to move them,” said Jadhav.

Title: Photo: Tara Sutaria is a vision in white as she poses for the camera
Content:
Photo: Tara Sutaria is a vision in white as she poses for the camera

Tara Sutaria is an avid social media user. The actress who made her big Bollywood debut with Punit Malhotra's 'Student of the Year 2'. Post her debut film, she starred in 'Marjaavaan' opposite Sidharth Malhotra. The star enjoys a massive fan following on social media. She is very active on Instagram and often shares pictures and videos to keep her fans all updated about her routine.Recently, she shared a stunning photo of herself and we can't our eyes off her! In this photo, we can see posing for a perfect photo in a white ripped white top and denim shorts. The post was captioned as, ''Snug as a bug in a rug! @rahuljhangiani @marcepedrozo''. The star is a vision in white in this photo. The actress, who was last seen in the Milap Zaveri directorial ‘Marjaavaan’, will soon be seen starring opposite debutant Ahan Shetty in ‘Tadap’. Talking about the film, it is the Hindi remake of Telugu hit 'RX 100. She actress often makes headlines for her rumoured affair with Ranbir Kapoor's cousin and actor Aadar Jain.

Title: Interstate gang behind gold thefts, Odisha man arrested: Police
Content: KOCHI: Perumbavoor police probing three separate incidents of gold theft reported in the rural police limits, have unearthed an inter-state racket engaged in robbing gold merchants with the arrest of an Odisha native. A police team, which went as far as Odisha in pursuit of the suspects, said they have come across a well-established racket, which had taken up looting as a vocation.Police said the interstate racket consisted mainly of four persons who had a network of associates in Kerala which provided them with legal assistance when they fall in police net.It was on Tuesday that police recorded the arrest of Das Sahil (23), who police say, was the kingpin of the racket. Three other Odisha natives managed to give the slip to the police.According to officials who went to Odisha for the operation, the suspects used to lead a luxurious lifestyle. "In Odisha, they have big houses with all luxuries. In fact, we were mesmerised by the kind of furnishing and interior works they had at their residences. They used to come to Ernakulam once in a while, conduct an operation and immediately go back with their bounty," said a police official.A team comprising Rinz M Thomas, Perumbavoor sub-inspector, ASI Abdul Sathar and CPOs Subair and Manoj had gone to Odisha to track the accused.Police said a hunt is on to arrest the remaining suspects by a special team formed by SP Karthick, led by DP K Bijumon and circle inspector Faisal PA.Police said they are planning to conduct a follow-up investigation at Odisha to nab the remaining members of the gang. "One among them is a relative of the arrested person. Once we got to Das, the information about us spread quickly. The others got the news and escaped," said the officer.He added that there are other similar gangs at Damodarpalli, who indulged in such offences. "The man who we arrested did not put up much of a resistance. From our investigation, they have enough contacts in Kerala to procure bail for them," said the officer.Ernakulam rural SP K Karthick said that the police managed to arrest the gang member with the help of local police. "He has some knowledge about the state as all of them have stayed here years ago. They used to come here and stay for a while before an operation. We tracked them down to Odisha and we sought assistance from the local police SP there, leading to the arrest," he said.Police said that the accused were behind the theft reported at Kanjoor and two other incidents reported from Perumbavoor. Over 52 sovereigns of gold, Rs 80,000 in cash and 8kg silver went missing in these incidents.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Chandigarh: Chemists hoard, raise N-95 mask prices
Content: CHANDIGARH: City-based chemists have started hoarding and increasing the rates of three-layered and N-95 masks four to five times, at a time when 29 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the country.Dr G Dewan, director, health services (DHS), UT, on Wednesday wrote to the deputy commissioner to regulate prices and prevent hoarding. The health workers and hospital staff usually wear these masks to prevent the transmission of viruses."We have written to the chemists' association not to hoard or sell in black markets any non-scheduled and scheduled drugs in context of the outbreak of coronavirus. This is under the drugs pricing regulation control Act," said the DHS. According to him, when it was brought to his notice that these masks are being hoarded, he requested the deputy commissioner to regulate masks and other personal protective equipment.Amarjit Singh, president, Chemists' Association, Chandigarh, however, blamed residents for creating panic and hoarding the masks. "People are stocking these masks even for their relatives. There is no need to panic and stock these masks," he said. He said, "Since there is an increase in demand for masks and hand sanitisers, the rates of these items have been hiked."Sources said there is enough stock of masks, protective gowns and head coverings . "The UT health department has around 25,000 N95 masks for hospital staff and placed order for 500 more on Wednesday," said an official in the health department.PGI has not recommended masks for use by general public. "Hoarding of masks can actually hurt the response by reducing the supply available for the health providers to have masks when caring for people exposed to the virus," said a doctor in a private hospital. He said, "We do not have N95 masks, while the three-layered mask, which otherwise costs Re 1 per piece has increased to Rs 50 per piece."

Title: Runner Prachi Choudhary suspended after failed dope test
Content:
Prachi Choudhary. (TOI Photo)

NEW DELHI: Middle distance runner Prachi Choudhary , who had dragged the Athletics Federation of India ( AFI ) to the Supreme Court over her exclusion from the squad for the 2018 Jakarta Asian Games, has failed the dope test for an anabolic steroid, Oxandrolone metabolite, and has been provisionally suspended by the National Anti Doping Agency ( NADA ), TOI has learnt.

Uttar Pradesh's Prachi, a 400m specialist, was tested out of competition by NADA's dope control officers (DCOs) on December 30 at the Netaji Subhas National Institute of Sports centre in Patiala and her urine sample returned dope positive for Oxandrolone at Qatar's Doha testing laboratory.

According to the adverse analytical finding (AAF) notice served to Prachi, she failed to obtain a Therapeutic Use Exemption (TUE) certificate to justify the presence of the banned substance in her system.

As a result, Prachi, a bronze medallist at the Senior Nationals athletics meet in Guwahati 2018, has been provisionally suspended pending a hearing by the disciplinary panel. A period of four-year ineligibility has kicked-in for the presence of non-specified substance in her sample.

Prachi wouldn't be able to participate in any of the qualifying meets for the Tokyo Olympics, as well as the Athletics Federation of India (AFI) sanctioned events.

Prachi, along with fellow middle distance runner Chhavi Sharawat , both of whom had finished third and fourth respectively at the Guwahati meet which acted as a qualifier for the Jakarta Asiad, had levelled allegations against the AFI that the federation overlooked their credentials while favouring other competitors in the women's 400m run for inclusion in the 52-member athletics contingent for the Games. The two had dragged the AFI to the SC, but lost their appeal after the federation convinced the Apex Court about its selection policy.

Title: Jennifer Winget rubbishes reports of quitting Beyhadh 2 and pay hike, says ‘I am sticking to my original plan’
Content:
❤️ https://t.co/PYi9K6cOv1 — Jennifer Winget (@jenwinget) 1583303926000

Jennifer Winget, Shivin Narang and Ashish Chowdhury starrer Beyhadh 2 is in the news for all the wrong reasons. First reports of the show being shifted to the channel’s digital platform grabbed headlines and now rumours of the lead actress Jennifer quitting the show has been doing the rounds owing to pay hike.However, the actress has now taken to her social media account to deny all these speculations. Jennifer clarified and also slammed the news reports which are spreading rumours of quitting the show due to her pay hike.The actress took to twitter and wrote, "Here it is, to clarify, I am not "quitting" Beyhadh or anything to that effect. I am sticking to my original plan as envisaged when I signed on and honouring my initial commitment. The fact remains that the channel was keen on moving the show to its digital platform, and all I did was beg to defer their decision, preferring/agreeing to continue on TV. For the record, there had been no discussion of a price hike or bolting on Beyhadh at any point."Earlier, the channel and producer of the show also denied the speculation. Prateek Sharma while talking to the TimesofIndia.com, dismissed all the rumours. He said, "Beyhadh is a finite show and it will run for six months. It is already three months old and it is getting the same kind of viewership as it had in the first season. All this talk of the show going off air is false."Beyhadh 2 is also enjoying the same viewership as the first season garnered.

Title: Microsoft asks staff in US to work from home as coronavirus spreads
Content: NEW DELHI: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday joined the growing number of US companies asking employees to work from home in order to limit exposure to the spreading coronavirus outbreak, as it responded to cases near its Seattle headquarters and in California.Microsoft asked many of its employees in the Seattle region near its headquarters and the San Francisco Bay Area to work from home if possible until March 25."Taking these measures will ensure your safety and also make the workplace safer for those that need to be onsite," executive vice president Kurt DelBene told employees in a blog post.The post said that some employees for whom "it is essential to be in the office or other work environments" - such as data center and retail employees - should continue to go to their work locations and that the company would follow government guidelines for disinfecting its sites for essential personnel.Microsoft also asked employees to suspend any business travel to the areas "unless essential for the continuity of Microsoft."Microsoft also said employees should cancel non-essential travel to areas with active coronavirus cases - which includes much of Europe, Asia and the Americas - and that employees were not required to travel if they had concerns about doing so.In the greater Seattle area, the total number of coronavirus cases climbed to 39 on Wednesday and 10 deaths, up from 27 cases and nine deaths a day earlier, the Washington State Health Department announced. The first death in California from the coronavirus was announced on Wednesday.The Seattle area has the largest concentration of coronavirus cases detected to date in the United States. Several cases were connected to a long-term care facility for the elderly.Microsoft also implemented new guidelines for employees who do come to its offices. It recommended "limiting prolonged close interactions with people" by keeping in-person meetings as short as possible and staying at least 6 feet, or 1.8 meters, away from others.

Title: Former UN chief Javier Perez de Cuellar dead at 100
Content:
LIMA: Former UN chief Javier Perez de Cuellar , who was known for his peace-making efforts including brokering a ceasefire in the Iran-Iraq war, died Wednesday in his native Peru, aged 100, his son said.

Perez de Cuellar served as UN secretary general from 1981 to 1991, when he was often described as a "pacifist by vocation and nature."

Lauded by his countrymen as one of the most illustrious Peruvians of his era, Perez de Cuellar led the United Nations through a period marked by the fight against world hunger, the eight-year war between Iran and Iraq, as well as the civil war in US-supported El Salvador which led to UN-mediated peace talks.

"My dad died after a complicated week. He died at 8:09 pm tonight (0109 GMT Thursday) and is resting in peace," his son Francisco Perez de Cuellar told RPP radio.

Perez de Cuellar was known for his efforts to reconcile warring parties.

He considered the 1990 independence of Namibia, one of the last colonial enclaves on the African continent, his greatest accomplishment as secretary general.

Perez de Cuellar's popularity prompted him to accept the presidential nomination from one of Peru's leading political parties -- the Union for Peru -- in 1995, which pitted him against then-incumbent president Alberto Fujimori.

The unifying force behind the Union for Peru, Perez de Cuellar won only 21.8 percent of the vote, coming in second behind Fujimori who got 64.4 percent.

In 1997, informants revealed that Perez de Cuellar had been subject to systematic surveillance and phone tapping during the campaign, ordered by the head of Fujimori's intelligence services, Vladimiro Montesinos.

Following the collapse of the Fujimori regime in November 2000, Perez de Cuellar was appointed head of a government of "unity and national reconciliation."

As prime minister, he helped expose a web of corruption woven by Montesinos over the course of Fujimori's 10-year rule.

After the election of President Alejandro Toledo in 2001, Perez de Cuellar was appointed ambassador to France.

Born into an upper middle-class family in Lima and educated in Catholic schools, Perez de Cuellar spent most of his professional life outside his homeland, in diplomatic posts in Britain, Bolivia, Poland, the former Soviet Union, Switzerland and Venezuela.

He was president of the UN Security Council from 1973 to 1974 and was UN permanent representative in Cyprus from 1975 to 1977.

The career diplomat's son and daughter are from his first marriage, along with six grandchildren. He and his second wife, Marcela Temple, had no children.

A lawyer by education, Perez de Cuellar received honorary doctorates from nearly 40 universities around the world.

Antonio Guterres, who currently heads the UN, wished him "with pride & joy" a happy 100th birthday on January 19.

"On this momentous occasion, we at the UN draw on his example for inspiration & are deeply grateful for his many contributions and achievements as Secretary-General," Guterres wrote on Twitter.

Perez de Cuellar's remains will lie at the Peruvian foreign ministry before burial on Friday, his son said.

Title: MH17 Plane Crash: Five key questions about the MH17 trial
Content:
THE HAGUE: Four suspects are to go on trial in the Netherlands next week accused of playing a role in downing Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 over Ukraine on July 17, 2014.

All 298 passengers and crew on board the Boeing 777 jet died in the crash, which international investigators said was caused by a Russian-made BUK surface-to-air missile.

Here are five key questions about the trial:

Three Russians — Igor Girkin, Sergei Dubinsky and Oleg Pulatov, and a Ukrainian, Leonid Kharchenko — are on trial. All have been linked to separatist rebels in eastern Ukraine.

Girkin, 49, also known by his pseudonym "Strelkov", is a former Russian spy and a historical re-enactment enthusiast who helped kickstart the war in eastern Ukraine and ruled part of its territory with an iron fist.

Dubinsky, 57, is a former Russian military intelligence officer who also served as military intelligence chief for the separatists.

Pulatov, 53, is a former Russian special forces officer who served as Dubinsky's deputy.

Kharchenko, 48, also known as "Krot", allegedly commanded a separatist combat unit and is accused of securing the missile launcher.

They are charged with murder and deliberately and unlawfully destroying an aeroplane, leading to the deaths of the 298 people on board.

The four suspects "closely worked together to obtain the BUK missile and (set) it up with the aim to shoot down a plane", according to Dutch prosecutors.

Under international law, the men are accused of being "co-perpetrators", which does not mean they physically pushed the button but rather that their deliberate actions enabled MH17 to be shot down, said Marieke de Hoon of Vrije Universiteit in Amsterdam .

If found guilty, sentences can range from 30 years to life as well as a fine of up to 87,000 euros ($95,000).

Russia and Ukraine do not extradite their citizens so none of the four suspects is expected to show up for the trial.

Only Pulatov has appointed a Dutch law firm to represent him, according to media reports.

The trial however is being conducted under a combination of Dutch and international law, which enables the suspects to be tried in absentia.

"The Dutch legal system is respected and acts with some authority. It has gone through a lot of judicial scrutiny," said De Hoon.

Yes. Relatives of the victims are expected to play an active role from the start, being present in the courtroom and able to watch proceedings at a secure location away from the media.

Relatives will also be asked later in the trial if they would like to make representations as well as eventually asking the court to award compensation.

The trial takes place at The Hague District Court's high-security facility next to Schiphol international airport -- a stone's throw from where the ill-fated flight took off.

The trial is taking place in The Netherlands largely because the plane to Kuala Lumpur left from Schiphol, and 196 of the passengers were Dutch.

The Netherlands also took the lead in the subsequent Joint Investigative Team (JIT), which also involved Australia, Belgium, Malaysia and Ukraine.

The trial will be conducted in Dutch, with translations available in English.

Title: CRPF Head Constable Recruitment 2020: Last date to apply for 1412 vacancies today
Content:
Gender General SC ST Total Male 1031 200 100 1331 Female 63 12 6 81 Total 1094 212 106 1412

Up to 4 years No marks 4-5 years 04 marks 5-6 years 8 marks 6-7 years 12 marks 7-8 years 20 marks

NEW DELHI: Directorate General, CRPF will close the online applications for the post of Head Constable (GD) in CRPF today i.e., March 5, 2020. The applications for CRPF HC recruitment were invited from serving male/female Constables (General Duty/Bugler/Mali/Painter) of the force.CRPF is conducting this recruitment drive to fill up 1412 vacancies (Male 1331 and Female 81) to the post of HC/GD through Limited Departmental Competitive Examination (LDCE). The examination will be conducted on April 19, 2020.It should be noted that the posts are temporary but likely to become permanent in accordance with the guidelines of the government.Candidates can check the CRPF HC vacancies from the table given below.The vacancies mentioned above are subjected to change, it may increase or decrease at any state by the CRPF.Service Eligibility: Applicants must have completed four years of service including basic training on the last date of application. However, constables having more than 4 years of service will be considered for weight-age of marks as underThe upper age limit for appearing in the LDCE is 32 years.Candidates should have passed 10+2 from a board or university recognized by the Central or State Govt.The selection process consists of following stages — Physical measurement, Physical Efficiency Test, Checking of Testimonial, Medical Examination, and Drawal of Merit list.The selected candidates are required to undergo separate LDCE course and will be put on probation for two years.Interested and eligible candidates can apply offline through their units/offices only in the application form as prescribed by the department.

Title: PM Modi pays tributes to Biju Patnaik on his birth anniversary
Content:
Remembering Biju Babu on his Jayanti. This document from the pages of history (dated 1945) gives a glimpse of his c… https://t.co/CjDf1aGAYi — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1583378584000

NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday paid tributes to former Odisha chief minister Biju Patnaik on his 104th birth anniversary, saying he worked tirelessly for India's development.The prime minister also shared a document from 1945 to highlight the courage shown by Patnaik in flying then underground leader Ram Manohar Lohia . Patnaik was an accomplished aviator."Remembering Biju Babu on his jayanti. This document from the pages of history (dated 1945) gives a glimpse of his courage (flying Dr. Lohia, who was then underground) and excellence," Modi tweeted.He said Patnaik worked tirelessly for India's progress and pioneered the development of Odisha.

Title: Delhi shooting World Cup won't offer any ranking points
Content: PUNE: After withdrawals from major shooting nations, the New Delhi ISSF World Cup got another blow on Wednesday as the event was stripped off any ranking points. The rifle-pistol and shotgun World Cup is scheduled to begin at Dr Karni Singh Ranges in the Capital from March 16.The decision has been taken by the International Shooting Sports Federation (ISSF) since most of the countries will not be able send their shooters for the World Cup due to the coronavirus outbreak."Due to local restrictions relating to the COVID-19 virus introduced by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare of India, the organizers of the ISSF World Cup in New-Delhi cannot guarantee the participation of all the athletes who would like to enter those competitions," the ISSF statement read.India has suspended visas for people travelling from Japan, South Korea, China, Iran and Italy, while countries like Bahrain, Taiwan, North Korea and Pakistan had already expressed their inability to participate."Therefore no ranking points can be earned at this World Cup. Still, it will be possible to achieve the MQS that can influence athletes' chances to get the desired Olympic quota places."MQS or minimum qualification score is important for shooters to claim the quota places for their respective countries. A shooter cannot participate in the Olympics if he/ she has not achieved the MQS.Ranking points are important in this cycle, since the ISSF had introduced ranking-based quota for the Tokyo 2020 Olympics. One quota in each event will go to the top-ranked eligible shooter as per the new quota distribution policy.The National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) president, Raninder Singh told TOI that the ISSF decision was fair. "It is only fair to everybody since a majority of participants will not able to participate in the World Cup. They shouldn't miss out on the ranking opportunity," Raninder said.When asked if the NRAI was keen on continuing with their plan of holding the World Cup on the original dates, he replied in affirmative. "We are not postponing or cancelling the event. We are holding it as per the schedule," he said.

Title: CAG: Local contractors favoured for Navi Mumbai airport land development
Content:
MUMBAI: The CAG report clearly shows how local contractors were favoured in award of contracts for the development of the Navi Mumbai International Airport land.

The audit also observed that in six cases, where the estimated cost was Rs 890 crore, Cidco awarded the contracts though contractors did not possess the minimum prescribed value of work experience. These included Rs 627-crore airport land development (package IV) awarded to Constructors San Jose-GVK Projects and Technical Services Pvt Ltd. Other contractors similarly awarded were D G Belhekar & Co. Kalpana Struct-Con Pvt Ltd, P D Earthmovers, P P Kharpatil Construction Pvt Ltd and Vishal Construction.

Cidco even waived off marking criteria for technical qualification in seven contracts—they were awarded to local contractors—including the Rs 545-crore contract for land development awarded to Thakur Infraprojects Pvt Ltd and J M Mhatre Infra Pvt Ltd, a Rs 19-crore contract for integrated infrastructure development of sector 27 to Thakur Infraprojects, a Rs 158-crore contract for integrated development in sector 4 to 10 Pushpak Nagar to J M Mhatre Infra, a Rs 34-crore contract to P P Kharpatil Constructions Pvt Ltd, and a Rs 62-crore to P D Earthmovers.

In its defence, Cidco said the marking system was not applicable in physical infrastructure works. The audit said the reply was not tenable as rules for tenders above Rs 15 crore had two bid systems—mandatory eligibility criteria and scoring minimum stipulated marks—which were not adhered to.

Cidco even awarded additional works—again to local contractors—in 10 cases to the tune of Rs 69 crore without inviting tenders. The original contracts were valued at Rs 430 crore.

In another instance of favouring Thakur Infraprojects and J M Mhatre, the audit stated that Cidco had issued letter of acceptance to Associated Soap Stone Distributing Company -Supreme Infrastructure for airport land development. The firm had quoted Rs 204 crore, which was 9.8% below the estimated cost. Cidco, however, cancelled the bid stating the company failed to provide an additional security deposit (ASD) as its bid was less than the estimated cost. Tender conditions required that ASD be insisted upon only if the bid was 15% less than estimated cost which was also the opinion of Cidco’s legal counsel. The contract was then awarded to Thakur and Mhatre for Rs 530 crore, 2.8% less than the estimated cost of Rs 545 crore.

Title: 3.39kg gold worth 1.50 crore seized at Cial
Content:
Representative image

KOCHI: Customs Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) seized 3.39kg gold worth over Rs 1.50 crore from two passengers at Cochin International Airport (Cial) on Wednesday morning after CISF personnel, who found them suspicious, alerted the customs.

The AIU seized the gold a day after the directorate of revenue intelligence (DRI) seized 5.3kg gold worth Rs 2.3 crore from four carriers in three separate cases at the airport on Tuesday.

Sources said the gold was seized from a man and a woman from Kottayam who arrived at the airport from Italy via Doha on a Qatar Airways flight.

The man was carrying gold weighing 1.99kg valued at Rs86 lakh hidden around his waistline while the woman was wearing seven crude bangles weighing around 1.39kg and valued at Rs 60 lakh on her hand. The bangles worn by the woman was covered with a jacket she was wearing.

Title: Manish Sisodia: Special PTM, Manish Sisodia visit to assuage fears
Content:
Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia visited a government school at Gokulpuri in the vicinity of the tyre mark... Read More

NEW DELHI: Kishwar Jahaan, a resident of riot-affected Khajuri Khas in northeast Delhi, stepped out of her home for the first time on Wednesday after more than a week. Jahaan put her anxieties aside to attend the mega parent-teacher meeting at her daughter's school in the area.

Delhi government had called a special PTM in the schools of northeast Delhi. These institutions have remained closed since February 24 after internal exams were postponed following the riots. Like Jahaan, a large number of parents made the effort to participate in the meeting.

Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia visited a government school at Gokulpuri in the vicinity of the tyre market that was targeted by arsonists during the riots. Gungun, a Class VII student, reported, "He told us that if we needed anything we should inform our teachers. He also asked us to write our exams without fear."

Jahaan, who was at the Sarvodaya Kanya Vidyalaya, Khajuri Khas, told TOI , "The teacher gave us the new dates for the postponed exams. I told the teacher that my children were very scared and hadn't been able to study. How will they write the exams?" The eldest daughter, Parveen, was at the CBSE exam centre in Karawal Nagar for her Class XII board exams when the rioting began. Parveen was able to return home only the following day. "She stayed at her teacher's house. But she saw people being beaten and killed and she is traumatised," said Jahaan.

At the Government Girls' Senior Secondary School nearby, Hindi teacher Krishna Kumari was surprised to see the large turnout for the PTM. "We didn't think too many students would come," Kumari exclaimed, adding that the meeting was meant to "counsel student and parents, guide them and give them confidence after the days of violence".

Another teacher, Sarita, said, "The students have been told that they shouldn't worry about coming to school because it is a safe space for them. If there are any students who have lost books or stationery items, we will provide them with what they need."

The announcement on the PTM was sent through phone messages, though some mosques also publicised it on their PA systems.

Title: Chandigarh: Teacher booked for raping student's mother for 8 months
Content:
Representative image

CHANDIGARH: Police have booked a private school teacher for allegedly raping the mother of one of his students for last more than eight months.

Police said the accused had first molested the woman. When she objected, the accused allegedly threatened her that her son would be expelled from the school if she reported the matter.

Later, the accused started blackmailing her and allegedly forced himself on the woman. The accused allegedly took the woman to different hotels in the Tricity and raped her.

The woman attached hotel bills with her complaint. The complainant said once she got pregnant, the accused forced her to abort the child.

Later, the woman told her husband about the assaults and they filed a complaint at the SSP public window.

The SSP marked an inquiry. After carrying out an investigation and taking legal opinion, police registered a rape case against the accused under the relevant Sections of the IPC. Police said no arrest has been made so far. On February 17, a resident of Uttar Pradesh was arrested for allegedly raping a 16-year-old girl in the city. Both were working as domestic help in a house.

Title: Tax officials threaten to cut workload in protest over working conditions
Content:
(Representative image)

MUMBAI: Indian tax officials on Wednesday threatened to cut their workloads in protest over working conditions, a move that could dent New Delhi’s tax collection just as the government scrambles to fill coffers before the fiscal year ends on March 31.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government is pushing to shore up revenue as India’s once-booming economy grows at roughly 11-year lows.

Corporate and income tax collection for the current year is likely to fall for the first time in at least two decades, several senior tax officials have told Reuters.

In a statement on Wednesday, two unions representing some 97% of tax officials said they were beginning action for improved working conditions, including the resolution of “pay anomalies” and set contracts for casual workers.

If demands are not met, the unions are planning to stop submitting certain reports and halt search and seizure operations on March 12, before putting an end to overtime work on March 15.

“We go beyond our limits and work for the government. There should some recognition at least for that,” said Dipak Gupta, general secretary at the Income Tax Gazetted Officers’ Association’s Mumbai unit.

In a February 26 letter to the Central Board of Direct Taxes that was seen by Reuters, the unions said there was “undue pressure” on officials to collect taxes and that staff were suffering from unclear promotion rules and career stagnation.

In the letter, the unions said they believed the government would intervene by next Tuesday, in which case they would call off planned protests.

The CBDT and the finance ministry did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the planned action.

Separately, a letter from the CBDT seen by Reuters on Wednesday said it was imperative for officials to make a new amnesty scheme, called 'Vivad se Vishwas', a success.

“The performance of officers ... shall be an important factor in determining their future postings,” the letter read.

Ravi Shankar, the secretary general of the Income Tax Gazetted Officers’ Association, said tax officials had promised the government to leave “no stone unturned” to make the scheme work, but stressed that New Delhi should also “redress our long pending demands.”

Title: MVD special drive to curb accidents in Kochi
Content:
Representative image

KOCHI: Motor vehicles department (MVD) held a 24-hour special drive in rural Ernakulam on Wednesday following increase in accidents reported from the area reportedly involving KSRTC buses.

Eight squads, including eight motor vehicle inspectors and 22 assistant motor vehicle inspectors, patrolled along the Muvattupuzha-Perumbavoor and Perumbavoor-Angamaly routes starting from 6am. The patrolling would go on till 6am on Thursday, sources said. tnn

Title: Kieron Pollard: Kieron Pollard joins 10,000-runs club in his 500th T20 match
Content:
Congrats on the 500 and welcome to the 10K Club, @KieronPollard55 💪🏿👍🏿🤫 — Chris Gayle (@henrygayle) 1583336995000

West Indies all-rounder Kieron Pollard became the first player to play 500 Twenty20 matches and only the second player to amass 10,000 runs in the format during their 25-run win over Sri Lanka in Kandy on Wednesday.Skipper Pollard, who had 9,966 career runs across both international and franchise cricket prior to this game, scored 34 off 15 balls to join compatriot Chris Gayle (13,296 runs) in the 10,000 runs club.Apart from T20 internationals, the 32-year-old has also played for franchises in India, Australia, England, West Indies, South Africa, Bangladesh and Pakistan since making his T20 debut in 2006."Congrats on the 500 and welcome to the 10K Club, @KieronPollard55," Gayle wrote on Twitter.West Indies scored 196-4 in their allotted 20 overs while Sri Lanka were bundled out for 171, with fast bowler Oshane Thomas picking up five wickets to give the visitors a 1-0 lead in the two-match series.

Title: Corona virus India: Fourteen Italians shifted to Gurgaons's Medanta Hospital
Content: NEW DELHI: The fourteen Italians, who have tested positive for coronavirus , have been shifted to the Medanta Hospital in Gurgaon from an ITBP quarantine centre.The hospital issued a statement on Thursday morning, saying these patients are housed on a completely separate floor, which has been quarantined and has no contact with the rest of the hospital.There is a dedicated medical team wearing protective gear looking after these patients. All items used on the floor are isolated to that floor.The isolated floor will completely contain the disease even with these asymptomatic persons. All other hospital operations are operating as normal, and there is no increased risk to patients, visitors or staff, the statement said.Twenty-one Italian tourists and their three Indian tour operators were shifted out from an ITBP quarantine centre here on Wednesday as they were exposed to novel coronavirus.An affected Italian couple is being treated at Jaipur's SMS medical college.Officials on Tuesday said the foreigners have been sent to a private hospital in Gurgaon and a centre in the national capital while the Indians have been transferred to the Safdarjung Hospital.Fourteen Italians and an Indian (driver), who were in the same group as the affected Italian couple, tested positive for the virus as per information provided by the Health Ministry.The Italian tourists and three Indians were admitted to the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) force centre in Chhawla on Tuesday.The Centre already has 112 people, 76 Indians and 36 foreigners, since February 27 after they were evacuated by an Indian Air Force (IAF) plane from China's Wuhan, the epicentre of the deadly coronavirus.The first samples of these 112 people had tested negative when reports came in last week.

Title: Devendra Fadnavis: Congress asks Devendra Fadnavis to quit, he says ‘leaks selective’
Content:
Devendra Fadnavis

MUMBAI: Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant on Wednesday demanded former CM and leader of opposition Devendra Fadnavis ’ resignation following the CAG report on irregularities in awarding of Cidco contracts. Fadnavis though claimed the MVA government had made “selective leakages” of the report and said Cidco was an autonomous body whose its decisions did not come to the minister or CM for approval.

“Fadnavis was not head of Cidco, but as minister for urban development, it was his responsibility to provide a clean and transparent administration. In view of CAG’s stringent observations, Fadnavis must accept responsibility and quit,” Sawant said. Cidco is under the control of the urban development department. “It has been established that all norms were flouted in the tender process and works allotted to firms headed by then Cidco chairman, who was also BJP legislator from Panvel,” Sawant said. He added that the entire tender process was monitored through the CM’s office then headed by Fadnavis.

“In the Rs2,000 crore work for the Navi Mumbai airport, irregularities were of the highest order. It was found that inexperienced contractors were allotted works worth Rs890 crore. More shocking, the Cidco chairman himself was the main contractor,” Sawant alleged.

Fadnavis said, “In case of Navi Mumbai Metro Rail and Nerul-Uran railway project, all tenders were awarded prior to 2014. In case of the mass housing project, the objection is with regard to delay in allotment of tenements. Contract for the project was awarded through nomination in 2013, and it was worth Rs475 crore, but this fact has not been mentioned in the report, nor the fact that the contract awarded in 2017 was for a lesser cost. That this should be excluded is surprising. Perhaps this will be brought out in the CAG report in the next session.”

Title: Problem of plenty helps Vidarbha U-23
Content:
Vidarbha U-23 cricketers. (TOI Photo)

NAGPUR: While Vidarbha boys have received deserving accolades for their on-field show in the ongoing Col CK Nayudu Under-23 Trophy, a lot of work was done in the background by the selectors, coach and think-tank.

Vidarbha reached their maiden final in the Nayudu Trophy, annihilating Mumbai in their own den inside two days on Tuesday. It wasn't easy for Suhas Phadkar-led selection panel and even more difficult for coach Trevor Gonsalves, who didn't have a settled playing XI in two successive matches.

When the new season began for Vidarbha Under-23 side last December, the selectors and team management had one major problem - how to rotate players between Ranji Trophy and Under-23 Col CK Nayudu Trophy.

While the selectors managed this quite admirably last year when Vidarbha won the Under-23 One-day and reached the semifinals of Nayudu Trophy, this year was different. Earlier, three Ranji Trophy players were eligible to make it to the final XI of the Under-23 side.

This year, the rule was slightly tweaked. Only three players who have represented their state teams in Ranji Trophy, Vijay Hazare and Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophies, were allowed to be part of the playing XI of the junior team.

When Vidarbha Under-23 started the season, Atharva Taide , Darshan Nalkande and Yash Thakur had already represented Vidarbha in Hazare Trophy. As the season progressed, Aditya Thakare, Aniruddha Choudhari and Siddhesh Wath joined the list. All three made it the Ranji Trophy on the basis of their exploits in the Nayudu Trophy. However, despite losing so many talented players, Vidarbha remained unbeaten in the competition.

Vidarbha openers Taide and Choudhari have seven hundreds between them. However, none could play the semifinal because of the tweaked rule. Choudhari, Nalkande and Thakur were not even part of the squad. "The rules are such that senior players can't even enter the field as a substitute," a VCA source said.

In the quarterfinal, skipper Mohit Kale couldn't be part of the playing XI, while Taide had to miss out in the semifinal despite scoring 746 runs in the competition. Despite key players missing in important matches, Vidarbha have been ruthless. They have registered seven outright victories, out of which four were innings win.

While the priority for VCA was Ranji Trophy, the wider talent pool eventually helped Vidarbha Under-23. The Under-19 team has reached the semifinal of Cooch Behar Trophy for three successive years now, though they lost the last two finals. However, there has been a constant flow of talent.

Under-19 all-rounder Harsh Dubey made immediate impact when he was drafted in the squad for quarterfinals. He did well in the semifinal too. Pacers Nachiket Bhute and Dushyant, who were revelations in the Cooch Behar 2018-19 season sharing more than 80 wickets, filled up big shoes of Thakur of Nalkande perfectly.

Coach Gonslaves also did a great job with his boys. "He has excellent communication skills. He handled the boys very well kept them in good space of mind. His man management skills are superb and he knows how to handle these grown up boys.

"Vidarbha have now reached the knock-out phase of every tournament since last year under him. While he has great bunch of youngsters, it's important to manage them properly, which he did with aplomb. The selectors also did a great job. They made sure every domestic performer was rewarded," the VCA source said.

So far, Vidarbha haven't put a foot wrong. They would be hoping to continue the intensity in the final as well.

Title: Corporate Mumbaikars go sporty at Equilympics 2020
Content: The recently organised Equilympics 2020, a one-of-its-kind sports event, saw over 1,000 participants from eighteen companies.Held at the office campus in the Bandra Kurla Complex area in Mumbai, this unique sports fest saw professionals of all ages and gender, compete against each other across a wide array of sports and games.The event held at Equinox, witnessed an enthusiastic gathering of over thousands from various companies including Tata Communications Times Network , Solvay, and Crompton.The participants competed in some unique sports such as human foosball, along with conventional games like cricket, carom, tug of war, and table tennis.Equilympics also drew a massive crowd that relentlessly cheered the participants on, as they battled it out for top honours. Boosted morale was apparent in the smiles visible at the event’s successful conclusion, furthering employee engagement and happiness at the preimses.Speaking on the event, Alok Aggarwal , one of the senior officials said, “We have redesigned and upgraded Equinox to offer unique experiences and amenities for the new-age professionals working here. It is proven that ensuring employees’ happiness at the workplace is critical in driving higher levels of productivity. The new sports arena here is the only one of its kind in and around BKC, Mumbai. Open spaces are valued the most in a city like Mumbai.”
