Title: Now, residents across Mumbai can ignore public parking lots, leave car on roads near home!
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: After giving a “special” exemption to residents of Shivaji Park area in the island city, the civic administration has now decided to waive off penalty for residents across Mumbai parking on roads near their homes despite having a public parking lot within 500 metres.

Locals will be issued passes and charged a monthly fee for parking on roads in their neighbourhood. However, this is not applicable to those who do not stay in the particular neighbourhood but park on the roads in the area. Besides, residents of societies that have parking space cannot avail of this facility.

Residents living in areas around public parking lots have been opposing the BMC’s move last year to impose steep penalties.

The BMC commissioner’s office said the civic chief has asked ward officers to coordinate with the traffic department and identify roads where parking can be allowed after examining the requirements of the local residents.

On Wednesday, TOI reported about two questionable decisions—largely favouring residents of Shivaji Park— of BMC to drop parking penalties and to allow vehicles to be parked on 15 roads that were designated no-parking zone in G-North ward, comprising Shivaji Park, Dadar (west) and Matunga (west).

Reacting to the BMC’s decision, Bandra corporator Asif Zakaria said, “This means they (BMC) are accepting that earlier they committed a mistake by implementing the (No Parking) policy haphazardly without any planning. It also means that the penalty imposed on local residents close to these PPLs earlier were wrong, so they should return their money.” He added, “It seems that the BMC not taken the Parking Authority into confidence . If you have the authority to suggest you on parking issue, but you are not taking their suggestion to implement related policy.”

Sources said the Mumbai Parking Authority, headed by former IAS officer Gautam Chatterjee , was not taken into confidence when the BMC took the decision to give Shivaji Park residents an exemption.

The BMC has set up the parking authority to deal with the city’s traffic problem, study vehicles movements, road congestion and advise on-off street parking.

Sources said that earlier also when the BMC took the decision to impose heavy penalty for parking near PPLs, it had not discussed with the Parking Authority. After Chatterjee expressed his disagreement over the penalties, the BMC revised them in January.

Title: CAG slams Cidco for flouting rules in awarding infra works
Content:
MUMBAI: The Comptroller and Auditor General has come down heavily on the City and Industrial Development Corporation (Cidco) for lapses in awarding contracts for major infrastructure projects. Among the projects it has looked into, as TOI had reported on February 28, is the Navi Mumbai Metro Rail, whose cost was revised from Rs 1,694 crore to Rs 3,064 crore.

The audit has shown the NMMR project was to be completed in May-June 2014. But by then, only 39% of work was completed, chiefly because of delay in completion of station work. Cidco terminated contracts only in February and December 2017, which, CAG said, had “a cascading effect on the completion of station work and related rail systems work.” In case of the viaduct over the railway crossing at Taloja, CAG said the consultant delayed finalising cost of railway crossing span work by 18 months.

The audit has raised questions about the tendering system, saying tender conditions were changed after ‘request for proposal’ were purchased by bidders, “which limited participation by other parties.” Cidco overpaid Rs 25 crore to the contractor for mobilisation of equipment. “As of August 2019 Cidco had already incurred an expenditure of Rs 1,759 crore on partly constructed facilities such as viaducts and elevated stations which could be put to use only when entire project is completed,” states the report. The report has blamed Cidco for “lack of vision,” stating it “ did not prepare any long, medium or short-term plans... with the result the proposals were sanctioned on a case to case basis.” NMMR is to be thrown open to the public this year. Trial run was held in 2018. The CAG looked at projects from April 2013 to March 2018. Unlike in the past years, when the CAG report would be tabled on the last day of the state legislature session, the Maha Vikas Aghadi government tabled it on Wednesday.

Title: Coronavirus in USA: Thousands held on cruise ship off California over coronavirus fears
Content: LOS ANGELES: Thousands were stranded on a cruise ship off the California coast Wednesday over fears of the new coronavirus after passengers and crew members on board developed symptoms.Officials delayed the return of the Grand Princess to San Francisco on Wednesday night from Hawaii in order to carry out testing on board for those potentially infected.A 71-year-old man who had been aboard the same vessel during its previous voyage to Mexico died after contracting the COVID-19 illness, becoming the first fatal case in California, the operator Princess Cruises and California Governor Gavin Newsom said.The ship's return from its current voyage was being delayed to allow "ample timing" for testing of "a number of passengers and crew members that have developed symptoms," Newsom told a press conference."So we're holding that ship, which (has) thousands of passengers as well, off the coast, and we'll be conducting those tests," he added.Eleven passengers and 10 crew members were potentially infected with the virus, Newsom said.Around 62 passengers who remained on board from the earlier Mexico voyage were restricted to their rooms for testing, the Princess Cruises company said in a statement to AFP.It was not specified if they were among those displaying symptoms."In an abundance of caution, these guests and other potential close crew contacts have been asked to remain in their staterooms until screened by our onboard medical team," it said.The ship held about 2,500 passengers, plus crew, said Newsom. According to the company's website, the vessel is manned by 1,150 crew.The Grand Princess belongs to Princess Cruises, the same company which operated the coronavirus-stricken ship held off Japan last month on which more than 700 people on board tested positive.At least six people who were hospitalized after being taken off the Diamond Princess have died.

Title: social security: Prosecutors urge denial of early prison release for Madoff
Content:
Former financier Bernard Madoff exits Federal Court in New York. Citing the scope and magnitude of his decades... Read More

NEW YORK: Bernard Madoff should not be released early from prison even if kidney disease kills him within months, prosecutors said Wednesday as they cited the scope and magnitude of his decades-long Ponzi scheme that cost thousands of investors billions of dollars.

Over 500 victims had written to a Manhattan federal court judge to oppose early release for the 81-year-old Madoff from a 150-year sentence imposed in 2009, while only 20, or 4% of letter writers, supported it, prosecutors said.

Madoff had demonstrated ``a wholesale lack of understanding of the seriousness of his crimes and a lack of compassion for his victims, underscoring that he is undeserving of compassionate release himself,'' prosecutors said.

Prosecutors cited numerous letters from victims, including one from a woman who said her husband of 40 years committed suicide after learning of the fraud and another in which an 84-year-old victim said: ``Why should he be shown any compassion, when he had none for his many victims?''

Madoff's lawyer had asked that he be released early under the terms of a program that permits compassionate release for some inmates if they have less than 18 months to live.

The Federal Bureau of Prisons has agreed he has less than 18 months to live but has denied early release on the grounds that it ``would minimize the severity of his offense.''

Madoff is confined to a wheelchair while he battles terminal kidney disease and other ailments, his lawyer said in an early February court filing.

The attorney, Brandon Sample, said Madoff has a back brace and medical shoes and is permitted to be aided by an inmate companion as he suffers from leg cramps, weakness, fatigue and uses an oxygen container to relieve shortness of breath.

``The government recognizes the serious nature of Madoff's illness and his general eligibility for a sentence reduction, Sample said in a statement Wednesday night. ``Madoff, despite what the government might claim, is remorseful for his conduct. A reply addressing the government's other contentions will be filed.``

Madoff began his sentence months after he confessed to his family and others that the $17.5 billion entrusted to him by thousands of investors had never been invested, even though he claimed it had grown in value by tens of billions of dollars. At the time, there was only several hundred thousand dollars left.

His Ponzi scheme, estimated to have begun as early as the 1980s, destroyed or crippled the finances of many individuals and charitable organizations worldwide.

Meanwhile, prosecutors said in their filing Wednesday, Madoff live extravagantly, using investor money to buy a $4.4 million Manhattan home, fund a $6.5 million loan for a home in Nantucket and to finance two yachts worth $11.5 million and the salaries of housekeepers and a personal boat captain.

In arguing for compassionate release for Madoff, Sample called his client's sentence ``symbolic,'' saying it was given for retribution, deterrence and for the victims.

He argued compassionate release was appropriate in light of his terminal illness, life expectancy of less than 18 months and ``our society's value and understanding of compassion.''

If freed, Madoff will live with a friend, financially supported by Social Security and Medicare benefits, Sample wrote.

Sample did not immediately comment on Wednesday's submission by prosecutors.

Last week, Irving H. Picard, a trustee appointed to recover money for Madoff's victims, reported that $13.93 billion had been recovered and nearly all of it had been distributed, meaning nearly 70% of the allowable losses reported by Madoff's customers will have been repaid.

Title: Piping hot chai and papdi, Akshit Sukhija enjoys a day out in the city
Content:
SHOOTING IN SIDHPUR AND RANI KI VAV WAS AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE

I remember my first day at shoot. Sidhpur is such a beautiful place. It has a very unique feel to it. And we shot the scene where Raja and Rani (the two lead characters from the show) meet for the first time at Rani Ki Vav, and just being there was an amazing feeling. Gujarat has become an integral part of my life as all the firsts in your life are extra special and I will always remember shooting my first TV show here. I remember my first day at shoot. Sidhpur is such a beautiful place. It has a very unique feel to it. And we shot the scene where Raja and Rani (the two lead characters from the show) meet for the first time at Rani Ki Vav, and just being there was an amazing feeling. Gujarat has become an integral part of my life as all the firsts in your life are extra special and I will always remember shooting my first TV show here.

I REMIND MYSELF DAILY THAT THIS IS WHAT I HAVE WORKED SO HARD FOR ALL THESE YEARS

Our shooting schedule is really hectic and there is hardly any time to socialise. Earlier I used to spend a lot of time with my friends. I don’t even get time to sleep. But this is what I have worked so hard for. Now that I have got one, I can’t crib about not having time. That’s why I remind myself daily that you are living your dream, enjoy it. Our shooting schedule is really hectic and there is hardly any time to socialise. Earlier I used to spend a lot of time with my friends. I don’t even get time to sleep. But this is what I have worked so hard for. Now that I have got one, I can’t crib about not having time. That’s why I remind myself daily that you are living your dream, enjoy it.









Gujarat will always remain “extra special” for Akshit Sukhija as it was in Sidhpur where he gave his first shot as a lead actor for the TV show Shubharambh . Set in Gujarat, the show that also stars Mahima Makwana is a love story of two distinctly different people who fall in love amidst unusual circumstances. In the city on a promotional tour, Akshit says, “We shot in Sidhpur and then Rani Ki Vav. But due to time constraints, we couldn’t spend much time in Ahmedabad. Now that I am finally here, I am looking forward to an eventful day ahead.” And it indeed turned out to be an eventful day for Akshit as Ahmedabad Times took him to a popular chai ki tapri where he had his share of some garma garam chai and farsan. Not just that, he even tried his hand at making tea. “This is really fun,” said Akshit while stirring the boiling tea.

Title: Delhi high court rejects PIL against government aid to all riot victims
Content:
People crowd to receive free grocery items being distributed outside a relief camp in northeast Delhi. (Reuter... Read More

NEW DELHI: The Delhi high court on Wednesday dismissed a public interest litigation ( PIL ) which challenged the AAP government's decision to grant compensation to all victims of the violence in the northeast district.

A bench of Chief Justice DN Patel and Justice C Hari Shankar underlined that grant of compensation is a policy decision and refused to interfere with the government's decision. "This is not a compensation given on fault basis. The compensation is being awarded on a no-fault basis. There is nothing wrong with it," the court said, while dismissing a plea by former lawmaker, Nand Kishore Garg .

The perpetrators of the riots must be denied the compensation and they must not be treated as victims, the plea urged. It sought directions to strike down the order of compensation to all riot victims, claiming them as being unreasonable and arbitrary.

Garg sought that victims of the riots be identified before payment of compensation to ensure those who "perpetrated" the violence do not get the relief. But the high court disagreed with the contention, saying if the petitioner's suggestion was accepted, then the scheme "would become totally unworkable." "It would be impossible to implement," the bench said.

Meanwhile, in a related development, the high court directed the AAP government and police on Wednesday to ensure there is no breach of security at the centres till all the Class X and Class XII board examinations are over in riot-affected northeast Delhi. Justice Rajiv Shakdher asked the cops to continue providing security till the last examination.

The court passed the direction while disposing of a plea by a private school here that the centre allotted to them by CBSE was 16km away from their school.

Title: Narendra Mehta: Former BJP MLA Narendra Mehta gets interim relief in rape case
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: The Bombay high court in an interim order on Wednesday directed the Thane police crime branch not to take coercive steps against former BJP MLA, Narendra Mehta, in a rape case filed against him if he cooperated with the police.

Mehta had petitioned the HC to have the February 28 case against him quashed. At a hearing of his plea before a bench of acting Chief Justice B P Dharmadhikari and Justice N R Borkar, his counsel Aabad Ponda argued he was married to the alleged victim in 2001 and “so there can never be rape”. He said she had a baby, too, out of the wedlock.

Ponda argued Mehta had “been regularly in touch with her and even on phone’’ and that she had charged him with rape “after 20 years.” He said she had applied for a caste certificate only last month and that he could point to several documents to prove she belonged to the general category.

Appearing for the complainant, counsel Rizwan Merchant , opposed grant of any relief and submitted the FIR could not be broken into parts to selectively say it was “by consent’’. He argued Mehta had offered her a job, knew of her personal status and yet proposed to her and married her, but asked her to keep it under wraps to maintain his public image.

He argued the marriage was based on misconception of facts and, hence, consent could not be presumed. He also cited judgments to show his custodial interrogation was essential. He said Mehta had “22 FIRs against him and has not been arrested yet.’’ “He has clout and all witnesses will disappear, unless he is interrogated,’’ he argued.

The public prosecutor said the accused had made a “casteist slur’’ against the woman and there was a “threat to her life.’’ He said he would file a reply within two weeks on his plea.

Title: Pashanam Shaji: Bigg Boss Malayalam 2: Amritha and Abhirami confront Shaji for his derogatory comments during Adholokam task
Content: The ongoing ' Vellaripravinte Changathi ' task is creating a huge buzz in the Bigg Boss Malayalam house. In the recent episode, contestants Abhirami and Amritha lodged a complaint against Pashanam Shaji for his derogatory comments during one of the tasks.During the trial, the duo narrated the incident in which Shaji has mentioned them as 'women who are fighting among each other to sleep with him' during the 'Adholokam task'. They alleged that the comment was a disrespect to womanhood.On the other hand, Shaji defended that the comment was made on the characters the duo portrayed and not on the individuals. He added that he was playing the character, Gabbar Singh, in the task and the funny comment was made on Thangamma and Omana (the characters played by Amritha and Abhirami in the same task). Shaji also emphasised that he is someone who has immense respect for women.After the trial, the judge Arya asked the opinion of the housemates and the majority supported Abhirami and Amritha. Thus, Bigg Boss declared Shaji guilty. However, after the task, Shaji meets the duo and apologised to them for the comment.Besides the above case, the 59th day of the show also featured the trial on Reshma's complaint against Rajith Kumar Reshma confronted Rajith for his statements against her during the 'Call Center task'.

Title: Kochi: Asadi awards event to be held on Saturday
Content:
Representative image

KOCHI: The Asian school of architecture and design innovations (Asadi) has announced its third edition of Asadi Vastukala Mahati awards 2020. This year Asadi is honouring six women architects from south India, one each from five states.

The function will be held at Silver Sand Island, Vyttila, from 4pm on on Sunday. The awardees are Jayashree Deshpande (Maharashtra), A Subbalakshmi (Andhra Pradesh), Renu Hasan (Telangana), Neelam Manjunath (Karnataka) Sheila Sri Prakash (Tamil Nadu) and Jabeen Zacharias (Kerala). Kummanam Rajasekharan , former governor of Mizoram, Ernakulam MP Hibi Eden will be present. The keynote address will be delivered Binoy Viswam, MP.

Title: Vivo S1 Pro gets a price cut on India
Content:
NEW DELHI: Chinese smartphone Vivo has slashed the price of its mid-range smartphone Vivo S1 Pro. According to Mumbai-based retailer Mahesh Telecom, the Vivo S1 Pro has got a price cut of Rs 1,000. The smartphone was launched in January last year at Rs 19,990 and is now selling at Rs 18,990.

Vivo S1 Pro specifications

The Vivo S1 Pro features a 6.38-inch full HD+ display with 1080x2340 pixel resolution. The display is made scratch resistant with a coating of protective glass. The smartphone runs Android 9.0 Pie operating systems topped with Vivo’s own FunTouch OS.

The smartphone is powered by an octavos-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 665 processor paired with 8GBG of RAM and 128GB internal storage. Users can further expand the storage by adding a microSD card.

Coming to the camera capabilities, Vivo S1 Pro sports a quad-camera setup. The rear camera comprises of 48MP main sensor with f/1.8 aperture, 8MP ultra-wide-angle lens with f/2.2 aperture, 2MP macro lens with f/2.4 aperture and 2MP depth sensor with f/2.4 aperture. There is also a 32MP front-facing camera with f/2.0 aperture.

The smartphone comes equipped with an in-display fingerprint sensor and is backed by a 4,500 mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. In terms of connectivity, the smartphone offers Dual 4G, VoLTE, 3G, WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS, and USB Type C.

Recently, Vivo revealed that it will launch its high-end Nex 3S 5G smartphone in China on March 10. As per various leaks and rumours, the Vivo Nex 3S 5G is said to feature a 6.89-inch full HD+ AMOLED display and powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 processor. The Vivo Nex 3S 5G is said to pack 8GB/12GB of RAM and come in three storage options — 128GB,256GB, and 512GB.

Title: Kajol has THIS to say about rumours of fight with Saif Ali Khan over his Tanhaji comments
Content: Ajay Devgn’s latest film, ’ Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior ’ not only received undivided attention at the box-office but it also made some record-breaking collections. Recently, rumours were rife that Saif Ali Khan ’s comment that the film was not an accurate depiction of history but populist had upset Ajay and Kajol . Clearing the air on the same, Kajol reportedly said that she is not at all upset with Saif’s comments. In fact, she thinks that the actor has a great sense of humour and that he just talks and talks. The actress feels that they are supposed to pick and choose what they want to hear out of that.Earlier at the trailer launch of ‘ Sooryavanshi ’, Ajay too spoke about the same stating that there is nothing like that.While Kajol’s husband Ajay Devgn played the titular role in ‘Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior’, she was seen as his wife Savitribai Malusare. Saif essayed the antagonist, Udaybhan Rathod.Saif, in an earlier interview, had expressed concern about the altered political narrative of films like ‘Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior’. He reportedly said that he would really like to a part of a film industry that would take a stand that wouldn’t make mass kind of films like that.Meanwhile, on the work front, Saif was last seen in ‘ Jawaani Jaaneman ’ co-starring Alaya F and Tabu inn lead roles. Ajay, on the other hand, has some very interesting films in his pipeline which include, ‘Maidaan’, ‘RRR’, ‘Bhuj: The Pride Of India’ and the official remake of ‘Kaithi’.

Title: Kochi: Adalat for clearing tax arrears
Content:
KOCHI: Residents who have registered their title deeds at Edapally, Angamaly and Ernakulam sub-registrar offices and face action for undervaluation can now avoid paying huge taxes as a 70% relaxation on tax dues has been declared by the authorities.

As per the scheme, residents can clear their tax dues, by paying only 30% of the tax arrears. By paying the same, the residents can prevent revenue recovery proceedings against them, sources said.

Office of Edapally sub-registrar informed that the residents can avail the scheme by attending an Adalat being held at the sub-registrar office from 10am onwards on Thursday to avoid revenue recovery proceedings.

Sources said that residents are urged to make use of this short-term scheme so that arrears can be cleared on time. Officials said that even those who are not intimated about the tax arrears by the sub-registrar office directly can also visit the office during the adalat to check if their title deeds are undervalued and to see if they would face any action for the same.

Similar adalats will be held at Ernakulam and Angamaly sub-registrar offices during the same time on Thursday. Officials sources said that the residents can make use of the scheme till March 31.

Title: Investigation agency can’t change with govt: Ajit Pawar
Content:
Ajit Pawar

NAGPUR: Rejecting all allegations made against him in the multi-crore irrigation scam, deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar once against opposed any move to hand over the investigation to central agencies like the CBI, ED, Serious Fraud Investigating Office (SFIO), and I-T Department.

Ahead of next week’s final hearing into the PILs filed by petitioners Jan Manch and Atul Jagtap , Pawar, who is respondent number 7, asserted that no exceptional case was made out by petitioners for handing over the investigation to central agencies.

Earlier, the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) had opposed the handing over of the investigation to the CBI, ED, SFIO and I-T, saying it would hamper its ongoing investigations. It said it was working diligently and registered many offences against contractors and VIDC officials through its Special Investigations Teams (SITs) in Nagpur and Amravati divisions.

Pawar in his latest affidavit filed before the Nagpur bench of Bombay high court this week stated that change of government after assembly polls can not be the grounds for change of investigating agency. “When the petitioner has full faith in investigating agency earlier, how has he lost faith after the change in the government?” he said.

Questioning the locus standi of Jagtap, Pawar said he was himself the contractor and had filed many tenders in various projects. “The petitioner shouldn’t use courts for settling personal scores. He’s having a mala fide notion of a scam which is yet to be proved. The courts can’t look or supervise investigations and also can’t direct that particular person should me made an accused,” he said.

Denying Jagtap’s allegations that the investigation against Pawar was not being conducted properly, the three-time deputy chief minister said he was being questioned and interrogated on September 11 last year, and also made to provide written replies to questionnaire. “The petitioner shouldn’t have biased approach as investigations against him were conducted during previous government and various FIRs against contractors were lodged in their tenure. I can’t be called on to answer every question, as I am not made as an accused in any complaint so far.”

❤️❤️ @imrealasim https://t.co/SAxeS4kQNK — Himanshi khurana (@realhimanshi) 1583336174000

Title: National Seminar on CAA at Nuals, Kalamassery
Content:
KOCHI: A three-day national seminar on Citizenship and Constitution will be held at the National University of Advanced Legal Studies (Nuals), Kalamassery, from March 5 to 7.

The inaugural ceremony will be presided over by Nuals vice-chancellor K C Sunny. The inauguration and the keynote address will be rendered by Central University of Kerala pro vice-chancellor Jayaprasad. There will be technical sessions, including paper presentations by students, from various universities across the country on all aspects relating to nationality, issues of NRC, Assam NRC , statelessness, IDPs and refugees and migrants.

On Saturday, a national colloquium to be attended by dignitaries from various fields including academicians, politicians and activists will be held.

Title: Take Sajjan Kumar to AIIMS: SC
Content:
Former Congress MP Sajjan Kumar

NEW DELHI: Supreme Court on Wednesday ordered that former Congress MP Sajjan Kumar , sentenced to life imprisonment in a 1984 anti-Sikh riots case, be taken to All India Institute of Medical Sciences on Thursday for a check-up to ascertain whether he suffered from any major ailment requiring hospitalisation.

After hearing Kumar's counsel Vikas Singh, a bench of Chief Justice S A Bobde and Justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant said, "It appears that there is a certificate by Dr Randhir Sud, chairman, Institute of Digestive & Hepatobiliary Sciences , Medanta, to the effect that Sajjan Kumar needs to be examined in order to rule out major illnesses."

Solicitor general Tushar Mehta said Kumar was due for a medical examination at AIIMS according to a December 10 report of the hospital. "We direct that Kumar be produced before the AIIMS board on March 5," the court said.

Title: Police foil hack of Rs 200-crore Tata Sons a/c; top bank account executive and tech expert among accused
Content:
Tata Sons

IndusInd

Palghar Crime Branch

Tasleem Ansari

Nagaland

Tasleem Ansari

Limra Inc Micro Finance Company

The seven were picked up from the parking lot of a mall. Nine mobile phones, a tablet connected to a keypad and aaccount statement were seized from them.Seven persons, including an employee ofBank, were arrested on Tuesday in Nallasopara minutes before they could hack into a Tata Sons account that had Rs 200 crore.The seven were picked up from the parking lot of a mall in Nallasopara around 5.30 pm. Nine mobile phones, a tablet connected to a keypad and a Tata Sons account statement were seized from them.The Nallasopara unit of thehas identified the accused as – IndusInd account executive, tech expert Anant Bhupati Ghosh, Naseem Yasin Siddiqui, Gunjeev Shamjibhai Barayya, Saroj Ramniwas Chaudhary, Satish Ajay Gupta, and Anand Pandurang Nalawade.Preliminary investigations have revealed that the seven had planned to transfer Rs 150 crore in three tranches of Rs 50 crore each and transfer the money to an account in Nagaland. The police on Wednesday refused to share the details of theaccount citing ongoing investigations.An officer privy to the operation said the gang was busted based on a tip-off and that a team had tracked the gang members’ movements for a few days. “There was a lot of chatter online between the group members and calls back and forth that we had managed to tap into. They were looking for a hacker with a proven track-record. But when they could not find one, they decided to do it themselves using the insider information Ansari had provided them,” he said.The targeted account was at the Chembur branch of IndusInd Bank. The account – a fixed deposit – had been dormant for some time and Ansari had told his associates that the withdrawals will not get noticed.The officer quoted above said the bank has been informed about the arrest of Ansari.Curiously, just two days before they were busted, two of the group members -- Naseem Siddiqui and Anand Nalawade -- had started a micro-finance business in Vashi. The company with an office in Sector 17 was namedThe cops believe Naseem was the brain behind the plan and he was in touch with his Nagaland-based contact. “Naseem had promised the Nagaland-based man 20 per cent commission,” said another officer.Assistant Inspector Siddhwa Jaybhaye said the seven have been booked under sections 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) and 511 (attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment) of the Indian Penal Code. Mirror’s attempts to contact Indus Ind Bank’s public relations executive proved futile.

Title: Exclusive! Janhvi Kapoor to ring in her birthday at Anshula’s house
Content: Tiger Shroff, who is one of the most loved actors in Bollywood, has taken to social media by storm with his debut single ‘Unbelievable’. He has now taken to his Instagram handle to thank his fans as his song is placed in the 2nd position on the Billboard global charts.

Title: Jothe Jotheyalli highlights the plight of farmers
Content: In popular serial Jothe Jotheyalli , protagonist Aryavardhan is now creates awareness about social and environmental issues which has got accolades from government officials.In the recent episode, one of the biggest challenges faced IN metropolitan areas is waste management and garbage disposal. This issue was highlighted in the serial adeptly. The experiment got immense praise and has rapidly gained popularity among the viewers. In its latest episode which on air, Aryavardhan takes up the issue of farmers in India. He even honors the farming community members, depicting them as the backbone of the country.

Title: Civic panel OK for Rs 100 crore new Gokhale bridge
Content:
Richa Pinto (File photo)

MUMBAI: A proposal for the demolition and reconstruction of Andheri ’s Gokhale bridge , which will cost the civic body over Rs 100 crore, recieved a nod from the Shiv Sena-led civic panel on Wednesday. The bridge is a key link between the eastern and western parts of the suburb.

BJP corporator Jyoti Alvani said that despite the July 2018 incident, when the pedestrian section of the bridge collapsed, causing the death of two and injuring three, BMC took a long time to bring the proposal for approval. “There was no consensus on which part of the bridge fell under the BMC and which part was under the railways, causing a delay in the proposal for the demolition and reconstruction of its approach roads,” she said.

After the 2018 incident, a consultant was appointed to estimate the cost of a new bridge. The initial estimate was pegged at Rs87 crore, but civic officials expected the final cost to increase.

Title: Parked truck on Ballari Road kills two Harley riders
Content:
stationary lorry

Bengaluru

They were on the way to a temple when they crashed into truck near DevanahalliTwo friends from a group of six who had set off on a trek which was to be followed by a visit to a temple, have died on the international airport road. The two men who were riding a Harley Davidson, crashed into athat had been parked on the road after it broke down.Their four friends, who were riding behind them, were unaware that the two men had met with an accident. When they stopped to check why a crowd had gathered on the highway, they saw that it was their friends who had crashed up.One of them had died on the spot, while the other was rushed to a hospital by his friends in a car, but he too died enroute. Both the victims were software professionals working in different companies and all six of them were school friends.The victims have been identified as YG Srihari, 27, a resident of Girinagar and HM Madhu, 27, of Mandya. The accident happened between 8.15 am to 8.20 am on Sunday on the Shidlaghatta flyover on theInternational Airport road, near Devanahalli. Madhu died on the spot while Srihari succumbed to injuries enroute to a hospital in Bengaluru.The group of friends were going on three bikes and a car. They had planned to go to Lepakshi in Andhra Pradesh and had reportedly left the city at around 6 am. They had stopped for breakfast at an eatery near the Airport and continued towards their destination at a different pace.“We do not know what the real cause of the accident was. As I was coming behind the Harley Davidson bike, I saw a group of people gathered on the flyover. I stopped to check and found that two of my friends had met with an accident. This apart, I cannot share anything as we are in extreme shock,” said R Karthik, one of the victim’s friends who has filed a complaint.Srihari was riding the bike and Madhu was riding pillion. After Srihari rammed into the stationary lorry with a Maharashtra registration number, both must have been thrown off the bike due to the impact.“Madhu who was riding pillion, fell off the bike and came under the wheels of a lorry with a Tamil Nadu registration number and died on the spot. The driver of the stationary lorry, had gone to get a mechanic after his lorry broke down on the highway,” said a police officer attached to the Chikkaballapura traffic police station.The spot where the accident occurred is prone to accidents and cautionary boards are present. The speed limit is 30 kmph. The police suspect that the rider of the Harley Davidson bike was speeding. The drivers of both the lorries have been booked. The post-mortem was conducted at a government hospital on the Chikkaballapura Road.The bodies have been handed over to the family members after the post mortem.A case of death by negligence (IPC 304A), rash driving on a public way (IPC 279) and danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation (IPC 283) has been registered.

Title: It’s a reunion for Arindam Sil and Abir
Content: Vidya Balan is all set to kick-start shooting of her upcoming film, ‘Sherni’ in Balaghat, Madhya Pradesh by the last week of October. The makers have roped in a special agency to monitor safety norms on the set amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Kochi: Marine Drive continues to be poorly maintained
Content:
The pathetic condition of marine drive walkaway

KOCHI: Despite intervention of the Kerala high court, the walkway at Marine Drive remains poorly maintained. Tiles on the pathway have chipped, the concrete base around trees have cracked and ubiquitous wild bushes are proving invasive.

Renjith G Thampy, who filed a petition through advocate K Jaju Babu highlighting the need for proper maintenance of the walkway, said, "The Greater Cochin Development Authority is least bothered about it."

An affidavit filed by GCDA secretary Jinumol Varughese on February 10 said the authority has already carried out maintenance work for Rs 90,000. Essential work was initiated on January 6, involving tiling and skirting of two trees. The Cochin Smart Mission Ltd floated a tender for executing development projects at the walkway on January 20, and GCDA is expecting a favourable outcome, the affidavit said.

Thampy has filed a counter affidavit. "The directions of the high court have not been fully complied with. On January 23, GCDA said that it has decided to complete the work without waiting for the outcome of the CSML project," he said.

Title: Ruby Hall asked to repay Rs 4.5 lakh loan taken for patient’s treatment
Content:
hospital

deputy charity commissioner

Ruby Hall Clinic

Vicky Dongre

Gokhale Nagar

In an unusual order, theon Wednesday askedto pay the Rs 4.5-lakh loan taken by the kin of a patient who died during treatment at the hospital.Sarika Dongre, wife of deceased, complained to the charity commissioner, asking for refund of money paid to the hospital despite belonging to a poor economy class. However, the charity officer has refused to consider the refund demand.resident Dongre (34) was admitted to Ruby Hall Clinic for acute pancreatitis and secondary acute respiratory distress on December 11, 2019. He expired on January 16. The bill incurred amounted to Rs 12.68 lakh, of which the family had paid some and Rs 6.79 lakh remained unpaid. Soon after Dongre had died, his relatives vandalised the hospital, creating chaos at the hospital. However, the issue was sorted out by police with no case being registered.Ruby Hall Clinic officials had then complained to the charity commissioner, claiming the relatives were not ready to pay the bill after Dongre’s demise. “During the entire month, the family never spoke about indigent patients’ fund (IPF), a scheme under which poor are provided free or discounted treatment. Even his brother took responsibility of paying the bill. After Dongre’s demise, they created ruckus and were not ready to pay the pending bill,” the hospital said in a complaint dated January 29, 2020, adding, “On humanitarian grounds, the hospital has forgone the unpaid bill of Rs 6.79 lakh, which is a huge amount. In spite of this, the relatives are claiming for refund of the paid bill. We got information from the social media that the brother runs a business and they cannot be considered poor under any scheme. Despite this, the family is insisting and compelling the hospital to consider the patient for free treatment and asking for refund. Such behaviour is not acceptable.”On the other hand, Sarika complained to the charity commissioner, claiming that despite informing officials about the IPF scheme, the hospital “forced them to pay” on regular intervals. “Till now, we have spent more than Rs 20 lakh for my husband’s treatment, for which we took loans from kin. After his death, the hospital is avoiding to pay concession fees. We also informed them that I have two children who are studying, but to no avail. They kept telling us to approach the charity commissioner,” she said.Deputy charity commissioner Navnath Jagtap said their decision was accepted by both parties. “The bill paid by any patient cannot be refunded as it’s a charitable hospital. The family pays the bill when they have the capacity, but the charity office comes in the picture if poor patients have no money to continue treatment. It is always better to inform the hospital and us initially if they belong to the poor patient’s category, which avoids chaos in future. The hospital has waived a huge chunk of bill, which has to be appreciated. The deceased is survived by two children, looking at which we have asked the hospital to take care of the loan of Rs 4.5 lakh taken for treatment,” he said.An unhappy Bomi Bhote, chief executive officer of Ruby Hall Clinic, said, “The hospital, despite the patient not being a genuine case of IPF, on humanitarian ground gave a huge discount. If the loan has been approved, the family has a financial condition to repay it. On the other hand, the money paid was more than Rs 6 lakh, which they were asking for refund. Poor patients don’t have that money to pay or even don’t get loans. A person getting loan and paying lakhs can’t be financially poor,” he said.

Title: Kangana Ranaut puts on 20 kilos for Thalaivi
Content: We had earlier reported that Kangana Ranaut has not only learnt Tamil and Bharathanatyam for her role as J Jayalalithaa in Vijay’s Thalaivi , but has also gained 10 kilos to play the former actress and CM of Tamil Nadu. Now, we have learnt from the actress herself that she’s put an additional 10 kilos for the film.In a video, posted by the Instagram page of Kangana’s team, the actress introduces her trainer Yogesh and says, “Hello everyone! We are resuming our workout after Thalaivi and ye hain mere trainer Yogesh.” She then asks him to take a guess how many kilos she has put on. “My guess is 10, I used to be 52,” she says, and Yogesh says, “not less than 15.” And when Kangana weighs herself, the scale shows 70.3 kg — an addition of almost 18 kg.A source says, “She has to put on a total of 20 kilos to play the role to perfection. But what’s interesting is that she has to lose all of that in two months to start work on her other two films – Tejas and Dhaakad. While she plays the role of an Indian Air Force pilot in the former, the latter is a high-octane action film.”Meanwhile, the team of Thalaivi is working round the clock to ensure the film releases as scheduled in June this year.

Title: Watch new serial Sangarsha soon on television
Content: New serial Sangarsha which has veteran actress Vanitha Vasu in the lead role will go on air son. Sangarsha is the remake of the Tamil serial Ayudha Ezhuthu. The promo of the serial has already aroused the expectations of viewers.The serial revolves around a powerful woman Byradevi who wants everything to happen as per her wish in the village, she wants school to be closed as she thinks everyone is deserting the village after getting education. While, Deputy Commissioner Indira aspires to implement the law for the welfare of citizens.

Title: City clubs cancel Holi festivities
Content:
cases

coronavirus

Sports Club

Voices

Vikram Shah

Shyam Mehta

With Covid-19 infection reaching 70 countries including India which reported spike in, prominent clubs are leaving nothing to chanceAs thescare takes the country in its grip with 26 fresh positive cases reported from Gurgaon, Delhi, Jaipur, Agra and Telangana– and two suspected cases closer home in Ahmedabad – city clubs are cancelling Holi parties to avoid mega public gatherings.Karnavati Club, Rajpath Club,, YMCA Club and others had earlier planned dry Holi parties with gulal, giving the more popular rain dance parties a miss. However, now with a spurt in positive cases, the clubs are leaving nothing to chance.They have therefore decided to cancel Holi parties this year to do their bit to prevent spread of the deadly virus. According to the club managements, usually the members and their guests are well-travelled and take off frequently to countries abroad for business purposes. It is quite possible that people may be carriers of the virus and therefore it is only wise to put in place strict social distancing measures to avoid human-to-human spread of the disease, they say.Earlier on Wednesday, PM Narendra Modi too had announced his decision to not celebrate Holi in a tweet that stated: “Experts across the world have advised to reduce mass gatherings to avoid the spread of COVID-19. Hence, this year I have decided not to participate in any Holi Milan programme.”Ketan Patel, secretary of Karnavati Club, who was recently on a Delhi-Ahmedabad flight, said, “Seeing people with face masks at the airport and in the flight, I was terrified. The cases being reported worldwide are a cause for serious concern. Looking at the present circumstances, the club management decided to cancel the preplanned Holi party.”Likewise, Sports Club has also cancelled their Holi event. They have already put up a list of dos and don’ts on the club’s notice board to apprise members of the precautions that need to be taken.Chiranjiv Patel, Vice President of Sports Club, told Mirror, “Holi celebration is an annual event but with concerns mounting over spike in coronavirus cases, we didn’t want to take any chance and decided to cancel the event for the safety of our members.”Rajpath Club has not been conducting the rain dance parties for many years now and this time they aren’t planning a Holi party either. Talking to Mirror, Dr, Senior Vice President of Rajpath Club said, “We were among the first to introduce rain dance in the club circuit but for the past few years we aren’t organising these parties in order to save water. Moreover, in a situation like this we also cannot think of a mass gathering. Therefore, there won’t be any Holi party in Rajpath Club.”Aprivate party organiser had booked YMCA club for a Holi party about a month ago. However, they are in the process of cancelling it., CEO of YMCA Club, said, “With a sudden spike in the cases in India and more countries across the world reporting deaths and fresh cases, organisers are rethinking about the Holi event. In all likelihood, looking at the situation, it will be cancelled.”

Title: India's mental and technical frailties were exposed by New Zealand: VVS Laxman
Content:
Virat Kohli talks to Kane Williamson after losing the Test series against New Zealand in Christchurch. (AFP Ph... Read More

NEW DELHI: Former Indian batsman VVS Laxman expressing his disappointment at Team India's Test series defeat against New Zealand but was left impressed in the manner in which Indian captain Virat Kohli didn't offer any excuses for the defeat.

In his column for the Times of India, Laxman wrote, "It was refreshing to hear Virat Kohli offer no excuses for the 0-2 loss in New Zealand and stress on acceptance of the outcome, but I hope India do address the issues that hurt them badly in probably one of their worst overseas outings of late. The next Test series isn't until December, so the temptation to write this off as a one-off could be overwhelming. But if India wants to avoid a repeat of this display in Australia later in the year, they can't afford to gloss over what transpired in New Zealand."

In the two Tests, on traditional New Zealand green wickets, India managed scores of 165, 191, 242 and 124.

"I am sure the batting group would be hurting, especially, since they take a lot of pride in preparation but were caught napping by New Zealand's gameplans for two Test matches in a row. I agree the conditions were tricky and challenging, but that's no reason why there shouldn't have been a greater application from the batsmen. New Zealand's plans were straightforward enough - to get swing with the new ball and make use of the lateral movement and, should that fail to produce wickets, to resort to the liberal use of the short ball," Laxman added.

There were only four half-centuries across four innings in this series with techniques of some of the players like Ajinkya Rahane , Mayank Agarwal against seam and swing leaving a lot to be desired.

"Ajinkya Rahane's tortured stint in the second innings in Christchurch best illustrated India's confusion. For an experienced and accomplished batsman who has scored runs all around the world, Rahane seemed all at sea against Neil Wagner and Kyle Jamieson 's short-ball barrage, and tried to hit his way out of trouble. On that surface, it was a method never designed to succeed," Laxman opined.

Skipper Kohli's 38 runs in four innings was one of the biggest setbacks for the Indians in the series. Kohli's low contributions were 2, 19, 3 and 14.

"The other aspect that stood out was a repetition of mistakes from the same batsmen. Virat was trapped leg before to the ball coming in twice in the second Test, Mayank Agarwal fell in similar fashion in both innings in Christchurch to Trent Boult 's inswingers, Prithvi Shaw was cramped up and dismissed fending balls following him in the second innings of both Tests. Test cricket is an unforgiving cauldron where there is no room for tentativeness. India's technical and mental frailties were badly exposed by a New Zealand side that looked out for the count during the T20s, but that knows how to win at home better than most other teams," Laxman wrote.

Indian pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah endured a dry spell in the ODIs and drew flak from some quarters as India lost the series 0-3.

"It was great to see Jasprit Bumrah return to somewhere near his best after an iffy ODI series," Laxman concluded.

Title: Car used by Shahrukh recovered
Content:
Shahrukh Pathan in police custody

NEW DELHI: The Esteem car, which Shahrukh Pathan used to escape police, has been recovered from Kairana . Shahrukh had tried to scare head constable Dahiya by pointing a gun at him during the recent clashes. His mobile phone has also been recovered. However, the gun could not be found.

Police said he is giving vague answers over where he threw it at. "Shahrukh claimed to have bought the pistol two years back. He kept it for show-off and carried it on the day of the incident," said a police officer.

Title: Organic markets a big hit in Kochi
Content:
Representative image

KOCHI: A unique vegetable market in Kakkanad is today one of the most sought-after destination for Kochiites looking out to buy organic vegetables and fruits. The Sunday market sells a wide variety of pesticide-free vegetables and fruits that include lettuce, pumpkin, lady's finger, cucumber, yam, tapioca, papaya, chilli, banana, string beans, snake gourd, bitter gourd vegetables and tubers, among others.

The market gained prominence after Nattu Nanma, a group of 30 farmers, came together four years ago to sell organic farm produce. Over the years, it has become popular among customers who come from various parts of the city. Farmers from Chalakkudy, Cherthala, Palakkad and distant areas of Ernakulam sell their products here.

Induchoodan S, vice-president of Nattu Nanma, said the farmers ensure that they sell only organic products in the market. "We even visit the farm, where the vegetables and fruits are cultivated land and fix the rates keeping in mind the interests of both consumers and farmers. Since farmers sell their products directly to consumers by avoiding middlemen, they earn their profits," he said.

The consumers can also directly communicate with the farmers through a WhatsApp group and can book the products before they reach market.

The Sunday market at Kakkanad is not the only to hold the fascination of the customers. A few other such organic markets have come up in the city, which have also got takers. One such Sunday market is operational at Kacheripady for the past few months. "I bring pesticide-free vegetables from Cherthala and get a good amount from the market," says Satheesh, who sells both vegetables and tubers .

The consumers admit the price is on a bit higher side. "Though the price is high, I buy vegetables from this market. I believe these are organic products. When we eat banana, we know the difference between organic and the one grown using pesticides. Organic ones are tastier," says Abilash Sugunadas living in Kacheripady.

Title: Losing a partner makes you more prone to succumbing to skin cancer
Content: If you have misunderstood the headline, here is some clarity. Individuals who experience the loss of a partner are not likely to be diagnosed with melanoma or skin cancer but are said to be at an increased risk of dying from the disease, according to a new research.Stress can act in strange and dangerous ways. While previous studies have suggested a link between various types of stress and progression of melanoma, which may have played a role in the finding, the researchers suggest that an alternative explanation could be that bereaved people no longer have a close person to help notice skin changes.The absence of a close person delays the possible detection of melanoma, and therefore diagnosis. And by the time the cancer shows up, it is already quite advanced and is more aggressive and harder to treat.According to Angel Wong, lead author and Research Fellow at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, "Many factors can influence melanoma survival. Our work suggests that melanoma may take longer to detect in bereaved people, potentially because partners play an important role in spotting early signs of skin cancer." The paper was published in the British Journal of Dermatology."Support for recently bereaved people, including showing how to properly check their skin, could be vital for early detection of skin cancer, and thus improved survival."The researchers, led by the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine and Aarhus University Hospital, investigated whether bereaved individuals had a higher risk of being diagnosed with, or dying from, melanoma than the non-bereaved.They used data from two large population-based studies between 1997 and 2017 in the UK and Denmark.They found that melanoma patients who experienced bereavement had a 17 per cent higher risk of dying from their melanoma compared with those who were not bereaved, with similar results seen in both the UK and Denmark.This study also showed that those who had lost a partner were 12 per cent less likely to be diagnosed with melanoma compared with non-bereaved persons, with 620 and 1667 bereaved diagnosed in the UK and Denmark respectively over the 20 year period, compared with 6,430 and 16,166 non-bereaved.This delays detection of a possible melanoma, and therefore diagnosis, until the cancer has progressed to later stages, when it is generally more aggressive and harder to treat.Each year, 197,000 people are diagnosed with melanoma globally.The survival rate of melanoma patients is relatively high, depending on what stage the cancer is at detection. Early detection and treatment are crucial for improving survival.The researchers encourage family members or caregivers to perform skin examinations for the remaining partner, and call for clinicians to lower their threshold for undertaking skin examinations in bereaved people."Detecting melanoma early can greatly improve survival and partners are key to this. Those without a partner should be vigilant in checking their skin, particularly in hard to reach locations such as the back, scalp, and ears," suggested Dr Walayat Hussain of the British Association of Dermatologists.

Title: Saurabh Bharadwaj: Peace panel to hold meet of citizens, MLAs
Content:
Delhi assembly's committee on peace and harmony chairperson Saurabh Bharadwaj

NEW DELHI: Delhi assembly's committee on peace and harmony will convene a meeting of citizens and MLAs from the riot-affected areas on Thursday. Prominent local religious leaders of all communities are likely to participate in the meeting, the committee's chairperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said.

Meanwhile, the state government's peacekeeping efforts to restore normalcy in different parts of northeast Delhi have started yielding results. The displaced victims of Old Garhi Mandu village started moving back to their homes on Wednesday.

Title: ‘Atrangi Re’: Aanand L Rai’s Akshay Kumar, Sara Ali Khan and Dhanush starrer goes on floors
Content: In what can be termed as a never-seen-before combination, Akshay Kumar Sara Ali Khan and Dhanush are coming together for their next titled, ‘ Atrangi Re '. After raising curiosity about the film with its teaser, the Aanand L Rai film finally went on floors. We got our hands on a picture where clapboard with the film’s name can be seen. Along with it is also a box of sweets and a lighted diya.As per reports, the film will star Sara Ali Khan in a double role, with Akshay Kumar and Dhanush playing her lovers in each timeline. It’s also rumoured that the track with Akshay will be set in Bihar and the one with Dhanush in Madurai.The AR Rahman musical is being helmed by Aanand L Rai and produced by Bhushan Kumar’s T-Series. The film is written by Himanshu Sharma.Meanwhile, on the work front, Akshay has some very interesting projects in his hands which include, ‘ Sooryavanshi ’, ‘Bachchan Pandey’, ‘Laxmmi Bomb’ and ‘Bell Bottom’.Sara Ali Khan, on the other hand, will next be seen in the official remake of David Dhawan’s ‘Coolie No. 1’ co-starring Varun Dhawan in the lead role.

Title: Coronavirus in Hyderabad India: Two more Covid-19 cases suspected in Hyderabad
Content:
Employees come out of Raheja Mindspace building no. 20 in Hi-Tec City after some firms suspended work followin... Read More

HYDERABAD: Two days after a 24-year-old software professional was confirmed as the first case of Covid-19 in Hyderabad, two more suspected cases tested positive in the first round of testing at the ICMR laboratory at Gandhi Medical College in Secunderabad. The samples have been sent to the National Institute of Virology (NIV), Pune, for final confirmation. Across India, 23 new cases were recorded on Wednesday, taking the total number of positive case to 29.

State health authorities also said that the first Covid-19 positive patient was stable even as 39 more with symptoms were isolated at Gandhi Hospital and Fever Hospital on Wednesday. Another 55 people, who approached authorities for tests, were advised to quarantine themselves at home for 14 days.

The two new cases whose samples have been sent to NIV include a software professional from Raheja Mindspace in the IT hub who had visited Italy. The other is a sanitation worker at Apollo Hospitals at Secunderabad where the first positive patient had been treated initially. "The NIV report is expected on Thursday evening," said Dr G Srinivas Rao, Telangana director public health.

45 who tested negative discharged, isolated at home

The two patients are being kept in isolation at Gandhi Hospital. The 45 others who tested negative were discharged and advised strict home isolation for 14 days.” On Wednesday, state health minister Eatala Rajender asked IT professionals and others not to panic. “Currently we have only one confirmed positive case,” he said. “The two others are yet to be reconfirmed. The extensive sanitisation activity at Mahendra Hills is also a precautionary measure. We are not taking any chances. We are following protocol for surveillance but that doesn’t mean the virus has spread.”

Meanwhile, 20 private medical colleges with 1,000 beds have also been roped in to house suspected Covid-19 patients.

Title: Sensex, Nifty inch higher, virus fears limit gains
Content:
(File photo)

NEW DELHI: Domestic equity indices edged up on Thursday, supported by a rise in Asian and US markets, but worries over a spike in coronavirus cases in the country kept gains in check.

The NSE Nifty index rose 0.25% to 11,276.3 in early trade, while the benchmark BSE Sensex was up 0.26% at 38,505.2.

The markets closed lower on Wednesday as the total number of known coronavirus cases rose sharply, fuelling concerns that a rapid spread could further hit an already slowing economy.

"Markets will be volatile as virus fears persist, it is very difficult to say that the trend has changed right now," said Siddharth Khemka, head of retail research at Motilal Oswal Securities.

Wall Street surged on Wednesday after former US vice president Joe Biden, considered less likely to raise taxes and impose new regulations than rival Bernie Sanders, rolled to victories on the biggest day of voting in the Democratic nomination campaign.

The US House of Representatives also approved an $8.3 billion funding bill to combat the spread of the coronavirus.

India is pushing state-run banks to approve new loans amounting to Rs 50,000-60,000 crore ($6.8-$8.2 billion) by the end of March, two government sources told Reuters, in efforts to shore up a stuttering economy as the virus spreads.

Consumer goods company Hindustan Unilever Ltd was the top boost to the indexes, rising as much as 3.6% to a one-week high.

IT stocks also contributed, with Tata Consultancy Services Ltd up 1.4% and HCL Technologies Ltd rising 3%.

Large cap banks and energy firms were among the top drags. ICICI Bank Ltd fell 1.5%, while Reliance Industries Ltd slipped 0.8%.

Title: Trupti Toradmal looks beautiful as ever in THIS candid pictures
Content: After the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Forensic Medical Board ruled out the murder angle in Sushant Singh Rajput’s death report, an audio tape of Dr Sudhir Gupta has been leaked wherein he reportedly claims that the late actor was ‘murdered’. When ETimes reached out to Sushant Singh Rajput’s family lawyer Vikas Singh for his reaction on the same, he stated, “To be honest, I tweeted my stand yesterday but I would like to speak to him before I take a final call. He is not answering my phone, what if he changes his stand, one doesn’t know. I will wait till I can talk to him.”

Title: Coronavirus: NZC providing regular updates to all including IPL-bound players
Content: AUCKLAND: Perturbed by the fast-spreading novel coronavirus threat, New Zealand Cricket (NZC) is sensitising its contracted players, including the six who will play in the Indian Premier League (IPL), about preventive measures to deal with the deadly outbreak.In India, 29 positive cases have been reported so far, including 16 Italian tourists. World over, the virus has claimed over 3,000 lives besides infecting more than 90,000 people."All New Zealand players, men and women, are being updated on latest developments, including best practice and preventive measures, as new information comes to hand," NZC Head of Public Affairs Richard Boock said in a statement to PTI.The six New Zealand players, who are set to play in the IPL are Jimmy Neesham (KXIP), Lockie Ferguson (Kolkata Knight Riders), Mitchell McClenaghan and Trent Boult (both Mumbai Indians ), Kane Williamson (Sunrisers Hyderabad) and Mitchell Santner (Chennai Super Kings).Boock also said that the cricket board is in constant touch with the country's health, foreign affairs and sports ministry to get regular updates which will ensure health safety for its players."NZC is in constant communication with its chief medical officer, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, the Ministry of Health, and Sport NZ, and is monitoring updates from the World Health Organisation to ensure compliance with best practice," Boock stated.The BCCI has already said that they it is going ahead with the IPL as scheduled from March 29.The Indian Board is, however, yet to come out with any travel advisory for foreign as well as national players.During IPL, the number of selfie and autograph hunters increases manifold and it is expected that players might be advised to refrain from public gatherings given prevailing circumstances.The England team, currently touring Sri Lanka, has been told to avoid handshakes and restrict pleasantries to fist-bumps.

Title: Nicki Minaj's husband Kenneth Petty booked for failing to register as sex offender
Content: Rapper Nicki Minaj 's husband Kenneth Petty is currently in a legal turmoil as he failed to register as a sex offender in Calfornia after relocating from New York.Petty surrendered himself to the authorities after failing to register as a sex offender, following which he was taken into custody.According to reports, the records from Sheriff's Department of Los Angeles county suggests that Beverly Hills Police Department arrested Petty earlier in November 2019 but the charges against him have not been ascertained.He was set free after a USD 20,000 bond.As told to a news portal by the US Attorney's office, the 41-year-old appeared in the court for the first time on Wednesday. The proceedings included the hearings of his bond and its arraignment.Petty was pleaded not guilty and has since then been released on a bond of USD 100,000."He is required to submit to electronic monitoring and his travel was restricted to Southern California," Fox News quoted the US Attorney's Office.Petty will further have a status conference on March 23 which will determine the following steps in the trial to be taken place on April 28.He was earlier convicted in 1995 for the first-degree rape of a minor girl.

Title: Calamity-wise list submitted to Centre: CM
Content:
File photo of Pinarayi Vijayan

Thiruvananthapuram: The state government has submitted a detailed calamity-wise expenditure list for the financial year 2019-20 to the Centre seeking financial assistance of Rs 2,101.88 crore from the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF) for the losses suffered by the state during the floods and landslides in August last year.

"The state had submitted a memorandum asking for an assistance of Rs 2,101.88 crore from NDRF in connection with the 2019 floods. But, to consider this memorandum, the Centre in its letter dated February 16, had asked to submit the calamity-wise expenditure list," chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan told the assembly on Wednesday.

The Centre is yet to release any emergency fund from the NDRF in the wake of the 2019 floods, he said while replying to a calling attention motion moved by CPM MLA James Mathew 'to exert pressure on the central government for release of flood relief fund to the state'.

Elaborating on the central aid received so far after the 2018 deluge, the CM said, the state had submitted a memorandum requesting for an aid of Rs 5,616 crore. But the Centre sanctioned only Rs 2,904.85 crore from NDRF, he pointed out.

In 2019-20, the Centre sanctioned only the first instalment of Rs 52.27 crore as state's share from the NDRF, Vijayan said. "The memorandum prepared by the state relief commissioner seeking assistance of Rs 2,101.88 crore was submitted to the home ministry," the CM added.

Title: Mahesh Babu urges fans to take precautions amid coronavirus outbreak
Content:
Safety always comes first. Do not panic and stay safe. #CoronaAlert https://t.co/kb0TplHYLV — Mahesh Babu (@urstrulyMahesh) 1583326038000

Superstar Mahesh Babu, who is very popular in South India, has expressed concern over the coronavirus outbreak in the country and advised fans to take precautions and follow the government’s instructions during tough times.Mahesh Babu, 44, has become a household name in Southern film industry due to the vast popularity of his films such as Okkadu, Srimanthudu, Maharshi, Bharat Ane Nenu, Businessman, Pokiri to name a few.The Sarileru Nekevvaru actor took to Twitter and wrote, ''Safety always comes first. Do not panic and stay safe. #CoronaAlert''The coronavirus has continued to spread globally, with concerns in China, South Korea, Singapore, Japan, Thailand and India. As of March 4, the number of confirmed cases of the virus is nearing 80,400. The number of deaths stands at 3000. Of those, 31 occurred outside mainland China On the work front, Mahesh Babu has reportedly been approached to play a crucial role in Chiranjeevi’s 152nd film tentatively titled Acharya. The film has been directed by Koratala Siva and bankrolled by Konidela Production Company in collaboration with Matinee Entertainment.

Title: Darshan discharged from hospital
Content: Challenging Star Darshan who got admitted to hospital following acute abdomen pain has been discharged from the hospital on Wednesday night. The actor who has fully recovered from the stomach pain will soon resume shooting for the magnum opus Rajaveera Madakari Nayaka Darshan said, “I was suffering from gastroenteritis because of eating at irregular times, I am absolutely fine now.” He got admitted in the wee hours of Wednesday morning. The actor’s next Roberrt will hit screens in April.

Title: Karnataka Budget 2020: CM BS Yediyurappa presents Karnataka budget
Content:
Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa at the Vidhan Soudha. (ANI photo)

* Saturdays to be no-bag days for students: Yediyurappa

* CM Yediyurappa announces a health and wellness cluster to Shivamogga.

Read full text of Karnataka Budget here

* Film city project shifted out of Mysuru city

* The budget announces free land for Belagavi-Dharwad new rail line project via Kittur, that was first sanctioned in the Union budget. BSY govt to bear 50% of expenditure to materialise this much-awaited railway line.

* The extension of two metro lines of a total length of 12.8km on Mysuru Road up to Kengeri and on Kanakapura Road, up to Anjanapura township will be commissioned in 2020 after their completion, says Yediyurappa.

* Government sets aside Rs 1,500 crore for the Yettinahole project that Greens in DK district has consistently been opposing on grounds that it is detrimental to ecologically sensitive Western Ghats.

* CM BS Yediyurappa announces that University of Agricultural and Horticultural Sciences, Shivamogga will start functioning from its own campus soon.

* Shivamogga gets Rs 500 crore for the development of Jog Falls. It is one of the highest waterfalls in India.

* Hassan-Mangaluru Rail Development Corporation (HMRDC) to enhance the capacity of rail line in the ghat region between Sakaleshapura and Subramanya stations. This will not only enhance the speed of the commute between Bengaluru and Mangaluru but will also help to commence additional rail facilities: CM Yediyurappa

* CM BS Yediyurappa announces Rs 5 crore for the development of birthplace of Mysuru based writer SL Bhyrappa.

* 400 Urdu schools likely to get English -medium sections.

* 6% jump in excise duty on Indian Made Liquor (IML) in all 18 slabs.

* 276 Karnataka public schools to get Rs 100 crore for infrastructure development.

* The budget proposes to increase petrol price by Rs 1.60 per litre and diesel by Rs 1.59 per litre.

* The budget will promote affordable housing. Flat costing less than Rs 20 lakh is proposed to be reduced from existing 5 per cent to 2 per cent.

* To facilitate all govt departments to function in one building, twin towers building with 25 floors will be constructed at Anand Rao Circle, Bengaluru, with an expenditure of Rs 400 crores.

* The budget proposes Rs 25 crore for Vishwakarma Development Board and Rs 10 crore for Arya Vaishya Development Board.

Rs 9,000 crore allocated for farmers' welfare. Rs 10,000 annual aid for small farmers. Kisan credit card for farmers and fishermen: Yediyurappa

* Rs 200 crore aid for organic farming. New policy for fertilizer and seeds.

* Bhagya Lakshmi Scheme, bicycle scheme for children to continue, says Yediyurappa.

* New agricultural policy will be implemented. Horticulture sector will be considered as an industry: BS Yediyurappa

* Centre has reduced Rs 8,883 grants to state: Yediyurappa

* 6.45 lakh farmers have been provided compensation for flood relief, says CM BS Yediyurappa.

*This is Yediyurappa’s sixth budget as finance minister. He had presented two budgets as deputy CM holding the finance portfolio during the BJP-JD(S) coalition government between 2006 and 2007 and three as CM between 2008 and 2010.

*Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa present budget for the financial year 2020-21 in the state assembly.

Title: Kumkum Bhagya update, March 4: Ranbir flirts with a girl, Prachi gets jealous
Content: In the latest episode of Kumkum Bhagya Prachi asks Ranbir if he will stop speaking to her if he marries Maya. Ranbir assures Prachi that he will always be his friend. Prachi arrives at her house with Ranbir. Ranbir tells Pragya Shahana and Saritaji that he is stressed because Maya has also agreed to marry him. Ranbir says that Maya did not confess the truth and all their plans have failed.Saritaji starts giving her ideas as a solution to Ranbir’s problems. She tells Ranbir that if he gets married, Maya will not be able to marry him. Saritaji says that if a girl pretends that she is his wife, Maya and his dad will not ask him to marry Maya. Pragya asks who will be the girl to act as Ranbir’s wife, and Saritaji says she knows someone who can act.Alia gets a lawyer at Kohli house, and he asks them to delete the video of Ranbir and Maya from the engagement or else they might lose the case. Lawyer learns that Chaubeyji already has the video. Ranbir tells Alia that if Maya and her dad refuse for the wedding, then he shall be out of all the problems.Saritaji introduces a girl named Dimple Shah to Ranbir, Prachi, and Shahana. Saritaji says that she will act as Ranbir’s wife. Ranbir agrees to Saritaji, and says that Dimple can be the girl to act as his wife.Ranbir flirts with Dimple, and Prachi gets jealous. Prachi asks Ranbir to stay away from Dimple, and Ranbir tells Prachi, she looks cute when she is jealous.

Title: Sargun Mehta, Ammy Virk and Jagdeep Sidhu pose for perfect team ‘Qismat 2’ shoot
Content: A couple of days back, Sargun Mehta in her social media story revealed that the preparations of ‘Qismat 2’ have begun, as she and Ammy Virk went ahead with the photoshoot of the movie. Though the official poster is yet to be out, some pictures from the shoot have been shared by each Sargun Mehta, Ammy Virk and Jagdeep Sidhu . And those pics are giving a perfect shout out for ‘Qismat 2’.There’s one picture of the actors and director trio, that speaks of their friendship and their bond, and then there are series of photos of Sargun and Ammy goofing around. And each one of them is simply unmissable.While sharing the pictures, Ammy wrote - “❤️❤️❤️WAHEGURU 🙏🏻”Sargun Mehta also shared a couple of similar clicks and in the caption mentioned - “Bass🙏🙏🙏🙏” and tagged her costars, musicians, director and producer.Director Jagdeep Sidhu also tagged team ‘Qismat 2’ and while sharing the same pics wrote - “Kuchh describe karan di lod aa ??? ”Slated to be released on September 18th, ‘Qismat 2’ is one of the much anticipated sequels of Pollywood. The movie stars Ammy Virk and Sargun Mehta in the lead, Tania in an important role and introduces Jaani.

Title: 'Pogaru' to release on April 24?
Content: Sandalwood's action Prince Dhruva Sarja-starrer ‘ Pogaru ’ went on the floors two years ago. Recently, the movie’s trailer was released and now, the team of the film has decided to delight fans by finalizing the date for its release.The makers have announced that the film will be released in April and as per our sources, the director Nanda Kishore and producer BK Gangadhar have decided to release the movie on April 24. This news has created frenzy among fans.The team of ‘Pogaru’ is currently busy with the last stage of shooting, and is also busy with post-production works simultaneously. The team is planning to announce the release date after the film gets its censor certificate. The shooting for two major songs from the film is still pending, and the team recently moved to Chennai for the filming. The audio will be released on March 10.Chandan Shetty has composed music for ‘Pogaru’, and V Harikrishna has done the background score. There are huge expectations from the songs of the film as well. Actress Rashmika Mandanna is pairing up with Dhruva Sarja in the movie and Dhananjay, Raghavendra Rajkumar, P Ravi Shankar, Sadhu Kokila, Mirnalini Ravi, Kuri Prathap, Chikkanna and others will be seen in supporting roles.

Title: Vidya Balan starts shooting for Amit Masurkar's next in the jungles of Madhya Pradesh
Content: After Jagan Shakti ’s 2019 multi-starrer, 'Mission Mangal', Vidya Balan kicked off her next, 'Sherni', on Wednesday, March 4, in 'Bhoot Palasi' in Madhya Pradesh. Directed by Newton director Amit Masurkar , the film features the actress as a forest officer. “I loved Newton and when Amit narrated Sherni to me, I knew I wanted to do this film. The uniqueness of the story and its world appealed to me,” informs the National Award-winning actress. According to a source close to the production, the drama has strong humorous undertones with Vidya’s character, along with a team of dedicated officers and forest guards, trying to find a solution to the man-animal conflict depicted in the film, while tracing her own journey. “Most of the film will be shot in the dense forests of 'Bhoot Palasi' and 'Balaghat', along with other locations in the state,” informs the source. The film, produced by Bhushan Kumar Vikram Malhotra and Amit, rolled on March 2 and will be shot in a start-to-finish schedule. It is expected to wrap up by April-end and also features Vijay Raaz, Sharat Saxena and Ila Arun. Newton (2017) bagged the National Award for Best Feature Film in Hindi and was India’s entry to the Best Foreign Language Film category at the Oscars. It centred on a government clerk, played by Rajkummar Rao , who is on election duty in a conflict-ridden jungle of Central India. “The story of Sherni is one that needs to be told. I am happy to be working with Vidya Balan, one of the finest actors and human beings in the industry,” Amit asserts.

Title: When Rajya Sabha polls are due, 'fever' to destabilise state govts rises: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad
Content:
NEW DELHI: The "fever" to destabilise a state government rises when Rajya Sabha elections are due, the Congress said on Thursday, accusing the BJP of abducting 14 of its MLAs in Madhya Pradesh .

Three Rajya Sabha seats are falling vacant in the state and they are currently held by Digvijaya Singh (Congress), Satyanarayan Jatiya and Prabhat Jha (both from BJP).

"Ever since the BJP has come to power at the national level, the democracy of the country is being finished in every state one by one. It started with Arunachal Pradesh," senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad told a press conference.

The BJP's policy has always been to ensure that states do not get any government except that of the party, he said.

"Where ever other parties have made governments, their (BJP's) aim has been to destabilise them. This fever to destabilise state governments rises when the Rajya Sabha elections are due," Azad said.

The efforts in Madhya Pradesh to break the government is not new, "we condemn it, we will raise it in Parliament", he said.

"We have never done politics of this kind where we scare and intimidate people to join us," he said.

Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala alleged that the BJP "abducted 14 MLAs".

"Eleven mafias have been identified and are being reigned in by the Congress. They had been active for 15 years. Vyapam scam was unravelling. So this is a conspiracy to bring the Madjya Pradesh government down," he said.

"Who paid for the charter plane to abduct the MLAs? Who paid for the five star hotels?," Surjewala asked.

Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said, "Sinister design of BJP in breaking state governments, they have hatched a plan to dig the grave of democracy in the country."

"By doing this heinous activity they want to destabilise the Congress regime. They are putting pressure on Congress leaders in Madhya Pradesh by adopting a carrot and stick policy," he said.

Chowdhury urged all opposition parties to unite against the "authoritarian" government.
