Title: 55 who visited China are coronavirus-free, says Himanta Biswa Sarma
Content: GUWAHATI: Assam health minister Himanta Biswa Sarma told the legislative assembly on Wednesday that all 55 persons who returned to the state from China were quarantined for observation and none of them tested positive for the Covid-19 virus. "There is no case of coronavirus in Assam. We have screened everyone but none has tested positive so far," Sarma saidIn a written reply to a question, Sarma said, "A total of 55 suspected persons who came from China were observed from January 15 last. Out of the 55 persons, 46 have completed their observation period. The remaining are under observation in home quarantine for the incubation period. Till now, two persons have been admitted at an isolation ward of Guwahati Medical College and Hospital with mild symptoms. The samples have been collected and tested and the result is negative."He added, "The Assam government is undertaking all necessary precautions and preparations to prevent the outbreak of COVID-19 in Assam and to restrict the epidemic in case of positive cases in line with advisories issued by the government of India and in consultation with the local offices of World Health organisation, UNICEF and other international organisations."The minister said deputy commissioners of all districts, principals of all government medical colleges and the joint director of health services of all the districts are being sensitised on actions they must take in case there is an outbreak. "Panchayat and rural development department and the education department have been advised to undertake information, education and communication activities for which 73 gram sabha meetings have been held in the bordering districts so far," Himanta added.He informed the legislators that medical team have been deployed at all airports in Assam and ambulances are kept on stand by. "The health department has also completed assessment of triple layer masks, personal protection equipment and N95 masks. Awareness announcements are being made at the airport at regular intervals and regular screening is being carried out at the Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International (LGBI) airport here," he added.Airport officials said that special focus is on passengers coming from Singapore.

Title: Video: Rani Chatterjee grooving to the Bollywood track 'Hauli Hauli Gidde' is the best thing on the internet today
Content:
Apart from this, Rani also has some interesting projects in the pipeline such as 'Chotki Thakurain', 'Kasam Durga Ki', 'Teri Meharbaniyan' and 'Herapheri'.







One of the popular faces of Bhojpuri cinema Rani Chatterjee is also equally famous on social media for posting her amazing pictures and videos on Instagram . She has several blockbuster movies and chartbuster tracks to her credit. And so, when the star recently posted a video of her shaking a leg to Ajay Devgn-Tabu-Rakul Preet Singh’s ‘Hauli Hauli’, fans couldn’t keep calm.Rani took to her Instagram handle to share a dance video of her wearing a pink dress. In the video, the actress can be seen grooving to the Bollywood track ' Hauli Hauli Gidde ' from Ajay Devgn , Tabu and Rakul Preet Singh 's 'De De Pyaar De'. The Punjabi track has been originally sung by Garry Sandhu On the work front, Rani will next be seen playing a police officer in the action-drama 'Lady Singham'. The film also stars Bollywood actor Shakti Kapoor and Ritesh Pandey in pivotal roles. The makers have not yet announced the release date.

Title: St. Josephs Convent: A grand homecoming for Miss Diva Supranational 2020, Aavriti Choudhary
Content:
Airport welcome at Jabalpur. Father Rajesh Choudhary was proud of her while mother Rita plants a peck on her cheek with love

Being treated to ghar ka khana with mother and nani

With her former prinipal of school Sr. Roslyn

Aavriti being felicitated by PIMR Director Dr. RK Sharma

Aavriti and her college friends

The winning moment

LIVA Miss Diva Supranational 2020 Aavriti Choudhary

'I look forward to representing India internationally'

Aavriti is going to represent India at Miss Supranational 2020 in Poland

Pics: Arpit Joshi

As soon as she stepped out of the airport at Jabalpur , LIVA Miss Diva Supranational 2020, Aavriti Choudhary was greeted by the cheer ‘Jabalpur ki shaan, Aavriti mahan’. Her family had been waiting eagerly for her arrival with garlands, bouquets and posters in hand. Her parents Rajesh Choudhary and Reeta Choudhary rushed to hug her. "I always had faith in her, as she was working very hard. We were present at the event, and despite having confidence in her win, the moment she was crowned was surreal," her mother said.After the warm welcome at the airport, Aavriti, who was born and brought up in Jabalpur proceeded home for some ‘ghar ka khana’ and to meet the rest of her family.The next day began at St Joseph’s Convent School, where she received a grand welcome. "My principal, Sr. Roslyn knew I was in the school band, so she ensured I was given a musical welcome from them," shares Aavriti.Dressed in a flowy white anarkali, she clicked selfies and pictures with the current students and teachers of the school. She also visited a Jain temple to seek blessings for her journey ahead. The day ended with a gala dinner with family and friends.As she had graduated from Prestige Institute of Management and Research ( PIMR ) Indore , Aavriti was welcomed by her alma mater on the third day. Director of the college Dr R K Sharma, who was proud of her win shared, "She was one of the most sincere students at college, and we had full faith in her hardwork. While our college was known for excelling in academics and sports, Aavriti has added a shining feather to our cap with this win."One of her professors, Dr Nidhi Sharma, who taught Aavriti during graduation added, "She was a meticulous student here, and would keep perfecting her craft until she gave her best even with presentations. I have seen her evolve from modelling in the college fashion show to making it to the top five. It has been a very proud moment for me to see her flourish." In Indore, she also caught up with her closest friends and roommates at their hangout spot and made a quick trip to the heritage monument Krishnapuri Chhatri with them.Speaking about the win, Aavriti says, "It is such an irony that on February 22, 2019 I tried out for the first pageant in my life and did not win, a year later on the same day, I was given the glittering crown of LIVA Miss Diva Supranational 2020!" She maintains that while modelling was not her first choice, she is happy that she went for this career and prepared sincerely for it. "Coming from a small city like Jabalpur, getting here was not easy. My elder sister Paridhi saw my genuine interest and pushed me towards getting the right training." She remembers being nervous about not appearing in the top picks on social media pages during the competition. "Every day I would work on self-affirmations that 'I’ve got this and I can make it'. I think all of that showed in my personality too and gave me confidence. Another thing that renewed my confidence was that all the girls in that pageant were in the same boat, and I was not the only one feeling so. All of us stood by each other and had a lot of fun moments together."In a month’s time, she is going to begin her training with experts for Miss Supranational 2020 in Poland, and she is looking forward to give her best there. "This was the first step. Now I’m looking forward to representing the country internationally and making India proud. I’m going to work on acquiring qualities that would set India apart amidst representatives of 80 countries. I’m going to remind myself every day, that my crown comes with a responsibility and every citizen will be rooting for me to win. That will certainly get me through," she concludes.

Title: Mumbai to have 26 of 138 fast-track courts for women’s safety
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: The state government will set up 138 fast-track courts across the state under the centrallysponsored national mission for safety of women, for time-bound disposal of pending cases of atrocities against women and cases registered under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences ( POCSO ) Act. As per official records, 30,000 cases of atrocities against women are pending in the state.

The law and judiciary department on Wednesday issued an official order for setting up 26 fasttrack courts in Mumbai and 112 across the state. Out of the 138 courts, 108 will deal with cases of atrocities against women, while the remaining 30 courts will deal with cases registered under POCSO Act.

Alarmed by prolonged delay in disposal of cases of atrocities against women and cases registered under POCSO Act, Supreme Court had on June 25, 2019, directed setting up of exclusive/designated special courts before March 3, 2020. “It’s a centrally-sponsored scheme, central government will bear 60% expenditure, while the state government will bear the remaining 40%. The state government has approved a proposal for providing Rs 100 crore for the project,’’ a senior official said.

The official said huge manpower will be required for setting up the courts. It has been proposed that for every court, there will be one judge and a staff of seven. “We will require a total of 1,104 persons, including 138 judges for these courts. We have approved a proposal for appointment of judges and subordinate staff on contract basis for one year,’’ he said.

As per the official order, while 26 courts will be set up in Mumbai, 18 in Thane, 16 in Pune, seven in Amravati and five in Nagpur, while one court under POCSO Act will be set up in each district. “All these courts have been set up for one year, we expect that all pending cases will be disposed of within the stipulated period,’’ he said.

Title: Ulfa releases Tinsukia man after 22 days
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

DIBRUGARH: After 22 days of captivity, banned militant outfit Ulfa (Independent) finally released Baikuntha Handique - a supervisor of a stone-crushing unit who was abducted from Jagun area of Tinsukia district on Wednesday.

According to police, Handique was released early on Wednesday near Lungri basti village in Arunachal Pradesh 's Changlang district. The village, being a remote one, police personnel had to trek many kilometres to rescue him. "He is in good health but seems a little disoriented. Though he spoke very little, he has confirmed that he was abducted by the Ulfa (I). He will be taken for a health check-up and we will initiate investigation as well," a police official said.

Handique, a resident of 9 Mile area of Jagun, is a supervisor in a stone-crushing unit owned by one Raju Khan of Digboi . On February 11, Handique had gone to visit a stone quarry at Wara area. It is from there that then his whereabouts remained unknown.

Enraged by the failure of the police to rescue the abducted person, hundreds of locals from Jagun had blocked NH-315 on February 20 for several hours demanding his immediate release. The protesters also made an appeal to Ulfa (I) commander in-chief Paresh Baruah to ensure his early release.

It is still unclear what made the insurgent outfit to release the employee but sources said that a certain amount of ransom was paid for his safe release.

Title: Over half a dozen Indian-Americans win Congressional primaries
Content: WASHINGTON: Over half a dozen Indian-Americans, including two incumbent Congressmen and two women, have won primaries for House of Representatives elections in November.In California, incumbents Dr Ami Bera and Ro Khanna registered an easy win in their respective seventh and 17th Congressional Districts. Both are from the Democratic party.Bera, the longest-serving Indian-American in the US House of Representatives, is seeking his fifth consecutive term.Khanna is seeking is third consecutive term. However, he would be challenged by Indian-American Ritesh Tandon from the Republican party. Tandon is supported by Indian-American groups opposed to Khanna.Tandon came a distant second in the primaries. As per California laws, top two contestants, irrespective of their party affiliations, have their names on the ballots of November elections."I am so grateful to everyone for our victory tonight. We are exceeding our 2018 totals, beating Ritesh Tandon who ran on Islamophobia and right wing nationalism in India. We are getting the most votes in the Bay Area! Silicon Valley rejects bigotry," Khanna said in a tweet.Republican Nisha Sharma won the primary from 11th Congressional District of California. She will challenge Democratic incumbent Mark DeSaulnier in the November elections.Democratic Rishi Kumar, seeking to challenge incumbent Anna G Eshoo from the same party, came a distant second with 15.9 per cent votes in the 18th Congressional District of California.Indian-American Manga Anantatmula sailed through the Republican primaries in the 11th Congressional District of Virginia. She would challenge the six-term Democratic Congressman Gerry Connolly.Priston Kulkarni scored a major primary win in the 22nd Congressional District of Texas."Thank you for your support! We couldn't have gotten here without your help and your support," he tweeted.

Title: SC to set up vacation bench during 7-day Holi break to hear urgent matters
Content:
NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Thursday said it will set up a vacation bench for the seven-day Holi break to hear urgent matters.

A bench headed by Chief Justice S A Bobde said it will not be on the day of Holi but during the week.

Till now, the apex court had a vacation bench during the summer break of nearly two months.

The CJI made the statement after a lawyer mentioned a case and sought urgent hearing.

Title: Turkish Airlines: Singapore sends Turkish Airlines flight back empty after coronavirus case
Content: SINGAPORE: A Turkish Airlines aircraft was flown back to Istanbul without any passengers on Thursday on orders from authorities in Singapore after a passenger who had arrived on the same plane on Tuesday tested positive for coronavirus Singapore's aviation regulator said that the three pilots and 11 other crew of flight TK54 that had arrived on Tuesday were on the return flight to Istanbul, where they would be placed in quarantine."The crew had come into close contact with a passenger on flight TK54 who subsequently tested positive for COVID-19 ," the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) said in a statement on Thursday."The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is in contact with the Turkish Embassy, which has confirmed that the crew will be quarantined upon arrival at Istanbul," CAAS said.Singapore's transport ministry said in a statement on its website that authorities had begun tracing passengers on flight TK54 that may have had contact with the infected person.The Straits Times newspaper said 200 passengers were affected. It issued a correction to an earlier report, cited by Reuters, that all of them had been tested for the coronavirus.Turkish Airlines did not respond immediately to a request for comment on the number of passengers on board.Singapore had 112 confirmed cases of coronavirus, which started in China, but a large majority of the patients in the city-state have recovered and been discharged from hospital.

Title: Trio with slain forest brigand 'Veerappan's pot' cheats businessman of Rs 8.5 lakh
Content: COIMBATORE: Three men who claimed to possess a pot used by the slain forest brigand Veerappan have cheated a businessman of 8.5 lakh near Anupoorpalayam in Tirupur ."The trio claimed that they had with them Veerappan's cooking pot which was later used by his family members and they had decided to sell it to a foreign company for a huge amount in 2012. The men sought 1 lakh as loan to complete certain procedures before the sale," said one of the complainants, E Rajprathap, 39, a resident of Anupoorpalayam. "Though I ignored their request, a friend persuaded me to lend the amount. Since I had high regard for the forest brigand, I gave them the amount. They borrowed a total of 8.5 lakhs in four instalments, said Rajprathap."Whenever I ask them to return the amount, they came out with vague reasons. Once they produced a certificate which was purportedly signed by the then RBI governor Raghuram Rajan and the then Union finance minister Arun Jaitley and said they were on the verge of sealing the deal. I believed them," he added.Rajprathap said the accused told him a month ago that the documents were on prime minister Narendra Modi's table."It is only after the Coimbatore police arrested one of the accused I realised that I was being cheated. I came to know that they had cheated close to 20 people using the same modus operandi," he explained.Rajprathap recently petitioned the office of police commissioner of Tirupur, who forwarded it to the Anupoorpalayam police station.

Title: 'Hilton to double presence in India in next 4 years'
Content:
Hilton India VP (development) Dhruv Hoon (File photo: Hilton)

NEW DELHI: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc is finally stepping on the gas in India where it currently has only 3,100 rooms across 19 properties. The American hospitality major will add 3,200 rooms in 17 new properties over the next four years.

While Hilton will be adding properties in some cities where it is already present like Jaipur, it will also venture into new markets like Hyderabad and Varanasi. There will be a greater focus on tier II cities in coming times, said Dhruv Hoon, Hilton India ’s VP-development.

“We will be almost doubling our presence in India in next four years, with 1,300 rooms in seven hotels going to open in the next 22 months. These are going to mainly management contracts and a few franchises,” said Hoon. The group plans to brings its top of the line Waldorf Astoria to India and is looking at Delhi, Mumbai or Goa as one of the possible locations. It is also looking at bringing our luxury brands ‘Curio Collection’ and Tapestry Collection’ to India, Hoon added.

Thanks to its small presence in India, Hilton is not facing the brunt of coronavirus’ negative impact on travel in the country. “Operationally speaking (on an overall level) all industries are affected by the coronavirus outbreak. We hope this passes soon. On development side, it is not impacting our plans for India as having new hotels is a long term program that happens over three to four years,” Hoon said.

“With our current development pipeline (signed deals), we continue to expand in Mumbai, Bengaluru, Pune, Goa and Jaipur. Further, we will enter new markets such as Hyderabad and Varanasi. We are keen to expand to other exciting resort markets such as Udaipur and Lonavala amongst others. Going forward, we expect more development activity in tier II markets,” Hoon said.

All upcoming Hilton hotels in India will be “digital key” compliant. This opens any door a guest will normally access with a key card like room, elevators and fitness centre. “Open the app, and when you are within a few feet of a door, simply push the button to unlock. To use the digital key, you have to request access by opting in through the Hilton Honors app first,” says the Hilton website.

Title: Ali Fazal and Richa Chadha now to get married in April
Content: It had recently emerged that Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are tying the knot in June/July after five years of dating. Now, we hear the actor-couple has moved the date ahead, to the third week of April. The registered wedding will be in Mumbai.A source privy to the development informs that Richa and Ali have already applied for the registration. “Both have prior work commitments which can’t be moved so they opted to change the wedding date. Richa had planned to complete all her work by March end or early April. But she just began work on a new project, while Ali has assignments scheduled for May and June,” a source close to the couple informed.While Richa will resume work on her new project and some patchwork on an upcoming film after the honeymoon, Ali has requested the makers of a currently underproduction film to wrap up work on his part by early April. “Ali is working extra hours every day to ensure he meets the deadline so that he and Richa have 10 days to prepare for the wedding,” the source shared.The wedding will be followed by receptions in Delhi and Mumbai. “Except the receptions, where all their relatives, friends and colleagues will be invited, most of the pre-wedding functions will be private affairs with only their inner circle in attendance,” added the source.

Title: Mumbai set to host IOC session in 2023
Content:
NEW DELHI: Mumbai is set to host the 2023 International Olympic Committee's session after the IOC Executive Board recommended the Indian city for the annual conference.

The EB decided to put Mumbai's candidature to a vote of the members after the IOC Evaluation Commission praised the quality of the facilities at the Jio World Centre, which is the potential venue for the meet.

The decision will be ratified at the 136th IOC session in Tokyo in July this year.

The Evaluation Commission had visited Mumbai in October last year to study the feasibility of hosting the Session in Mumbai.

"We have chosen India because it is the second most populous nation in the world, with a very young population and a huge potential for Olympic sport," IOC President Thomas Bach said.

"We want to encourage and support the National Olympic Committee of India and all the National Federations to promote and strengthen Olympic sport in the country," he added.

India had hosted an IOC session way back in 1983 in New Delhi.

"The year 2023 will be significant for India as it coincides with the 75th anniversary of Indian independence. Hosting the IOC Session in Mumbai would put the Olympic Movement at the heart of those celebrations," an IOC statement said.

Title: Old Varsova creek bridge to be shut for 7 hours today
Content:
The 49-year-old Gujarat-bound bridge was rehabilitated in May 2017. (File photo)

MUMBAI: The Gujarat-bound Varsova creek bridge at Ghodbunder junction will be shut for inspection for seven hours on Thursday. Vehicles will be restricted on the two-lane bridge from 10am to 5pm. The two-lane Mumbai bound bridge will be open for vehicles leaving the city.

The 49-year-old Gujarat-bound bridge was rehabilitated in May 2017. It will be inspected for further wear and tear.

The Mumbai-bound bridge was partially shut for a month for maintenance in November 2018.

Title: Docs visit Guwahati jail to enquire about Akhil Gogoi
Content:
GUWAHATI: A team of doctors visited the Guwahati Central Jail on Wednesday to take stock of the deteriorating health condition of jailed Krishak Mukti Sangram Samiti (KMSS) leader Akhil Gogoi, who was arrested while addressing an anti-CAA rally.

About 40 activists of KMSS and its allied organizations are likely to be grilled by the Crime Branch of Assam Police for their alleged involvement in the violence during anti- Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) protests in December last year.

On Wednesday, police grilled KMSS president Bhasco De Saikia, adviser Subrata Chakraborty and president of the Guwahati city committee of Satra Mukti Sangram Samiti (SMSS), Ashiq Ali. Apart from the three leaders, convener of Swaraj Asom and once a close associate of Akhil, Bhaben Handique, IIT-Guwahati research scholar Himalay Bora, Anusuchit Jati Yuba Chatra Parishad president Rubul Das and Raktim Thakuria of All Assam Publishers and Book Sellers' Association and some other top leaders of KMSS were also interrogated by the sleuths of the Crime Branch. They were later allowed to go home. All were summoned relating to the Crime Branch PS Case No 01/2019.

"The NIA court in Guwahati sought a reply from the Guwahati Central Jail authorities on his (Akhil's) health condition. Though the reply was furnished by the authorities, it came in the afternoon. So, we are expecting a judgment from the NIA court tomorrow," said KMSS joint general secretary Mukut Deka.

He added that the jail authorities also sought reports of Akhil's previous medical treatment from his wife on Wednesday and the same were sent to jail authorities immediately. "If the jail authorities are unable to provide Akhil proper treatment, KMSS is ready to bear the expenses for his treatment. Akhil must be admitted to hospital without further delay," said Deka.

Swaraj Asom convener Bhaben Handique said, "I was asked about my association with Akhil and how I came in touch with Arvind Kejriwal later as I was the founding joint coordinator of Aam Admi Party in Assam in 2013. I clearly said I believe in parliamentary democracy, while Akhil trusts street protests."

KMSS insiders said those questioned by the Crime Branch on Wednesday were summoned in connection with the large-scale vandalism and destruction of property in Guwahati and upper Assam soon after the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill (CAB) was passed in Parliament in December last year.

Title: Dhanush's character in 'Karnan' gets revealed thanks to new stills from the film
Content: Tiger Shroff, who is one of the most loved actors in Bollywood, has taken to social media by storm with his debut single ‘Unbelievable’. He has now taken to his Instagram handle to thank his fans as his song is placed in the 2nd position on the Billboard global charts.

Title: Shivaji Surathkal to be premiered in London
Content: After the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Forensic Medical Board ruled out the murder angle in Sushant Singh Rajput’s death report, an audio tape of Dr Sudhir Gupta has been leaked wherein he reportedly claims that the late actor was ‘murdered’. When ETimes reached out to Sushant Singh Rajput’s family lawyer Vikas Singh for his reaction on the same, he stated, “To be honest, I tweeted my stand yesterday but I would like to speak to him before I take a final call. He is not answering my phone, what if he changes his stand, one doesn’t know. I will wait till I can talk to him.”

Title: WATCH: Katy Perry announces she is pregnant with her first child with Orlando Bloom in ‘Never Worn White’ music video
Content:
omg so glad I don’t have to suck it in anymore — KATY PERRY (@katyperry) 1583387006000

or carry around a big purse lol — KATY PERRY (@katyperry) 1583387027000

Congratulations are in order for singer Katy Perry and fiancé Orlando Bloom , who are expecting their first child together.Katy made the happy announcement in the music video of her latest single ‘ Never Worn White ’. The singer debuted her baby bump at the end of the video that sees her cradling her bump in a sheer dress.Taking to social media, the star confirmed her pregnancy saying, “omg so glad I don’t have to suck it in anymore.”She went on to quip, “or carry around a big purse lol.”Bloom and Perry, who have been in a relationship for a while, got engaged in on Valentine's Day 2019. The couple was set to wed last December but decided to postpone their wedding.This will be the first child for the songstress and second child for actor Orlando Bloom. He shares a son Flynn Bloom with his supermodel ex-wife Miranda Kerr Orlando and Katy have never shied away from speaking about their desire to start a family together. Bloom said in a previous statement, "I really want to enjoy family and friends, my beautiful son, and have more kids. I want to make sure when I embark on that, it's with my heart full and very clear about the reality of what that means, as opposed to some romantic idea of that it means to be in a relationship."

Title: Prothoma Kadombini’s promo talks about period-shaming
Content: Bengali television has been showing many new concepts- be it shows featuring female protagonists stepping outside the kitchen or women entering the workplace. Not only that, concepts like the struggle of a transgender mom or a female protagonist starting afresh in life breaking the taboo of a divorcee woman can also be seen on Bengali TV.Not to forget the dialogues which have reportedly become quite ‘bold’ talking about live-in relationship and other topics, which was a strict ‘NO’ on Bengali television even until a few days ago though Bengali films were never hesitant to talk about several topics which are considered as taboo.Adding to the list, the second promo of ‘Prothoma Kadombini ’ talks about menstruation and the taboo around it. The first promo featuring Solanki Roy as Dr. Kadambini Ganguly , the first female medical practitioner in the British-ruled era, drew much attention.The video starts with little Kadombini whose dad tells her, nothing is more important to a doctor than a patient. In the second part of the same promo, Kadombini is all grown up and she reaches the home of a patient. But she faces the first hurdle as the ladies deny allowing her inside crossing the puja room without the assurance that she isn’t menstruating. What comes hard-hitting is that the ladies of that particular household ask her to strip in order to prove that she isn’t menstruating. For a moment, Kadombini hesitates but she recalls how her dad once explained that a patient should be her highest priority. Following the demand of the ladies, Kadombini decides to satisfy their curiosity.Here's the promo:The promo tried to underline the similarity between the then era when the society was more conservative and now in 2020 when a recent incident of period-shaming took was reported in Gujarat Recently, in an incident female students of a hostel were allegedly taken to the restroom and forced to show their undergarments to prove that they aren’t menstruating. Later, the girls told the media that such humiliations are a part of their daily life. The college authority faced stiff criticism from all concerns of the society.

Title: Narendra Modi: Saamna roasts PM Modi for social media ‘drama’
Content:
MUMBAI: Saamna on Wednesday flayed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his “shortlived suspense drama” on giving up his social networking media. Stating that Ratan Tata has been using social media for “positive” results, Saamna advised the PM to take a leaf out of the noted industrialist’s book.

A day after Modi’s tweet hinting at the possibility of discontinuing his social media accounts, Saamna, in an editorial, said the PM had played the clever game of administering a shock to countrymen.

This is Saamna’s first onslaught on Modi after chief minister Uddhav Thackeray ’s recent meeting with the Prime Minister in New Delhi. Thackeray held talks with the PM for over an hour, triggering speculation that the Sena, which heads a tripartite alliance with the NCP and the Congress in Maharashtra, may be keen on inching closer to the BJP, its former power ally in the state.

“Social media is the heart of the BJP...They used the Goebbels’s technique, and the Congress party vanished from the political scene,” said the Shiv Sena mouthpiece, stating Modi’s talk of giving up his social networking account was a carefully planned strategic move. “When enough dramatic effect had been created, Modi administered the last shock by saying his accounts on Twitter, Facebook , Instagram and YouTube would be handled by women who inspire us on Women’s Day on March 8.”

Pooh-poohing Modi’s earlier announcement that he was contemplating giving up his social media account, Saamna said this was akin to the capitalist US adopting the policies of Communist China. “Five and a half crore people follow Modi on Twitter. Modi’s Facebook reaches out to five crore people. Modi has access to people through Instagram and YouTube. How can Modi take a decision to give up all this?” asked Saamna.

However, the saffron morninger warned that social media had its limitations. “It is certainly not a social indicator. The BJP’s cyber generals lost the Jharkhand assembly election. The party had to suffer defeat in the New Delhi polls notwithstanding the key role played by its cyber army,” recalled Saamna. Social media is the BJP’s oxygen and it seems impossible Modi would give it up, it said.

Title: Shillong limps back to normalcy
Content:
The Secondary School Leaving Certificate examinations for Class X students started on a peaceful note.

SHILLONG: Curfew was relaxed for longer hours in some areas of the Meghalaya capital on Tuesday following improvement in law and order, a top police official said on Wednesday.

"As no reports of any fresh violence came in from across the state, the curfew was relaxed for 4 hours in the Police Bazaar and Anjali Cinema areas. Night curfew was relaxed at 6 am all over Shillong city on Wednesday, except Police Bazaar and Anjali Cinema areas, where it was relaxed for four hours," the official added. He further informed that the Secondary School Leaving Certificate examinations for Class X students started on a peaceful note. "Over 51,034 students are appearing for the examination. In order to ensure peaceful examinations, the state government has deployed extra security in and around the exam centres," he added.

Business establishments in both Police Bazaar and Iewduh markets opened on Wednesday after remaining shut for five days. As curfew was relaxed for longer hours, residents of the city were seen shopping. A large number of vehicles plied on the city roads and the national highways.

However, the district magistrate of East Khasi Hills District re-imposed pre-emptive curfew in Shillong and its adjoining from 9 pm on Wednesday to 6 am on Thursday. Curfew was also re-imposed in Sohra (Cherrapunjee) and Shella areas from 6 pm on Wednesday to 8 am on Thursday.

Mobile internet ban was lifted in two Jaintia Hills districts after improvement in the situation, officials said. Mobile internet and messaging services were withdrawn in six districts of the Khasi and Jaintia Hills region following clashes between tribal and non-tribal groups which has claimed three lives.

Law and order in the city was hit in the aftermath of the death of a Khasi Students' Union (KSU) activist, identified as Lurshai Hynniewta, at Icchamati in East Khasi Hills district last Friday. He was attacked by a mob during an anti-CAA and pro-ILP rally organized by the students' union.

Title: Thiruvananthapuram: Opposition walkout over gold tax
Content:
File photo of Ramesh Chenithalai

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The opposition UDF staged a walkout in the assembly on Wednesday, alleging laxity on the part of state's GST department in collecting tax on gold, 'which has cost the state exchequer a huge GST income of Rs 2,700 crore in 2019-20'. The UDF also alleged that an 'underworld' in gold business was thriving in Kerala due to inefficiency and lethargy of the state GST officials.

"The state finance minister is making lame excuses and putting the blame on GST council instead of reforming the department under the GST regime," said opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala before staging the walkout after speaker P Sreeramakrishnan denied leave for an adjournment motion on the issue.

The speaker rejected the notice for the motion issued by senior Congress leader V D Satheesan, based on the clarification given by finance minister T M Thomas Isaac, who said the matter could be discussed elaborately on March 10, when the House will discuss on demands for grants in the budget for the GST department. "The department is not remaining a mere spectator as being alleged, but is carrying out inspections in shops, and the government might take stricter measures like deploying officials at shops during business hours," he said.

Raising the issue, Satheesan pointed out that the state's tax revenue from gold market in 2017 under VAT regime was Rs 750 crore, though the VAT was 1.25% under a compounding system. "The tax on gold increased to 3% under GST and the state was to receive Rs 1,800 crore in 2018-19. But we received only Rs 200 crore," he pointed out.

Title: Salman Khan advises fans to stick to ‘namaste’ and ‘salaam’ as Coronavirus hits India

Title: Bibriti to play a mermaid in her next
Content: After the 2018 film ‘Byomkesh Gowtro’, Bibriti Chatterjee is all set to play the lead in Tathagata Mukherjee ’s next ‘ Bhotbhoti ’ while Rishab Basu plays the male lead. “After audition I bagged this role and I am happy to play the lead. I play Ariel, a mermaid and Bhootbooti (Rishab) is in love with her. The film is a love story between fire and water. I watched Tathagata da’s Water bottle and liked it. What I loved about him is that he is very clear about what he wants from his cast. The way he narrates the story is amazing. I could literally see Ariel in front of my eyes. We all have grown up reading stories on mermaid and when you actually get a chance to play one it seems surreal,” said the model turned actor.In Byomkesh Gowtro Bibriti had played Meera, one of the love interests of Satyakam (Arjun Chakraborty). “In Byomkesh Gowtro I played one of the characters. It was a film with ensemble cast. But in this film, the story revolves around my character and Bhotbhoti. I am really looking forward to this fairy tale of water and fire. While water signifies life, fire carries knowledge so both these two aspects get interpreted in this film,” added Bibriti.The film is about what happens when Bhotbhoti a young boy comes across a mermaid in reality. The film has two sides- one is fantasy and the other side is the reality and how at the end of the film the two get merged is to be seen.It’s a love story also starring Mamata Shankar, Rajatava Dutta Debleena Dutt Mukherjee , Lama Halder and others. The story is penned by the director while music of the film is composed by Mayookh Bhaumik.

Title: Manipur defers ADC polls in 6 dists
Content:
IMPHAL: The state cabinet has resolved to defer the coming Autonomous District Council (ADC) elections in the six hill districts of the state.

Though Manipur has 10 hill districts of which five were newly created, the ADC polls will be held in six districts - Churachandpur, Sadar Hills, Ukhrul, Tamenglong, Senapati and Chandel.

Chaired by chief minister N Biren Singh , the cabinet convened at his office secretariat on Tuesday evening decided to defer the after deliberating on certain proposals raised by the Hill Areas Committee (HAC). According to the Manipur (Hill Areas) District Councils Act, 1971, the ADC election can be deferred for six months, sources said.

The last ADC polls were held on June 1, 2015. Going by the schedule, the election is supposed to be held before June this year.

Sources said an HAC meeting convened on January 16 resolved to hold the ADC polls under a party-less system. Taking into account the monsoon period of June-July during which the ADC polls are usually held, the HAC meeting decided to conduct the polls in the dry season, possibly in November, the sources added.

The cabinet also approved appointment of 62 posts in the Manipur high court and 64 posts in the juvenile justice board under Manipur social welfare department.

Title: MVA govt reviews Shivaji memorial bid process, says audit flagged irregularities
Content: MUMBAI: The MVA government is reviewing the tender process for the Shivaji memorial project following complaints of irregularities , PWD minister Ashok Chavan told the legislative council on Wednesday. The government is already reviewing several projects and schemes started by the previous BJP-Sena government.The work on the mid-sea project was stopped by the SC in January 2019.Chavan said the CAG has flagged many irregularities in the way the contract was allotted. “Some serious irregularities have been pointed out, like the scope of work was changed after tender was allotted and in the name of cost optimization, several project elements were changed. This did not allow a fair ground for other bidders,” he said while replying on a question by the Congress MLC Hemant Takle .After an audit in April-May 2019, the CAG, in its report, pulled up the PWD for giving 'undue favour to the project management consultant' for non-inclusion of penalty clause in the contract.When MLC Vinayak Mete , who headed the steering committee on the project till recently, asked if fresh bids will be invited, Chavan said, “We are studying the issue. I am not calling it a scam as yet. We will decide what has to be done next.” The minister said they want to go ahead with the project, but will first study what happened in the last five years.Chavan also said that Mete had written to the government in 2019 saying key decisions were taken without his knowledge. “We have not released any money to the contractor, so things are still under control,” he added.

Title: Tamil Nadu: DMK, AIADMK cadres clash over panchayat polls
Content:
Representative image

MADURAI: Chaos reigned in several places in the state over elections to the posts of chairman and vice-chairman of panchayat unions.

In Theni district, tension prevailed after an AIADMK candidate was elected to the post of chairman of the Kadamalaikundu panchayat union. In Sivaganga district, indirect elections to the post of panchayat union chairman of Thirupuvanam was called off again on Wednesday due to lack of quorum. This is the third time the election to this is being cancelled. Tension prevailed at the T N Palayam panchayat union office in Erode district since morning after the district administration conducted a 'shadow' election to elect the chairman and vice-chairman for the union.

The Kadamalaikundu panchayat union has 14 wards, and the DMK and the AIADMK won seven seats each in the local rural body elections in January. Elections to the posts of chairman and vice-chairman of the union had been postponed twice.

Tamilselvan of the DMK, who contested the post of councillor for the eighth ward in this panchayat union, joined the AIADMK recently, following which the AIADMK's strength council went up to eight.

On Wednesday, tension prevailed as the eight AIADMK councillors and the six from the DMK came to the panchayat union office. The DMK councillors went over to the other side and tried to pull Tamilselvan to their side. Police personnel rushed in and brought order. Chandra, the councillor of ward number one, was elected chairman of the panchayat union.

Meanwhile, Nivedha Annadurai of the DMK was elected chairperson of the Chinnamanur panchayat union in the district.

In Sivaganga district, there are 12 panchayat unions, and indirect elections were held for the post of chairman and vice-chairman of 11 of these on January 11. Collector J Jayakanthan cancelled the election in Thirupuvanam citing the law and order situation. Thirupuvanam panchayat union has 17 councillors. In the elections, the DMK secured 10 posts, the AIADMK five, and two independents also won.

Title: Arunachal Pradesh: IAS officer suspended over exam irregularities
Content:
ITANGAR: The Arunachal Pradesh government has suspended former secretary and controller of examinations of the Arunachal Pradesh Staff Selection Board (APSSB) S K Jain for alleged administrative negligence.

Jain's suspension came after the APSSB announced the cancellation of its lower division clerk (LDC) and junior secretariat assistant (JSA) examinations over the recent 'cash for jobs' fiasco. Jain, a 2007-batch IAS officer, who was also the secretary of the state's land management, urban development and town planning departments, was suspended on Tuesday.

Title: Lok Sabha adjourns till noon amid protests over Delhi violence
Content:
NEW DELHI: Lok Sabha was adjourned on Thursday till noon as vociferous protests and sloganeering by Opposition parties over the Delhi violence disrupted proceedings for the fourth straight day.

Amid din, three questions were taken up during the Question Hour .

For the second day, Speaker Om Birla was not present in the House and the proceedings were presided over by BJD leader B Mahtab.

Around 30 members, mostly from the Congress, were in the Well of the House shouting slogans and displaying placards, demanding resignation of Home Minister Amit Shah over the Delhi violence.

Mahtab repeatedly said disruptions would serve no purpose. If the government and the opposition sit down and settle differences, then issues such as Delhi violence and coronavirus can be discussed in the House, he added.

Mahtba also said that the Speaker was disturbed by the happenings in the House, due to which he decided not to preside over the proceedings.

If the government and the opposition sit down and settle differences, then issues such as Delhi violence and coronavirus can be discussed in the House, he added.Mahtba also said that the Speaker was disturbed by the happenings in the House, due to which he decided not to preside over the proceedings.

Title: Harika stuns world champion Ju Wenjun in FIDE Women's GP
Content:
Dronavalli Harika. (Getty Images)

LAUSANNE: Indian Grandmaster Dronavalli Harika stunned world champion Ju Wenjun in the third round to grab a share of the top spot in the FIDE Women's Grand Prix chess tournament here.

Harika, the world No.9, has two points after three rounds along with four others.

The Indian outlasted the 29-year old Chinese player, ranked No.3 in the world, in 54 moves with white pieces late on Wednesday.

The others on two points include Russians Alina Kashlinskaya and Alexandra Goryachkina, Anna Muzychuk of Ukraine and Georgia's Nana Dzagnidze .

Three of the six games on the day were decisive ones with Kashlinskaya and Muzychuk registering wins.

Kashlinskaya defeated former world champion Alexandra Kosteniuk while Anna Muzychuk got the better of Frrance's Marie Sebag in 38 moves.

The 29-year old Harika faces Dzagnidze in the fourth round later on Thursday.

The strong tournament featuring 12 players, including world champion Wenjun, is the third in the series of four Grand Prix from which two with the highest points would qualify for the next candidates event.

Results: Round 3: Dronavalli Harika (IND) 2 beat Ju Wenjun (CHN) 1; Anna Muzychuk (UKR) 2 beat Marie Sebag (FRA) 1; Alexandra Goryachkina (RUS) 2 drew Zhansaya Abdumalik (KAZ) 1; Alexandra Kosteniuk (RUS) 0.5 lost to Alina Kashlinskaya (RUS) 1; Antoneta Stefanova (BUL) 1.5 drew with Nana Dzagnidze (GEO) 2; Mariya Muzychuk (UKR) 1.5 drew with Pia Cramling (SWE) 1.5.

Title: Will hear pleas on CAA after arguments in Sabarimala related matter are over: SC
Content:
NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Thursday said it will hear pleas challenging the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) after arguments in the Sabarimala matter are over. A bench headed by Chief Justice S A Bobde said this after senior advocate Kapil Sibal sought urgent hearing of CAA matters and said that till date, the Centre has not filed a reply in the matter.

Attorney General K K Venugopal told the bench also comprising justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant that the Centre would be filing a reply in a few days.

A nine-judge bench is re-examining various religious issues, including the entry of women into the Sabarimala temple and mosques, and the practice of female genital mutilation in the Dawoodi Bohra community.

Title: students and celebs: Celebs stress on taking a chill pill this exam season
Content:
It’s the exam season , again! One thing that hasn’t changed with years, especially for Class 10 students , is the famous comment, ‘The board exams will shape your future.’ The pressure and expectations on them is boundless. But as they gear up to give the exams, here’s what a few celebs, who haven’t followed the conventional path of education but have emerged successful, tell us:

What matters is whether they have given their best: Poornima Indrajith , fashion designer - actor

During my boards, I only faced pressure from my teachers and family.

But, today’s children need to put up with a lot more, from the virtual world, tuition centres and more. At the same time, today’s education system has its merits too. For instance, in CBSE, students are allowed to study basic mathematics if they aren’t planning to study the subject in Class 11 and 12. This lowers the pressure. But, there are also those who aren’t privileged with these options. I think when kids understand this, that too would make a difference. Also, until you face the exams, you would be constantly stressed out.

What’s going to matter in the future is how they handle life’s situations and the understanding that fear and courage go hand in hand. It also matters whether they have given their best. If the result isn’t great even after that, it’s not something they should take the blame for as it was beyond their control.

Board exam should be given like any other exams in school: Gopi Sunder, composer

Often, parents inflate the importance of Class 10 exams, from the time they are first graders and are told pathaam class jayikkanam. This would scare them, well in advance. They don’t try enough to find children’s talents. Many things, like the kind of mathematics you learn in school, is not even applied in real life.

My own life is an example of how you can be successful if you do things that make you happy. When I didn’t complete my Class 10, I was only worried about my parents. But, I started off my career at the age of 16, which is much earlier than my peers, which helped me reach where I am now.

I would say one must look at the Class 10 exam like any other examination, say, a Class 9 exam. One must also nurture what a child is interested in and show them the way.

Everyone will discover their inherent ability, growing up: Anees Salim, writer

I stopped studying after Class 11. Looking back, I consider it my best decision.

However, I don’t want it to influence anyone, including my own son. The road to getting my works published wasn’t easy. I wanted to write in English, but my education was in Malayalam medium.

t was a risk, considering that I was just beginning to explore the world of books. It was a brave decision, and it could have gone either way.

I won’t advice anyone to stop education to be something. As for today’s pressure, I tell my son to relax, do what he can and not compare himself to anyone. I’m sure everyone has an inherent ability and as you grow, one might discover that. That’s what I want to tell everyone. I would also like to tell the parents that the biggest let down children can experience is comparing them to others.

Children should study for themselves: Nisha Sarang, actor

Back in our times, we did not face this much pressure, though parents were concerned back then too. I was staying in my paternal house, when I was in Class 10, and because of that I was never put through tense situations. Even after my exams, I never felt or regretted that I should have studied more, as a majority of the excellent students are now confined to being housewives. That said, if an adult is well educated, he or she could transfer the knowledge to their children. Parents should love their children and give them the needed facilities, while at the same time make them aware of the difficulties one is in, as a family. They must be taught about their family atmosphere, but not pressurize them. Personally, I have never gone behind my children saying, ‘Padik padik’. As long as they have a goal, and you keep thinking about it and working towards the same, you will study. Study for you own selves, not for your parents or anybody. When you keep comparing yourselves to others, what you get won’t be the right one. Rather than going on a curvy lane, focus on the straight path, and you will get what you have to.

Title: Cong moves speaker against E P Jayarajan
Content:
File photo of P Sreeramakrishnan

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Congress has lodged a complaint with speaker P Sreeramakrishnan against the remarks made by industry minister E P Jayarajan in the assembly on Tuesday.

Congress deputy leader in the house K C Joseph in his complaint said that the industry minister used "unparliamentary words" against Congress member Shafi Parambil. "While the chief minister was making a speech in the assembly, the industry minister made certain adverse remarks against the Congress member which is against the code of conduct that has to be followed by a member in the assembly," said Joseph.

He also condemned the behaviour of the speaker and said, "It was most unfortunate that the speaker did not make any comment on this or condemn the behaviour of the minister in the House." The remarks by E P Jayarajan was heard by all the members in the House through the microphone and it had even come in several of the online and social media. Hence, the speaker should make a ruling on this and appropriate action should be taken against the industry minister, he said in a letter given to the speaker.

Title: Surabhi Lakshmi: You cannot miss THIS throwback picture of Surabhi Lakshmi
Content: Be it her choice of movies or her performance, Mollywood actress Surabhi Lakshmi is one of the few showbiz personalities who stand out in a crowd. Also one of the most sought after artists in the industry, she has won the National Award for the best actress for her performance in ‘ Minnaminungu ’. Surabhi Lakshmi is an avid social media user and she values her fans a lot. And hence keeps them updated with her whereabouts. Recently the talented diva shared a throwback picture of herself from her 20s. Surabhi’s youthful photo came as a surprise for her fans and they are praising the beauty. Surabhi has also shared a pencil-drawn version of the same picture, which one of her fans presented to her. The passport size picture is doing the rounds on social media and you must not miss this picture.Surabhi Lakshmi rose to fame with her performance in the 2005 release ' Thirakkatha '. She essayed Valarmathi, a help and personal assistant of Malavika in the movie. The Ranjith directorial was one of the most critically acclaimed movies and the actors received huge acceptance for the respective parts they played. Her performance in ' Ennu Ninte Moideen ' also earned her a lot of fame. Surabhi was last seen in Vikruthi, giving a notable performance. Surabhi is into modeling these days and the gorgeous diva has been sharing bewitching her social media followers with some stunning pictures.

Title: Santhosh Prathap in Arya's next
Content:
Thank you for always being my biggest support, You are a great inspiration @arya_offl brother.. Let’s rock @beemji… https://t.co/RUEK9QFgsV — Act Santhosh Prathap (@Actorsanthosh) 1583375492000

Actor Santhosh Pathap, who made his film debut with Parthiban's Kathai Thiraikathai Vasanam Iyakkam, is part of Pa Ranjith 's next with Arya . The title for the film is speculated to be Salpetta . Santhosh took to his social media page to share a workout video in which is seen preparing for the film.He had posted, "Thank you for always being my biggest support,You are a great inspiration @arya_offl brother..Let’s rock @beemji anna 💪🏼You are the best..#paranjithfilm #arya30 #prelook #preplook @Music_Santhosh."Arya, too, showered praises on the latter for the hard work he put in for the film. He posted, "U r awesome bro 😎Amazing Workouts and preparation u have done 👍👍💪 "The film is said to be based on kickboxing and is set in North Chennai. Music for the film is by Santhosh Narayanan and cinematography by Murali G. Santhosh Prathap was recently seen in Ashok Selvan’s Oh My Kadavule.

He is not answering my phone, what if he changes his stand, one doesn’t know. I will wait till I can talk to him.”

Title: Rajesh Tope: Greet with namaste, not handshake, says Maharashtra minister Rajesh Tope
Content: MUMBAI: While pointing out that Maharashtra has not reported a single confirmed Covid-19 case so far, state health minister Rajesh Tope said it may be a good idea to revert to the traditional way of greeting with a namaste with folded hands, instead of a handhsake.“Since the virus is airborne and can spread through contact, maybe going back to traditional greetings like ‘Ram-Ram’ and ‘Namaste’ are a better idea,” Tope said on Wednesday, while responding to a discussion in the state council on the coronavirus threat.The government also plans to use prime-time TV shows and cinema halls to spread awareness about Covid-19. “Jingles and video messages will also be put out soon,” Tope said.Stressing that the state government has adequate supplies of preventive masks, he said that washing hands was a much better preventive measure. He advised people to use clean handkerchiefs, following reports of non-availability of masks and allegations of hoarding which has led to spiralling of the cost in some cities.Tope said 551 international flights landing in Maharashtra had been checked with 65,000 people undergoing thermal scanning, and 676 passengers had been screened from ships entering the ports.“The fatality rate of this ailment is 2.5%-3%, so there is no need to panic,” the minister said, adding that six people have been quarantined in Mumbai and Pune for possible infection.He said quarantine facilities are available at Kasturba and Rajawadi hospitals, while Bhabha hospitals in Bandra and Kurla, and Balasaheb Thackeray trauma care facility have been identified for setting up isolation facilities. “We have also asked each district to make provisions for a trauma care facility,” he said.The additional director general of cybercrime has also been instructed to book those found spreading fake news about coronavirus on social media, Tope added.(With agency inputs)

Title: Did you know Soumitra Chatterjee had turned down 1971 hit ‘Anand’?
Content: He is no doubt Bengali cinema’s living legend and one of the most accomplished Indian actors. Stretching a six-decade-long career, Soumitra Chatterjee still remains a leading stage and film actor, working with almost every renowned director. Sadly, he never said yes to Bollywood. So, despite being one of our elite actors he is still largely unknown to a major portion of the Indian audience.But only a few people know Soumitra Chatterjee once turned down offers from as many as three Hindi films from renowned directors which eventually became big hits.The veteran actor went down the memory lane while reminiscing those days and said, “Hrishikesh Mukherjee in his 1971 film ‘ Anand ’ approached me to play the role of the famous character Dr. Bhaskar Banerjee. I had to say no because the shooting dates clashed with my commitments Bengali cinema, the But I have no such regrets for not accepting the role.”We all know Amitabh Bachchan played the doctor’s character in Rajesh Khanna starrer ‘Anand’ which turned out to be his first major hit.“The next film I refused was Shyam Benegal’s 1981 ‘Kalyug’ which is a modern-day take on Mahabharata. Kalyug was produced by Shashi Kapoor and he played Karan (Karna). Shashi offered me the character Dharam Raj (Yudhisthira) but I said no because I felt it’s not strong enough for my first Hindi film. Shashi and I were close friends and we always admired our professional decisions, so Shashi didn’t press me to do the role,” Soumitra added.The role of Dharam Raj was eventually offered to Raj Babbar.The veteran actor said the last one happened recently, “More recently, I turned down n offer from Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury’s ‘ Pink ’. I was offered a judge’s role but once again it didn’t have enough scope for acting.”The role of the judge was eventually played by Dhritiman Chatterjee. The 2016 Bollywood flick ‘Pink’, made at a budget of 23 crore, earned a staggering 107.32 crore in revenues winning widespread critical acclaim.

Title: Bizman abducted in Gandhinagar
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 43-year-old man, resident of Sector 25 of Gandhinagar , was allegedly abducted from his home on Wednesday evening by seven men brandishing knives and a pistol. Later, the abductors dumped him near his home and fled away in two cars.

An official of Sector 21 police said that Dharmendrasinh Raol, a resident of Suryanarayan Society in Sector-25, was walking in the front yard of his house at around 8am when seven men arrived in two SUVs.

The men got down in from of Raol's house and put a pistol to his neck. The others began abusing him and waving knives. They pushed him inside a car. Around three hours later, they dumped Raol near his house.

Some of the locals spotted Raol and took him to Civil Hospital , Gandhinagar.

Inspector Amarsinh Chauhan of Sector 21 police said that Raol, who was traumatized after the incident, could not speak much about the abduction and was unconscious.

"We have identified the vehicles and are trying to nab the abductors," said Chauhan.
